Macmillan|language=en|doi=10.1007/978-3-030-01545-9_8|isbn=9783030015442|access-date=|last2=Unah|first2=Isaac}}</ref><ref name=":9">{{Cite book|url=http://www.simonandschuster.com/books/American-Amnesia/Jacob-S-Hacker/9781451667837|title=American Amnesia|last=Hacker|first=Jacob|last2=Pierson|first2=Paul|date=|publisher=Simon and Schuster|year=2017|isbn=9781451667837|location=|pages=|language=en}}</ref><ref name=":4">{{Cite book|url=https://www.basicbooks.com/titles/thomas-e-mann/its-even-worse-than-it-looks/9780465096206/|title=It's Even Worse Than It Looks|last=Mann|first=Thomas|last2=Ornstein|first2=Norman|publisher=Basic Books|year=2016|isbn=|location=|pages=|language=en-US}}</ref><ref name=":7">{{Cite book|url=http://www.simonandschuster.com/books/The-Cynic/Alec-MacGillis/9781501112034|title=The Cynic|last=MacGillis|first=Alex|date=2014|publisher=Simon and Schuster|year=|isbn=9781501112034|location=|pages=|language=en}}</ref><ref name=":32">{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/03/17/us/politics/17mcconnell.html|title=McConnell Strategy Shuns Bipartisanship|last=Nagourney|first=[[Carl Hulse]] and Adam|access-date=October 5, 2018|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.politico.com/magazine/story/2013/11/get-mitch-mcconnell-99376.html|title=Get Mitch|last1=Zengerle|first1=Jason|date=November 2013|work=Politico|accessdate=August 20, 2014}}</ref> working to withhold Republican support for any major presidential initiatives. '''In October 2010, McConnell said that "the single most important thing we want to achieve is for President Obama to be a one-term president."''' Throughout Obama's tenure, Senate Republicans made frequent use of the filibuster; '''this meant that any bill needed a supermajority (60 votes rather than 50) to pass the Senate.''' Senate Republicans also blocked an unprecedented number of Obama's judicial nominees, including Supreme Court nominee [[Merrick Garland Supreme Court nomination|Merrick Garland]]; '''McConnell refused to hold a hearing on the Garland nomination. A number of political scientists and historians have characterized McConnell's obstructionism and "constitutional hardball" as contributors to democratic erosion in the United States.<ref name=":10">{{Cite web|url=http://www.hup.harvard.edu/catalog.php?isbn=9780674976825|title=The People vs. Democracy|last=Mounk|first=Yascha|date=|website=|publisher=Harvard University Press|language=|publication-date=2018|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite book|url=https://www.press.uchicago.edu/ucp/books/book/chicago/H/bo28381225.html|title=How to Save a Constitutional Democracy|last=Ginsburg|first=Tom|last2=Huq|first2=Aziz|publisher=University of Chicago Press|year=2019|isbn=|location=|pages=126}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.hup.harvard.edu/catalog.php?isbn=9780674046832|title=The Promise of Party in a Polarized Age|last=Muirhead|first=Russell|date=|website=|publisher=Harvard University Press|page=254|language=|access-date=}}</ref><ref name=":12">{{Cite news|url=https://columbialawreview.org/content/asymmetric-constitutional-hardball/|title=Asymmetric Constitutional Hardball|last=Fishkin|first=Joseph|date=2018|work=Columbia Law Review|access-date=|last2=Pozen|first2=David E.|language=en-US}}</ref><ref name=":22">{{Cite web|url=https://www.penguinrandomhouse.com/books/562246/how-democracies-die-by-steven-levitsky-and-daniel-ziblatt/9781524762933/|title=How Democracies Die|last=Levitsky|first=Steven|last2=Ziblatt|first2=Daniel|date=2018|website=|publisher=Penguin Randomhouse|language=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.nybooks.com/articles/2018/10/25/suffocation-of-democracy|title=The Suffocation of Democracy|last=Browning|first=Christopher R.|work=The New York Review of Books|access-date=October 6, 2018|language=en-US}}</ref><ref name=":9" />'''<ref name=":4" />

{{reflist-talk}}

Please indicate whether you '''support''' or '''oppose''' something similar to the above text, along with your reasoning. [[User:Snooganssnoogans|Snooganssnoogans]] ([[User talk:Snooganssnoogans|talk]]) 17:54, 5 January 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:African humid period#rfc_6FD2C39|Talk:African humid period]] expired 2019-02-05 17:01 ===
* Id: 6FD2C39
* User: Jo-Jo Eumerus
* Date: 2019-01-06 16:41:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|878773502|HIST 878773502}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|878773509|SCI 878773509}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|881916120|HIST 881916120}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|881916121|SCI 881916121}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
As {{U|Johnbod}} noted in [[Template:Did you know nominations/African humid period]], [[Neolithic Subpluvial]] appears to cover the same ground as this article ([https://scholar.google.ch/scholar?hl=de&as_sdt=0%2C5&q=%22neolithic+subpluvial%22%22african+humid+period%22&btnG= Some sources]), except that that article is much shorter and its title less commonly used in academic literature: [https://scholar.google.ch/scholar?hl=de&as_sdt=0%2C5&as_vis=1&q=%22neolithic+subpluvial%22&btnG= few hits for Neolithic Subpluvial], [https://scholar.google.ch/scholar?q=%22African+humid+period%22&hl=de&as_sdt=0&as_vis=1&oi=scholart far more African humid period hits]. Thus, I would recommend that [[Neolithic Subpluvial]] be redirected/merged into [[African humid period]]. [[User:Jo-Jo Eumerus|Jo-Jo Eumerus]] ([[User talk:Jo-Jo Eumerus|talk]], [[Special:CentralAuth/Jo-Jo Eumerus|contributions]]) 16:41, 6 January 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:User scripts#rfc_419A763|Wikipedia talk:User scripts]] expired 2019-02-06 10:01 ===
* Id: 419A763
* User: Flooded with them hundreds

{{rfcquote|text=
[[User:Lourdes/PageCuration.js]] and its documentation should move to a more accurate title. I tried [[Special:Permalink/881670618#User:Lourdes/PageCuration.js|talking]] to the script's creator but they appear to not want to do it. I believe the current title is very misleading because the script adds a shortcut link to the sidebar pointing to [[Special:NewPagesFeed]]. It does not, in any way, load up the PageCuration toolbar like anyone looking at the script for the first time would expect. I propose the script to be moved to another title, for example, [[User:Lourdes/NewPagesFeedShortcut.js]] to prevent confusion. Should it be moved? -- <span style="font-family: Courier">[[User talk:Flooded with them hundreds|<span style="background:#241e20;color:#42aaf4">'''Flooded''' w/</span><span style="background:#42aaf4;color:#241e20">them '''100s'''</span>]]</span> 14:27, 5 February 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Article titles#rfc_257F166|Wikipedia talk:Article titles]] expired 2019-02-07 00:02 ===
* Id: 257F166
* User: Dreamy Jazz/Archive 2#Michael Iver Peterson
* Date: 2019-01-07 23:52:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|877325055|BIO 877325055}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|877325061|STYLE 877325061}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|882124307|BIO 882124307}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|882124313|STYLE 882124313}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should those who have plead the [[Alford plea]] in a court of law have their articles parenthetically disambiguated with (criminal)? 

A bit of background: 

The [[Alford plea]] is a plea in the court of law, which means the defendant pleaded "guilty" to save themselves from worse punishment. This plea is mostly plead in murder or manslaughter cases where. The evidence against them is so convincing, that the court would find them guilty (and the judge does not dismiss the trial) and if they pleaded "not guilty" they may face punishment such as the death penalty, so scared them into pleading guilty for a lesser sentence.

Take the article [[Michael Peterson (criminal)]]. He was convicted of murder, but then because an expert witness in the case was found to have provided false and inaccurate information on other cases the court gave him a retrial. In this retrail he plead the [[Alford plea]] and subsequently was sentenced to 
86 months in prison with credit, so was released from jail has he had served longer than that.

Therefore, the defendant has only plead "guilty" to save themselves, but still think they are "not guilty". This raises the question: Does pleading the [[Alford plea]] make someone a "criminal" in the eyes of the wiki?

This was brought to my attention through the discussion I had with {{u|Gazeboist}} on [[User talk:Dreamy Jazz/Archive 2#Michael Iver Peterson|my talk page]] and am opening on their behalf. Some important points in their message to me:
:{{tq|it is not reasonable to describe him as "convicted", despite the [[Alford plea]], due to the nature of an Alford plea and the post-conviction relief process in the United States}}
:{{tq|The Alford plea theoretically requires that there be enough evidence to convict a defendant, but in practice it merely requires that the prosecution have enough evidence that a judge will not dismiss the case before trial (as happened in this case). It amounts to an agreement to leave the case perpetually in the state it was in after the conviction was thrown out: Peterson asserts his innocence, but the claim has effectively never gone to trial. The assertion that Peterson is a "criminal" or "murderer" has been found *provable* but it has not been *proven*.}}

Please indicate your '''support'''/'''oppose''' to having the [[Alford plea]] be justification for the "criminal" parenthetical disambiguation. Comments are also welcome.
* '''Support''': [[Alford plea]] IS justification for the "criminal" parenthetical disambiguation
* '''Oppose''': [[Alford plea]] is NOT justification for the "criminal" parenthetical disambiguation

pinging those involved in the recent RM. {{ping|Ravensfire|TheGridExe|SnowFire|Born2cycle|Gonnym|Dlohcierekim}} [[User:Dreamy Jazz|Dreamy <i style="color:#d01e1e">'''Jazz'''</i>]] üé∑ <sup>''[[User talk:Dreamy Jazz|talk to me]]'' &#124; ''[[Special:Contributions/Dreamy Jazz|my contributions]]''</sup> 23:52, 7 January 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Sukavich Rangsitpol#rfc_641F2F0|Talk:Sukavich Rangsitpol]] expired 2019-02-11 20:01 ===
* Id: 641F2F0
* User: Lieutenant Colonel Thita Rangsitpol Manitkul,WRTA
* Date: 2019-02-11 03:03:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|882758351|UNSORTED 882758351}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|882861259|UNSORTED 882861259}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The bits that are negative that [[User:PohranicniStraze|PohranicniStraze]] said it was well source

https://books.google.co.th/books?id=4wyh6DqlDuQC&pg=PA217&lpg=PA217&dq=sukavich+rangsitpol+gay&source=bl&ots=hebs2C3QTk&sig=ACfU3U2PGT5At8xKh0UgKfA6xPY5y7KhUA&hl=th&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjOo8DvxrLgAhWHQI8KHediD50Q6AEwAXoECAEQAQ#v=onepage&q=sukavich%20rangsitpol%20gay&f=false

This is the Link that the contributor use as source it did not said the ban was approved,and yet the contributor said it was approved and His rival lift the ban is a lie. There were three newspapers that the writer use as source.The only that mention my father name had paid us (including me) many time for compensation. I would not be surprised if I take this case to court of law and the result is 

* Sorry , there should be  Deputy Education Minister( Suraporn Danaitangtrakul). My people forgot Duputy that is why only our newspaper mentions your father name . Something like this.

I think it would be easier to come here and talk to you about the truth first.

I had sent email to the writer (Professor.A.Jackson) about the issue and he sent me back to article to read and it showed the real situation about LGBT Rights in Thailand.

Dear Thita Rangsitpol,

You read the paper "Educating Desire: Thailand, Transnationalism, Transgression". There's a paper related to it on Academia that you haven't read yet: 

I check the paper it did not clear my father name that he mentioned. I am not sure why he sent me the paper to read.

'''Politic'''

Both issues was created to outs my father from his administration because his Education Reform had created and impact in Thailand.The Priminister at the time feel threatened by My father that was why this email was sending around the globe.

https://www.outrightinternational.org/content/thailand-gays-and-lesbians-banned-enrolling-teacher-training-schools
this is the original email it does not have my father email on because I call them and explain the situation back in 1997.
She understood and remove my father email from the letter in the link.

My father have never approved the ban because it was against his Education for All Education Reform .Please check and comfirm with  Ministry of Education,Thailand. Thailand had always been friendly country do not let any Political lies confuse you.

The following information is from UNESCO 

'''Thailand education reform 1995'''

On 16 September 1996, while in [[Jomtien Beach]], Education Minister [[Sukavich Rangsitpol]] gave his view on the issue:<ref>[http://unesdoc.unesco.org/images/0012/001221/122102Eo.pdf Asia-Pacific Regional Consultation on ADULT EDUCATION page53-56]</ref><ref>[[wikisource:Inaugural Address and Keynote Speech (Asia-Pacific Regional Consultation Adult Education)|s:Inaugural Address and Keynote Speech (Asia-Pacific Regional Consultation Adult Education)]], from [[Wikisource]]</ref>{{quote|I strongly believe that, as a citizen of the world, any person has the right to learn and should be entitled to have access to education according to their competency and needs. It is essential that the government provide educational services that respond to the people's needs. Education, therefore, has to be organized in such a way that people from all walks of life can participate in educational activities at levels and times of their preference.

 

All sort of boundaries, be their gender, age, socio-economic status, physical or mental disabilities have to be eliminated. To achieve this, we have to distinctively promote continuing and lifelong education, the form of education which is responsive to individual needs and preferences. With educational facilities and a variety of educational programs available, people can make use of the learning centre as a place to acquire technical skills or knowledge adaptive to their work and daily life activities.}}

The Minister of Education launched a series of education reforms in 1995. The aim was to enhance the quality of education from 1995 to achieve educational excellence by 2007.

{{quote|The objective of education reform is to create learning individual, organization, and society. An educated person or the authentic learning outcome should possess the following abilities and characteristics which are based on Thai cultural heritage and appropriate level of education: good physical and mental health, critical thinking, intellectual inquisitiveness, professionalism, sense of responsibility, honesty, self-sacrifice, perseverance, team spirit, adherence to democracy, and love for king, country, and religion.}}<ref>{{cite journal |last1=Dachakupt |first1=Pimpan |title=The current innovation in curriculum development in Thailand |journal=International Journal of Curriculum Development and Practice|date=1999 |volume=1 |pages=93-101 |url=https://www.jstage.jst.go.jp/article/jcrdaen/1/1/1_KJ00006742072/_pdf |accessdate=14 February 2019}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Dachakupt|first1=Pimpan|date=1999|title=The current innovation in curriculum development in Thailand|url=https://www.jstage.jst.go.jp/article/jcrdaen/1/1/1_KJ00006742072/_pdf|journal=International Journal of Curriculum Development and Practice|volume=1|pages=93-101|accessdate=14 February 2019}}</ref>

* 12 years [[Free education]] for all children provided by the government. The free 12 year education was in The [[1997 constitution of Thailand]].


According to UNESCO, Thailand education reform has led to the following results: 
1) The educational budget increased from 133 billion baht in 1996 to 163 billion baht in 1997 (22.5 percent increase)

2) Since 1996, first grade students have learned English and computer literacy.

3) The professional advance from teacher leve1 6 to teacher leve1 7 without having to submit academic work for consideration was approved by the Thai government 

4) There has been drawn up education policy to raise the standards of education from pre-primary to tertiary education.

5) Free 12 years education for all children provided by the government. The free 12 year education was in The 1997 constitution and that was the first time Thailand had give access to education for all citizens.

6)The Education Reform Project involved about 20,000 schools.<ref>{{cite book |title=Education Management Profile: Thailand |date=1998 |publisher=UNESCO  PRINCIPAL  REGIONAL  OFFICE  FOR  ASIA  AND  THE  PACIFIC |location=Bangkok |url=http://unesdoc.unesco.org/images/0011/001135/113535Eo.pdf |accessdate=14 February  2019}}</ref>



Please fix LGBT issue it should not be mentioned at all in my father page [[User:Lieutenant Colonel Thita Rangsitpol Manitkul,WRTA|Lieutenant Colonel Thita Rangsitpol Manitkul,WRTA]] ([[User talk:Lieutenant Colonel Thita Rangsitpol Manitkul,WRTA|talk]])

'''Wrong source '''

He was involved in a long-running scandal over the purchase of overpriced computers for schools . 

Tom Wingfield (2002). Edmund Terence Gomez, ed. Democratization and economic crisis in Thailand. Political Business in East Asia. Routledge. p. 269.


The source is about me join the opposition party in my page in German Languages 
https://de.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thita_Rangsitpol_Manitkul [[User:Lieutenant Colonel Thita Rangsitpol Manitkul,WRTA|Lieutenant Colonel Thita Rangsitpol Manitkul,WRTA]] ([[User talk:Lieutenant Colonel Thita Rangsitpol Manitkul,WRTA|talk]]) 03:03, 11 February 2019 (UTC)}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
User:Epf2018 made a number of edits which concerned a modern population genetics study that were misplaced in a section on Ancient DNA evidence. I reverted the edits and directed the editor to the talk page. Having engaged in reverting a number of times this editor agreed to enter a discussion. While the discussion was ongoing, User:Epf2018 unilaterally, and, I consider, in bad faith, resumed editing the article. I do not object to the addition of relevant material to the article, but the editor removed previously existing sound material and changed the wording derived from the conclusions of the paper it was describing. User:Epf2018 has a decided opinion that one particular paper is entirely definitive, in a complex field that has thrown up many studies with diametrically differing conclusions. I would like to defend the article from dumbing down to the state where one study is given a spurious pre-eminence over all others. [[User:Urselius|Urselius]] ([[User talk:Urselius|talk]]) 23:26, 12 January 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Administrator intervention against vandalism#rfc_6155616|Wikipedia talk:Administrator intervention against vandalism]] expired 2019-02-13 01:01 ===
* Id: 6155616
* User: Subtropical-man
* Date: 2019-01-14 00:26:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|878298143|POLICY 878298143}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|878298148|PROP 878298148}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|883056987|POLICY 883056987}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|883056989|PROP 883056989}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Real-life example: [[:user:WikiInspector42]] many times removed templates like {fact}, {disputed} etc from article [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_countries_and_dependencies_by_area&type=revision&diff=878245841&oldid=878245365][https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_countries_and_dependencies_by_area&type=revision&diff=878242156&oldid=878242011][https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_countries_and_dependencies_by_area&type=revision&diff=878132624&oldid=878132550][https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_countries_and_dependencies_by_area&type=revision&diff=875919815&oldid=875914159][https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_countries_and_dependencies_by_area&type=revision&diff=875904841&oldid=875899813]. Recidivism. Warnings do not help (also as "last warning") [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/User_talk:WikiInspector42#Edit_warring]. I add case to [[:Wikipedia:Administrator intervention against vandalism]], however, the administrator's reaction was unacceptable. User:WikiInspector42 got a warning [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk%3AWikiInspector42&type=revision&diff=878259341&oldid=878241395], I also [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk%3ASubtropical-man&type=revision&diff=878259280&oldid=878258812], but the main point is that vandalism has not been removed. If the article has problems, every user have the right to add templates like {fact} etc to article. There is no doubt here. User:WikiInspector42 has no right to delete templates like {fact} or other added by other user without improving the article or/and consensus (the discussion is under way). Administrator do not distinguish between two things: there may be differences of opinion between the two users but no user can break the rules. If the user deletes the template of {fact} or other from article without correcting the problem or consensus [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_countries_and_dependencies_by_area&type=revision&diff=878242156&oldid=878242011], this is vandalism. The problem is that [[:Wikipedia:Vandalism]] nothing writes about removing tags like {fact} or similar, and the administrator did not consider this as vandalism [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia:Administrator_intervention_against_vandalism&oldid=878248290][https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Escape_Orbit&oldid=878266896#Vandalism]. So, I am an experienced user (12 years on Wikipedia, 9 as registered user, about 30,000 editions in two Wikipedias and few other Wikimedia projects) and new user defeated me using stupid Wikipedia system and policy. Does this mean that everyone (even IP and new users) can remove tags from articles and experienced editors can not do anything because if reverted it more than twice, the administrator will not do anything except for the warning of both persons?  I am slowly beginning to regret that I have devoted so much life to the Wikipedia. Does it have to be this way? Can not normally solve such a simple problem? The administrator can always restore the tags, block the article or user, ordinary editor is defenseless against the trolls and the administrator does not want to help. It's not just about this example, there are thousands of such problems. Does anyone have any ideas? [[User:Subtropical-man|<span style="color: navy;">Subtropical</span><span style="color: red;">-man</span>]] <span style="color: navy;">([[User talk:Subtropical-man|talk]] / <small>en-2</small>)</span> 00:26, 14 January 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Fashion#rfc_A76020D|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Fashion]] expired 2019-02-13 10:01 ===
* Id: A76020D
* User: Trillfendi
* Date: 2019-01-14 08:00:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|878339274|MEDIA 878339274}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|883110209|MEDIA 883110209}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Does article quality really improve and is notability created if the majority of sources are directories that are deemed unreliable by administrators? This is the question that must be settled once and for all. What started at the AfD I have proposed for model K√§tlin Aas (on the grounds of meeting NMODEL but not GNG) has become a war of words and ad hominem attacks that I never meant for it to escalate to. For years, administrators have told me and other editors that appearance does not create notability. That models.com is not a reliable source. That New York Magazine‚Äôs defunct model profile pages such as [http://nymag.com/fashion/models/cdelevingne/caradelevingne/ this] are just directories that don‚Äôt contribute to notability. That things have to be validated by significant coverage to get approved for creation not simply mere mention. Some editors at the AfD for Aas believe the deemed-unreliable source of models.com, profile of New York Magazine, and Model Wall-style interviews are enough to create notability (despite the fact that almost all of Aas‚Äôs work cannot be verified outside of said directories) when that is the very thing administrators say is reason for declining articles. And that now those unreliable sources and elastic stretching of notability guidelines has moved her quality from stub to start class. [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Maartje_Verhoef&oldid=773873373 Exhibit A]. The question is, henceforth for ''all'' models, does meeting notability for NMODEL (things such as an international cover no matter what country, a Prada-exclusive casting, beauty contract, high fashion campaign, etc.) override the [[WP:GNG|general notability guidelines]] for any model? Are they to be related to each other in creation and deletion? Some editors don‚Äôt see that this is bigger than my view or opinion, informed by many examples of administrator comments I can provide, or that this isn‚Äôt about me trying to be ‚Äúright‚Äù, or that I have any emotional stake in proposed deletion results. I‚Äôm just trying to get clarity. This is about policy and how it‚Äôs supposed to be executed for all articles without hypocrisy or special favors. [[User:Trillfendi|Trillfendi]] ([[User talk:Trillfendi|talk]]) 08:00, 14 January 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Digital media use and mental health#rfc_801E226|Talk:Digital media use and mental health]] expired 2019-02-13 18:01 ===

At least in cases where most sources treat the phenomena as a social problem rather than strictly a medical condition."

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Naming conventions (Macedonia)#rfc_C01D16B|Wikipedia talk:Naming conventions (Macedonia)]] expired 2019-02-14 07:01 ===
* Id: C01D16B
* User: Kkyriakop#top
* Date: 2019-02-14 05:59:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|883225092|UNSORTED 883225092}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|883253386|UNSORTED 883253386}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I thought it would be useful to separate out this discussion, as some people in the Draft RFC also proposed, to distinguish it from other issues discussed there and to make things a bit less confused. The question here concerns the '''demonym''' of the country of North Macedonia, namely:
# What should be listed under Demonym(s) in the article 'North Macedonia'
# How to refer to people from North Macedonia in articles e.g. 'Zoran Zaev is a XXX politician', 'Ali Ahmeti is an XXX politician', 'Goran Popov is a XXX football player', 'many XXX residents', 'many prominent XXX musicians' etc.
Ideally (IMO) the answer to the above two should be the same.
Demonym is NOT the same thing as adjectival reference (i.e. North Macedonian Parliament, North Macedonian cuisine etc.), nor ethnicity (which, as far as I can tell, remains unchanged as Macedonian/ethnic Macedonian) and I would recommend setting up separate RFCs for those issues.
Demonym is also ''not necessarily'' the same thing as nationality, as illustrated by the example of North Korea, where the nationality is Korean, listed demonyms are North Korean and Korean, and the demonym used in articles is North Korean.

Based on my reading of the discussion in the Draft RFC, four main views have emerged:
* '''North Macedonian only''' - Match demonym to name of country for minimum confusion and to be able to refer to everyone and everything from the country in the same way, including, for example, people who may be from North Macedonia but may or may not hold Macedonian nationality (e.g. Albanians, residents who aren't citizens)
* '''North Korea model''': 'Demonym(s): North Macedonian, Macedonian', 'North Macedonian politician', 'North Korean football player' etc. - Minimises confusion and also closely matches double-barreled nationality under Prespa Agreement 'Macedonian/citizen of North Macedonia'
* '''Macedonian only''' - Match self-identified nationality of most citizens of North Macedonian while staying true to the fact that the Prespa Agreement never mentions the term 'North Macedonian'
* '''Macedonian for now, wait for consensus''' - Keep Macedonian for now as it was the demonym under the previous name and wait to see what language sources use going forward

My own quick review of news sources since the name change (12th February) has revealed:

'North Macedonian prime minister' <ref>https://www.irishtimes.com/news/world/europe/north-macedonia-s-birth-hailed-as-boost-for-balkans-and-nato-1.3792882</ref>, 'North Macedonian premier' <ref>https://www.gulf-times.com/story/622084/North-Macedonia-puts-up-new-name-on-border-with-Gr</ref>, 'North Macedonian Defense Minister' <ref>https://www.euronews.com/2019/02/11/we-re-ready-to-contribute-to-nato-north-macedonia-defence-minister-tells-euronews</ref> <ref>https://www.aa.com.tr/en/turkey/turkeys-defense-minister-us-counterpart-discuss-syria/1391760</ref><ref>https://www.aa.com.tr/en/turkey/turkeys-defense-minister-us-counterpart-discuss-syria/1391760</ref>, 'North Macedonian official' <ref>https://www.france24.com/en/20190214-13-killed-bus-accident-north-macedonia-minister</ref><ref>https://www.irishtimes.com/news/world/europe/north-macedonia-s-birth-hailed-as-boost-for-balkans-and-nato-1.3792882</ref>, 'North Macedonian authorities' <ref>https://www.foxnews.com/world/road-signs-replaced-to-reflect-north-macedonia-name-change</ref>, 'North Macedonian residents', 'North Macedonian nationals' <ref>https://greece.greekreporter.com/2019/02/12/gains-and-losses-for-greece-after-the-birth-of-north-macedonia/</ref>, 'North Macedonian fake-news creators' <ref>https://www.techcentral.ie/how-fake-news-is-changing-the-internet/</ref>, 'North Macedonian counterpart' <ref>http://www.bta.bg/en/c/ES/id/1957269</ref>, 'North Macedonian lawyers' <ref>https://www.acerislaw.com/north-macedonia-arbitration-lawyers-desk/</ref>

'Macedonian Prime Minister' <ref>http://jamaica-gleaner.com/article/world-news/20190212/country-prepares-name-change-removing-signs</ref>, 'Macedonian Foreign Minister' <ref>https://www.reuters.com/article/us-greece-macedonia-namechange/welcome-to-north-macedonia-new-road-signs-go-up-on-border-with-greece-idUSKCN1Q21LM</ref>, 'Macedonian workers' <ref>https://www.reuters.com/article/us-greece-macedonia-namechange/welcome-to-north-macedonia-new-road-signs-go-up-on-border-with-greece-idUSKCN1Q21LM</ref>, 'Macedonian soldiers' <ref>https://www.foxnews.com/world/macedonia-raises-nato-flag-ahead-of-name-change</ref>, 'many Macedonians feel humiliated' <ref>https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/feb/12/nato-flag-raised-ahead-of-north-macedonias-prospective-accession></ref>, 'Macedonians, who speak a Slavic language' <ref>https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/macedonia-north-name-change-greece-nato-controversy-eu-accession-a8776806.html</ref>, 'Macedonian prosecutor' <ref>https://www.occrp.org/en/investigations/macedonian-prosecutor-implicates-former-political-leaders-in-money-laundering-extortion-illicit-land-deals</ref>, 'Macedonian official', 'Macedonian counterpart' <ref>https://www.rferl.org/a/north-macedonia-puts-itself-on-the-map-officially/29766440.html</ref>, 'Macedonian church leaders', 'Macedonian Christians' <ref>https://www.brnow.org/News/February-2019/Macedonian-Baptists-awaken-to-church-planting</ref>

* '''North Korea model''': My personal vote if for Demonym(s): North Macedonian, Macedonian and North Macedonian everywhere else. No other country with a double name (North Korea, South Africa etc.) has a demonym that doesn't match its name. I believe Macedonian as a demonym for someone from North Macedonia is unnecessarily confusing, particularly since there is an ethnicity and three overlapping regions with the same name. Further, Macedonian is not that country's nationality (the nationality is Macedonian/citizen of North Macedonia) and it appears that for Albanian citizens of North Macedonia it will only be 'citizens of North Macedonia' <ref>https://www.balcanicaucaso.org/eng/Areas/Macedonia/North-Macedonia-the-new-name-comes-with-hopes-and-high-costs-192098</ref>, meaning 'Macedonian' will be an inaccurate designation for them. Finally, it looks like the adjectival reference for the country will most likely be North Macedonian, in which case you will create an enormous number of confusing grey areas and inconsistencies if the demonym is different (North Macedonian government but Macedonian government officials, North Macedonian film but Macedonian filmmakers, North Macedonian population but population of Macedonians etc.) <small class="autosigned">‚Äî&nbsp;Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Kkyriakop|Kkyriakop]] ([[User talk:Kkyriakop#top|talk]] ‚Ä¢ [[Special:Contributions/Kkyriakop|contribs]]) 2019-02-14T02:01:43 (UTC)</small> <small>‚Äî [[User:Kkyriakop|Kkyriakop]] ([[User talk:Kkyriakop|talk]]&#32;‚Ä¢ [[Special:Contributions/Kkyriakop|contribs]]) has made [[Wikipedia:Single-purpose account|few or no other edits]] outside this topic. </small> [[User:Matthew hk|Matthew hk]] ([[User talk:Matthew hk|talk]]) 05:59, 14 February 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Macedonian culture#rfc_B6156CB|Talk:Macedonian culture]] expired 2019-02-14 12:01 ===
* Id: B6156CB
* User: Future Perfect at Sunrise
* Date: 2019-02-13 23:22:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|883219096|UNSORTED 883219096}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|883277805|UNSORTED 883277805}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Right now, the article purports to refer to the culture of ethnic Macedonians ("Macedonian culture is the culture of the ethnic Macedonian population") and is thus appropriately titled 'Macedonian culture'. However, all the subsections refer to the culture of the country of North Macedonia (Music of North Macedonia, Cinema of North Macedonia etc.) and include many references to things like Islamic architecture and the Manaki brothers (who were Aromanians), which pertain to the country but nor the ethnic group.

On the other hand, there is no reference to anything related to ethnic Macedonians outside of North Macedonia, nor in my view should there be, since this would be covered by articles like [[Macedonian diaspora]] and [[Slavic speakers of Greek Macedonia]].

This is consistent with the practice in other similar articles ([[Culture of Greece]], [[Culture of Montenegro]], [[Culture of Bosnia Herzegovina]] etc.) which all refer to countries and not ethnic groups.  

I, therefore, suggest changing the title to 'Culture of North Macedonia' and adjusting the first sentence accordingly.


: Please start an RfC here if you want to change the long-standing scope of the article. We are having too many hasty, rushed-through changes of too many articles at once in this topic area today. It's been impossible to keep track of things. [[User:Future Perfect at Sunrise|Fut.Perf.]] [[User talk:Future Perfect at Sunrise|‚òº]] 23:22, 13 February 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Process crime#rfc_5641D04|Talk:Process crime]] expired 2019-02-14 13:01 ===
* Id: 5641D04
* Date: 2019-02-14 08:26:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|883243713|POL 883243713}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|883283473|POL 883283473}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
*I've undone the "<nowiki>{{criticism section}} {{cherry-picked}} {{POV}}</nowiki>" tags because it is not clear to me what the problem is. The IP's edit summary adding them read: "The previous version was mostly examples, this version is mostly criticism from one source, cited multiple times. This seems to violate NPOV." I can't follow this. A scholarly analysis of how process crimes are used by prosecutors isn't necessarily "criticism"; the author we cite doesn't say that it is necessarily wrong to punish criminals by charging them with easier-to-prove process crimes rather than their substantive crimes. I've clarified that by removing the "criticism" from the section header, which somebody else added. Also, the tag's statement that he article is based on "quotations that were previously collated by an advocacy or lobbying group" is mistaken; the article is based on a peer-reviewed law review article. I do agree, though, that the article could benefit from more sources and a perspective that is broader than that of one author; I'll try and find more when I have the time. <small><span style="border:1px solid black;padding:1px;">[[User:Sandstein|<span style="color:white;background:blue;font-family:sans-serif;">''' Sandstein '''</span>]]</span></small> 08:26, 14 February 2019 (UTC)}}

Which image should be used in the infobox?. ‚Äì[[User:Davey2010|<span style="color: blue;">'''Davey'''</span><span style="color: orange;">'''2010'''</span>]]<sup>[[User talk:Davey2010|<span style="color: navy;">'''Talk'''</span>]]</sup> 16:00, 22 January 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of northernmost items#rfc_BD339A2|Talk:List of northernmost items]] expired 2019-02-14 22:01 ===
* Id: BD339A2
* User: 91.155.138.20
* Date: 2019-02-14 14:43:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This comment is regarding the latest removals on this article made by [[User:Reywas92]] [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_northernmost_items&diff=883211493&oldid=883182745]. That sounds absolutely subjective and high-handed.
For example, why would a harness racing track be too unimportant to be included but a golf course not? That doesn't make any sense. The other removals are as senseless like this. Pages linked by him ([[WP:INDISCRIMINATE]], [[WP:TRIVIA]]) don't give any further explanation to his removals. It is like Reywas92 removed only the parts about the topics he knows nothing about or he doesn't personally particularly like.

I left a comment about this on talk page, but he removed also that without any explanation. Obviously he is so omnipotent he doesn't need to take other's point of views even into consideration and only his opinions matters, no matter how subjective they are. He must be a very self-entitled and stupid person if thinks he can always act like that. --[[Special:Contributions/91.155.138.20|91.155.138.20]] ([[User talk:91.155.138.20|talk]]) 14:43, 14 February 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Elliott Abrams#rfc_3E6CA63|Talk:Elliott Abrams]] expired 2019-02-15 07:01 ===
* Id: 3E6CA63
* User: Vfrickey
* Date: 2019-02-13 22:42:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|883206320|POL 883206320}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|888111042|POL 888111042}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should we describe Abrams as a "war criminal", and where in the article should we do so?

The previous version of the article stated <blockquote>Elliott Abrams (born January 24, 1948) is an American diplomat, lawyer, political scientist, and war criminal[2] who served in foreign policy positions for Presidents Ronald Reagan and George W. Bush.</blockquote> 

Calling Elliot Abrams a war criminal based on a very contentious statement made in a [[WP:BIASED]] source<blockquote> Alterman, Eric. "An Actual American War Criminal May Become Our Second-Ranking Diplomat". BillMoyers.com. Public Square Media. Retrieved 13 February 2019. </blockquote>without first seeking consensus on the change violates [[WP:BLP]] and [[WP:DUE]].  

I reverted the article to the previous page as required by [[WP:BLP]] while I researched available sources, to make sure Mr. Abrams had or had not been found guilty in a court of a war crime.  The evidence for such a finding may exist, but Abrams has never been found guilty in a court of law of a war crime according to any reliable source of which I am aware. Under [[WP:BLP]] we cannot call Mr. Abrams a "war criminal" unless a court has found him guilty of a war crime.

"Accused war criminal" might be an accurate description of Elliott Abrams.  However, mentioning those accusations in the first paragraph of the lede sentence is [[WP:UNDUE]] until the charges made are adjudicated in a court of law.  So far, Elliot Abrams has not been indicted for war crimes in any court.

I propose we cite Eric Alterman's article [https://www.thenation.com/article/an-actual-american-war-criminal-may-become-our-second-ranking-diplomat/ "An Actual American War Criminal May Become Our Second-Ranking Diplomat"], February 2, 2017, in ''[[The Nation]]'' as support for the statement "Elliott Abrams has been accused of war crimes committed while he served in foreign policy positions for Presidents Ronald Reagan". 

This statement should '''not''' appear in the lede paragraph, because it is the opinion of activists such as Eric Alterman.  So far all of the statements which appear in a Google search "Elliott Abrams war crime" which support Alterman's statements regarding Abrams' guilt of war crimes are activist forums, not reliable secondary sources.  Even Alterman's own statements appear in [[WP:BIASED]] fora such as ''The Nation'' (this article was cited in billmoyers.com, which admitted the article first appeared in ''The Nation'').

[[WP:DUE]] states <blockquote>"Neutrality requires that each article or other page in the mainspace fairly represents all significant viewpoints that have been published by reliable sources, in proportion to the prominence of each viewpoint in the published, reliable sources. Giving due weight and avoiding giving undue weight means that articles should not give minority views or aspects as much of or as detailed a description as more widely held views or widely supported aspects."</blockquote>

I feel we need to discuss this matter in light of [[WP:BLP]], [[WP:DUE]] and [[WP:NPOV]].  Thanks for reading this. [[User:Vfrickey|loupgarous]] ([[User talk:Vfrickey|talk]]) 22:42, 13 February 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:MMR vaccine controversy#rfc_19388CE|Talk:MMR vaccine controversy]] expired 2019-02-19 15:01 ===
* Id: 19388CE
* Date: 2019-01-20 14:41:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|879329081|SCI 879329081}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|884100937|SCI 884100937}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I propose this article should be moved. Obvious candidates include:
* MMR-autism hoax
* MMR-autism fraud
* MMR vaccine and autism

Rationale: Scientifically, there is no controversy, and essentially there never was. Virtually all research from the time of the original fraudulent Lancet paper either failed to confirm its findings, or contradicted it. To describe this as a controversy is to give undue weight to the fraud and those who perpetuate it still. The statement in the lede that it is perhaps the most damaging medical hoax of the last 100 years is pretty compelling evidence that we should choose a less [[WP:WEASEL|musteloid title]]. <b>[[User Talk:JzG|Guy]]</b> <small>([[User:JzG/help|Help!]])</small> 14:41, 20 January 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:BarlowGirl#rfc_CDFDE49|Talk:BarlowGirl]] expired 2019-02-20 03:01 ===
* Id: CDFDE49
* User: LABcrabs
* Date: 2019-01-21 02:50:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|879416365|MEDIA 879416365}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|884192611|MEDIA 884192611}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The text about Lady Gaga was added on [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=BarlowGirl&oldid=781496448 May 21, 2017] and while Walter and company did not support this change, they did not revert it either. It is only in the recent few days that the text was contested and entirely removed, without any explanation. I did [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=BarlowGirl&oldid=879412800 restore an edited version just now], removing the prose, but I expect Walter and company to pounce on it and remove the mention entirely. The text, per my latest revision, is referenced and states the following:
: The [[set list]] for the [[BarlowGirl and Superchick live tour]] in 2009 included a portion of "[[Just Dance (song)|Just Dance]]" by [[Lady Gaga]], as covered by Superchick. In 2016 and 2017, Lauren Barlow commented favorably on Lady Gaga's performances.
I believe that the text is justified because it is important information, as not many people are expecting BarlowGirl to endorse Lady Gaga. For example, the [[American Family Association]] Journal [https://afajournal.org/past-issues/2004/november-december/barlowgirl-stuffs-stockings-with-spiritual-values/ interviewed BarlowGirl] in November/December 2004. AFA is a group that openly opposes homosexuality, among other values, so it's reasonable to believe that an artist being on good terms with AFA would share the organization's values. It's not just AFA, but also Billy Graham, Joyce Meyer, Secret Keeper Girl, The Revolution TV and several other like-minded ministries. Gaga is famous/infamous for her immodesty, sacrilegious songs like "[[Judas (Lady Gaga song)|Judas]]", the "Born This Way" movement, promoting promiscuity, and many other such values which BarlowGirl's platform historically opposed. If anyone does not realize the problem, I believe they are deceived.

Given this, I am having an RfC to determine whether or not the text should be present. I will allow Walter and company to fill in the "No, we should not add this" section. Thank you for your consideration. --[[User:LABcrabs|LABcrabs]] ([[User talk:LABcrabs|talk]]) 02:50, 21 January 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Ricardo V√©lez Rodr√≠guez#rfc_AE94FCB|Talk:Ricardo V√©lez Rodr√≠guez]] expired 2019-02-20 21:01 ===
* Id: AE94FCB
* User: Losedank
* Date: 2019-02-19 05:09:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|884051340|BIO 884051340}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|884051343|POL 884051343}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|884310716|BIO 884310716}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|884310725|POL 884310725}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=

=== [[Template talk:Subscription required#rfc_B5892E9|Template talk:Subscription required]] expired 2019-02-21 23:01 ===
* Id: B5892E9
* User: GreenC
* Date: 2019-01-22 22:28:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|879716412|TECH 879716412}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|884484078|TECH 884484078}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Proposal is with CS1/2 templates that look like this:
:*[[Bovver boot]]: <code><nowiki>{{cite news | url=https://www.questia.com/read/1G1-61177939 | title=Max hangs up his boots with ¬£200m | work=[[The People]] | date=March 31, 1996 | accessdate=March 4, 2013 | author=Gunn, Cathy}}{{Subscription required|via=[[Questia Online Library]]}}</nowiki></code>

:::{{cite news | url=https://www.questia.com/read/1G1-61177939 | title=Max hangs up his boots with ¬£200m | work=[[The People]] | date=March 31, 1996 | accessdate=March 4, 2013 | author=Gunn, Cathy}}{{Subscription required|via=[[Questia Online Library]]}}

Replace with this:

:*[[Bovver boot]]: <code><nowiki>{{cite news | url=https://www.questia.com/read/1G1-61177939 | title=Max hangs up his boots with ¬£200m | work=[[The People]] | url-access=subscription | via = [[Questia Online Library]] | date=March 31, 1996 | accessdate=March 4, 2013 | author=Gunn, Cathy}}</nowiki></code>

:::{{cite news | url=https://www.questia.com/read/1G1-61177939 | title=Max hangs up his boots with ¬£200m | work=[[The People]] | url-access=subscription | via = [[Questia Online Library]] | date=March 31, 1996 | accessdate=March 4, 2013 | author=Gunn, Cathy}}

As background, this template was created before CS1/2 had a {{para|url-access}} feature. It also makes other tools like Citation bot difficult as it's not always clear which citation is being tagged with which {{tld|subscription required}} template. 

The RfC will 1) change the documentation to be only for use in free-form citations 2) and for a bot to make the conversions of existing cases to the CS1/2 system (like in the example). Estimate is about 12k-15k cases. -- [[User:GreenC|<span style="color: #006A4E;">'''Green'''</span>]][[User talk:GreenC|<span style="color: #093;">'''C'''</span>]] 22:28, 22 January 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Help talk:Citation Style 1#rfc_9016F3F|Help talk:Citation Style 1]] expired 2019-02-22 21:01 ===
* Id: 9016F3F
* User: Cunard
* Date: 2019-02-07 07:48:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|882169863|POLICY 882169863}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|882169864|TECH 882169864}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|882169866|PROP 882169866}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|884621651|POLICY 884621651}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|884621653|TECH 884621653}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|884621655|PROP 884621655}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Right now, {{noping|Citation bot}} removes publisher and location in {{tl|cite journal}}. Proponents of this removal state that this is recommended by nearly every style guide under the belief that there is little value to the information. 

However:

* Several recent threads at [[User talk:Citation bot]] indicate that removing the parameters is unexpected at-best and believed to be detrimental at worst;
* "nearly every style guide" is not [[WP:MOS|our style guide]]
* Removing them does not respect the consensus in [[Module:Citation/CS1]], which is to provide the parameters in cite journal.

This RFC seeks [[WP:CCC|consensus]] for the following questions:

# Should Citation bot continue to remove these data?
# Is there consensus for this removal, {{em|anywhere}}, by {{em|anyone}}?
# Should we continue to support these parameters in [[Module:Citation/CS1]] for {{tl|cite journal}}? <s>If we continue to support these parameters, should we:</s>
## <s>Support them only in metadata without display;</s>
## <s>Display them only without support in the metadata;</s>
## <s>Status quo, which is both to support them in the metadata and display them?</s>

<small>RfC added to [[Template:Centralized discussion]] and relisted by [[User:Cunard|Cunard]] ([[User talk:Cunard|talk]]) at 07:48, 7 February 2019 (UTC)}}


=== [[Wikipedia:Administrators/2019 request for comment on inactivity standards#rfc_3553154|Wikipedia:Administrators/2019 request for comment on inactivity standards]] expired 2019-02-22 21:01 ===
* Id: 3553154
* Date: 2019-01-23 20:47:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|879858143|POLICY 879858143}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|884621651|POLICY 884621651}}

{{rfcquote|text=
Are the [[Wikipedia:Administrators#Procedural removal for inactive administrators|activity standards for administrators]] effective? Should they be adjusted? 20:47, 23 January 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Help talk:Citation Style 1#rfc_09B1977|Help talk:Citation Style 1]] expired 2019-02-22 21:01 ===
* Id: 09B1977
* User: DannyS712
* Date: 2019-02-22 19:50:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|884614021|UNSORTED 884614021}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|884621656|UNSORTED 884621656}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
, a no-consensus close would also result in stopping the automatic removal.</small> Accordingly, {{ping|Smith609|p=}} is requested to disable the bot until the code is updated and compliant with the results of this RfC. Since they have not edited in almost 2 weeks, I will leave a note at [[WP:ANI]] asking that the bot be blocked until it is updated to be compliant with the result of this RfC.

2. Is there consensus for this removal, anywhere, by anyone?
:This question is a bit trickier. The discussion relating to question 1 discussed the benefits and drawbacks of having the parameters included, and the consensus was that the parameters should not be automatically removed. Thus, there is '''consensus against''' the indiscriminate removal of these parameters in the manner of a [[WP:MEATBOT]]. However, there is consensus that '''these parameters can be removed''' in the same way as any other edit is made (respecting [[WP:BRD|the BRD process]], discussing on the talk page, etc.); likewise, they '''can also be included''' in the same manner.

3. Should we continue to support these parameters in Module:Citation/CS1 for {{tl|cite journal}}?
:There was less discussion about this question. But, given that there is consensus against indiscriminately removing these parameters (see questions #1 and #2), it would make no sense to remove the support for the parameters. Accordingly, we '''should continue to support''' the parameters for {{tl|cite journal}}.

This was a complicated topic; if anyone has any questions about this close feel free to [[User talk:DannyS712|ask me]]. I will leave notes on the maintainer's talk page, as well as at [[WP:ANI]] and [[WP:BOTN]], regarding this close. Thanks, --[[User:DannyS712|DannyS712]] ([[User talk:DannyS712|talk]]) 19:50, 22 February 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Review aggregators#rfc_B2EA021|Wikipedia talk:Review aggregators]] expired 2019-02-23 01:01 ===
* Id: B2EA021
* User: Flyer22 Reborn
* Date: 2019-01-24 00:33:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|879886857|MEDIA 879886857}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|884648736|MEDIA 884648736}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
As seen at [[Wikipedia talk:Review aggregators#ASOF]], there was little discussion on whether or not the {{t|As of}} template, or some similar wording indicating that the score may have changed over time, should be used for [[review aggregator]]s. This RfC is to gauge wider opinion on the matter. I'll alert [[WP:Film]], [[MOS:Film]], [[WP:TV]], [[MOS:TV]], [[WP:Video games]], [[WP:Manual of Style/Video games]] and [[WP:WikiProject Music]] and [[WP:Manual of Style/Music]] to this RfC since film, television, video game articles and music articles, especially the first three, commonly use review aggregators. If someone feels that another WikiProject or MOS page should be notified, feel free to do so. [[User:Flyer22 Reborn|Flyer22 Reborn]] ([[User talk:Flyer22 Reborn|talk]]) 00:33, 24 January 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Electric smoking system#rfc_3523696|Talk:Electric smoking system]] expired 2019-02-23 22:01 ===
* Id: 3523696
* User: HLHJ
* Date: 2019-02-22 04:11:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|884521898|ECON 884521898}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|884521902|SCI 884521902}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|889204929|ECON 889204929}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|889204932|SCI 889204932}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This RfC is about how [[electric smoking device|products that heat solid tobacco using external heat sources]] work, and how to explain it clearly and comprehensibly (''note these are '''not''' e-cigarettes; they heat tobacco, usually to much higher temperatures'').

Points on which comment is requested:
# Should [[char]]red tobacco be described as unburned?
# Should the more specific term "charred" be preferred to the more general term "heated" for things that have been heated until they charred (charring/pyrolysis cannot occur without heating)?
# Should the more specific term "smoke" be preferred to the more general term "[[aerosol]]" for the emissions of charring tobacco (but not for aerosols heated to temperatures too low to char)? 
# Should Wikipedia have separate articles for products that char tobacco and those that leach it at sub-boiling temperatures (the article currently addresses only charring products)?
# How should the term "burned" be used? Does it encompass both charring and complete combustion to ash?
# Under what circumstances should terminology used to market these products be used in Wikipedia's voice (separate from sourced content on public discussion of such terms)?
# Should the more specific term "charring" be preferred to the more general term "pyrolysis" for pyrolizing complex organic materials, specifically tobacco? (added question)

For those who like pictures, [https://a1.vaping360.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/12/IQOS-34.jpg here] is a photo of one of these products, disassembled after use to show the heat-altered tobacco; and I've put together a [[User:HLHJ/Thermal breakdown of organic matter|pictoral guide]] to the thermal changes in heated organic matter (not neutral on the above questions, but attempting accuracy). [[User:HLHJ|HLHJ]] ([[User talk:HLHJ|talk]]) 04:11, 22 February 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Israeli occupation of the West Bank#rfc_B555D01|Talk:Israeli occupation of the West Bank]] expired 2019-02-26 07:01 ===
* Id: B555D01
* Date: 2019-01-27 06:44:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|880405669|HIST 880405669}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|880405676|POL 880405676}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|880405681|SOC 880405681}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|880405683|STYLE 880405683}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|885146745|HIST 885146745}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|885146747|POL 885146747}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|885146748|SOC 885146748}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|885146749|STYLE 885146749}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Please see prior discussion at [[Talk:Israeli occupation of the West Bank#size]], [[Talk:Israeli occupation of the West Bank#WP:FORK]], [[Talk:Israeli occupation of the West Bank#WP:SPINOUTs]], [[Talk:Israeli occupation of the West Bank#Israeli security concerns]], and [[Talk:Israeli occupation of the West Bank#Article trim per TOOLONG and MOS:LEADLENGTH]]. Please also note that the scope of the article ("the occupation" vs. "the effects of the occupation"), inclusion of additional content (e.g. Israeli motivations and security concerns, diplomatic initiatives), and organization (e.g. proposal at [[User:Levivich/sandbox1]]) are also being discussed. What is the appropriate size for this article?

'''A:''' The size of [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Israeli_occupation_of_the_West_Bank&oldid=880315366 revision A] - 158kb (25244 words) of readable prose + 132 notes (which are not citations or references) containing some 51kb of additional prose, 6 paragraph lead.

'''B:''' The size of [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Israeli_occupation_of_the_West_Bank&oldid=880184986 revision B] - 72kb (11533 words) of readable prose + 45 notes (which are not citations or references) containing some 16kb of additional prose, 3 paragraph lead.

'''C''' The size of a further trim of B - 50kb of readable prose, less than 15 notes (of at most 3kb - containing mainly clarifications or notes on source mixups), 3-4 paragraph lead.

Please indicate A, B, C, or other (please specify) and a reason.06:44, 27 January 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Internal consistency of the Bible#rfc_1253087|Talk:Internal consistency of the Bible]] expired 2019-02-27 01:01 ===
* Id: 1253087
* User: JohnThorne
* Date: 2019-02-13 02:57:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|884477497|RELI 884477497}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|885272525|RELI 885272525}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
A sourcing error crept in since May 28, 2008, in the following part:
: 3.  Biblical criticism and criticism of the Bible; 3.3 Manuscripts: 
:: "Manuscripts also differ. Usually the differences are minor‚Äîmatters of spelling and the like‚Äîbut occasionally they are significant, as in the case of the [[Comma Johanneum]], a clause in the [[First Epistle of John]] that bears explicit witness to the doctrine of the Christian [[Trinity]], <u>but is not found in any manuscript earlier than the 10th century (codex 221), where it is shown as a marginal note</u>.<nowiki><ref name=DBWallace>Daniel B. Wallace,"[http://www.bible.org/page.asp?page_id=1185 The Comma Johanneum and Cyprian]".</ref></nowiki>"
The underlined statement is not found in the mentioned reference, which can still be accessed. Could it be that the source was revised since its publication on June 25, 2004? These are the issues:
* "any manuscript earlier than the 10th century" contradicts the source which stated that "The earliest instance of the passage being quoted as a part of the actual text of the Epistle [italics added] is in a fourth century Latin treatise entitled Liber Apologeticus (chap. 4)..."
* "codex 221" is not found in the source.
The proposed change to match the source could be:
:: "...as in the case of the [[Comma Johanneum]], a clause in the [[First Epistle of John]] that bears explicit witness to the doctrine of the Christian [[Trinity]], <u>which is found written only in Latin in the 4th century at the earliest, but is not observed in any Greek manuscripts prior to 1215</u>.<nowiki><ref name=DBWallace>Daniel B. Wallace,"[http://www.bible.org/page.asp?page_id=1185 The Comma Johanneum and Cyprian]".</ref></nowiki>"
Peace. [[User:JohnThorne|JohnThorne]] ([[User talk:JohnThorne|talk]]) 02:57, 13 February 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Habakkuk#rfc_1A45EEE|Talk:Habakkuk]] expired 2019-02-27 06:01 ===
* Id: 1A45EEE
* User: JohnThorne
* Date: 2019-02-20 18:49:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|884477497|RELI 884477497}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|885306229|RELI 885306229}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Proposal for the lede:
:'''Habakkuk'''{{efn|({{IPAc-en|audio=en-us-Habakkuk.ogg|h|…ô|Àà|b|√¶|k|…ô|k}} or {{IPAc-en|audio=en-us-Habakkuk-2.ogg|Àà|h|√¶|b|…ô|k| ä|k}}; {{hebrew Name|◊ó÷≤◊ë÷∑◊ß÷º◊ï÷º◊ß|·∏§avakuk|·∏§aibaquq}}; also spelled '''Habacuc''')}} was a [[prophet]] in the [[Hebrew Bible]], described in the [[Book of Habakkuk]], the eighth of the collected [[Twelve Minor Prophets|twelve minor prophets]].{{sfnp|Hirsch|1906}} He is revered by Jews, Christians, and Muslims.
:Almost all about his information can be drawn only from the book of the Bible bearing his name,{{sfnp|Bruce|2009|p=831}} with no biographical details provided other than his title "the prophet."{{sfnp|Gowan|1976|p=12}} Outside the Bible, he is mentioned over the centuries in the form of [[Christian tradition|Christian]] and [[Rabbinic tradition]], but these are dismissed by modern scholars as speculative and apocryphal.{{sfnp|Brownlow|1961|p=440}}{{sfnp|Henderson|1980|p=291}}
:The tomb of Habakkuk has been claimed at multiple locations, currently one location in Israel and one in Iran.
[[User:JohnThorne|JohnThorne]] ([[User talk:JohnThorne|talk]]) 18:49, 20 February 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:The Matrix (franchise)#rfc_CB3505A|Talk:The Matrix (franchise)]] expired 2019-02-28 06:01 ===
* Id: CB3505A
* User: Betty Logan
* Date: 2019-01-29 05:40:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|880744804|MEDIA 880744804}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|880744807|STYLE 880744807}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|885470343|MEDIA 885470343}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|885470346|STYLE 885470346}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
How should [[the Wachowskis]] be credited in articles about films/media they worked on before they came out as women? (The main point of contention is how they‚Äôre credited in leads and infoboxes.)

'''A''': Reflect their preferred gender identity and avoid referring to them as ‚Äúbrothers‚Äù (except in footnotes and references.) For example, the ''[[Matrix Revolutions]]'' article should say that the film was directed by "The Wachowskis" in the lead and infobox.

'''B''': Reflect how they were credited when their films were released. For example, the ''Matrix Revolutions'' article should say that the film was directed by "The Wachowski Brothers‚Äù in the lead and infobox.

'''C''': Reflect the credit as it is currently recorded on the work in question. {{small|(Added by [[User:Betty Logan|Betty Logan]] ([[User talk:Betty Logan|talk]]))}}

'''OTHER''': Please specify.  {{small|(Added by [[User:WanderingWanda|WanderingWanda]] ([[User talk:WanderingWanda|talk]]))}}

(Previous RfCs: [[Talk:The_Matrix/Archive_5#RfC:_How_should_the_directors_of_this_film_be_presented_in_the_lead?|here]] and [[Talk:The_Matrix_Reloaded#The_Wachowski_credit_in_the_lead|here]]. Previous discussions: [[Template_talk:Infobox_film/Archive_24#.22credited_at_the_time.22|here]], [[Talk:The_Matrix/Archive_5#"The_Wachowskis"_vs_"The_Wachowski_Brothers"|here]], and [[Talk:The_Matrix#The_Wachowskis|here]].) [[User:WanderingWanda|WanderingWanda]] ([[User talk:WanderingWanda|talk]]) 05:40, 29 January 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Walking on Air (Katy Perry song)#rfc_497DD2B|Talk:Walking on Air (Katy Perry song)]] expired 2019-03-01 19:01 ===
* Id: 497DD2B
* User: 2402:1980:8245:A56A:508B:72F0:AF1E:857A
* Date: 2019-01-30 18:43:00

'Disco' is vaguely referenced and phrased by one reviewer who is being given undue weight. Because "disco" shortened for "Discotheque" which redirected to "[[Nightclub]]", a place where dancing, rather than a [[disco]] genre. [[Special:Contributions/2402:1980:8245:A56A:508B:72F0:AF1E:857A|2402:1980:8245:A56A:508B:72F0:AF1E:857A]] ([[User talk:2402:1980:8245:A56A:508B:72F0:AF1E:857A|talk]]) 18:43, 30 January 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:FC Cincinnati#rfc_C96C9FA|Talk:FC Cincinnati]] expired 2019-03-01 20:01 ===
* Id: C96C9FA
* User: DA1
* Date: 2019-01-30 19:23:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|880995666|LANG 880995666}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|880995671|SOC 880995671}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|885708819|LANG 885708819}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|885708822|SOC 885708822}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The article's existing lede stated as follows:
{{quote frame|1='''FC Cincinnati''' is a [[association football|soccer]] club based in [[Cincinnati]], [[Ohio]], that will begin play in [[Major League Soccer]] (MLS) in 2019. {{highlight| The team will succeed the [[FC Cincinnati (2016‚Äì18)|lower-division team]] of the same name and was announced on May 29, 2018, when MLS awarded an expansion franchise to Cincinnati.}}[S] The club's ownership group is led by [[Carl H. Lindner III]].}}
I am proposing RfC, following a [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=FC_Cincinnati&diff=880978985&oldid=880978728 dissenting revert] stating "''Not the agreed-upon lede. Seek [[WP:CONSENSUS]] to change it.''";  My proposal is akin to: 
{{quote frame|1='''FC Cincinnati''' is a [[association football|soccer]] club based in [[Cincinnati]], [[Ohio]], that will begin play in [[Major League Soccer]] (MLS) in 2019. {{highlight| The club began in 2015 and [[FC Cincinnati (2016‚Äì18)|played in]] the [[USL Championship|United States Soccer League]] (USL), the second-tier division of the [[United States soccer pyramid]], for two seasons from 2016 to 2018. On May 29, 2018, MLS announced it had awarded the club a franchise in its league.}}[S] The club's ownership group is led by [[Carl H. Lindner III]].}}
My reasoning is: the club is a pre-existing club that has "join[ed] MLS". It previously competed in the USL and was founded in 2015. It is not a new club "of the same name" succeeding the previous one. This is [http://www.espn.in/football/major-league-soccer/story/3512103/fc-cincinnati-to-join-mls-as-expansion-team-next-season based on] the [S]ource cited in the lede itself, which states:
{{quote frame|1=
- MLS made the announcement on Tuesday evening at a ceremony with commissioner Don Garber and Cincinnati mayor John Cranley in attendance. <br> 
- "We congratulate [FC Cincinnati managing owner and CEO] Carl Lindner and his partners, and also the soccer fans of Cincinnati, who '''have passionately supported FC Cincinnati in the USL'''." <br> 
- '''FC Cincinnati, which {{highlight|has played}} in the lower-division United Soccer League {{highlight|since 2016, will continue}} to''' use the University of Cincinnati's Nippert Stadium until its own soccer-specific venue is completed. <br> 
- "I have to start by '''thanking the supporters of FC Cincinnati, because {{highlight| from the beginning they were the foundation of the efforts of our bid to join MLS.}}''' We could not have done this without them. This has been a true team effort among the soccer fans, our partners and our civic and corporate leaders. <br> 
- '''{{highlight|The}} club {{highlight| has been}} a major success story since joining the USL in 2016,''' averaging more than 21,000 fans in 16 home games last season, and beating two MLS clubs in the U.S. Open Cup in front of 30,000-plus fans.}}
Requesting consensus and input on the aforementioned. [[User:DA1|DA1]] ([[User talk:DA1|talk]]) 19:23, 30 January 2019 (UTC)}}

{{rfcquote|text=
RFc on citation style on this article. 

A. Use only <nowiki><ref></ref> </nowiki> and remove/don't use {{para|refs}} of {{t|reflist}}

B. Use <nowiki><ref name=></nowiki> for all ref as well as using {{para|refs}} to wrap all citations

C. Keep [[User:Geo Swan]]'s unique citation style, by putting one and only one ref in {{para|refs}} of {{t|reflist}} . [[Special:Contributions/49.196.4.73|49.196.4.73]] ([[User talk:49.196.4.73|talk]]) 23:17, 30 January 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Blocking policy#rfc_6AF36DC|Wikipedia talk:Blocking policy]] expired 2019-03-02 20:01 ===
* Id: 6AF36DC
* Date: 2019-02-25 08:39:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|884998198|POLICY 884998198}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|885857023|POLICY 885857023}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I propose that a new subsection should be added to the "[[Wikipedia:Blocking_policy#Common_rationales_for_blocks|common rationales for blocks]]" section, which should be as follows.

{{quote frame|text= === Viewpoint-based blocks '''

Editors who personally hold extreme viewpoints ("extreme" being defined as a viewpoint that differs in major ways from what would constitute [[WP:NPOV|NPOV]]) may be indefinitely blocked for holding such viewpoints, even if their behavior itself is not disruptive. Evidence about an editor's personal viewpoints may rely on the editor's activities outside of Wikipedia, but in order to avoid a breach of privacy, off-wiki evidence about an editor's viewpoints may only be submitted privately to the [[WP:ARBCOM|Arbitration Committee]]. Blocks placed for this reason will typically remain in place until the blocked editor can demonstrate that they no longer hold the viewpoint that led to their block.}}
08:39, 25 February 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Cultural impact of Michael Jackson#rfc_ED0E178|Talk:Cultural impact of Michael Jackson]] expired 2019-03-04 12:01 ===
* Id: ED0E178
* User: Flyer22 Reborn
* Date: 2019-02-02 11:36:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|881413159|MEDIA 881413159}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|881413160|SOC 881413160}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|886123150|MEDIA 886123150}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|886123152|SOC 886123152}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
As seen at [[Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Cultural impact of Michael Jackson]], whether or not there should be a Cultural impact of Michael Jackson article has been subject to debate. That AfD closed as "no consensus." That was in August 2017. In December 2017, further discussion took place at [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Music]] (see [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Music/Archive 37#Redirect discussion|here]]). After that, there was a 2018 discussion [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Talk:Cultural_impact_of_Michael_Jackson&oldid=823153914 on the talk page]. Soon, the article was redirected per arguments made at Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Music. Recently, another discussion has taken place on the matter...this time at [[Talk:Michael Jackson]] (see [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Talk:Michael_Jackson&oldid=881408140#Cultural_impact_of_Michael_Jackson here]). So that is where this RfC comes in. One view is that this is a [[WP:No page]] case and that the article (the latest version seen [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Cultural_impact_of_Michael_Jackson&oldid=881375297 here]) is an unnecessary [[WP:Content fork|content fork]] (and the same goes for [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Michael_Jackson_in_popular_culture&oldid=881303695 a Michael Jackson in popular culture article]) because it's copy and pasted content already covered at the [[Michael Jackson]] article and related articles. When redirected, the page points to the "[[Michael Jackson#Legacy and influence|Legacy and influence]]" section of the Michael Jackson article. With regard to previous incarnations of the article, there have also been [[WP:Synthesis]] and [[WP:FANPAGE]] concerns. The other view is that the page should be an article because Jackson has had a huge cultural impact. Editors have also felt that since the [[Cultural impact of Elvis Presley]], [[Elvis impersonator]], [[Michael Jackson impersonator]] and [[Cultural impact of Madonna]] articles exist, this page should be an article as well. Additionally, editors have talked about fixing up the page so that its existence as an article is justified. 

Thoughts? I will alert the associated WikiProjects to this RfC. [[User:Flyer22 Reborn|Flyer22 Reborn]] ([[User talk:Flyer22 Reborn|talk]]) 11:36, 2 February 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Countries#rfc_7A1E9DC|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Countries]] expired 2019-03-04 22:01 ===

* Date: 2019-02-04 03:43:00

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|881684664|MEDIA 881684664}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|891427803|MEDIA 891427803}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
 There has been a lot of debate about whether or not to include Fletcher in the infobox, but there does not seem to be a clear consensus one way or the other. So should we include Fletcher in the infobox with Singer, or should we just include Singer with a note mentioning that Fletcher took over towards the end of production? <span style="color:green;">[[User:JDDJS|<span style="color:green;">JDDJS</span>]] ([[User talk:JDDJS|<span style="color:purple;">talk to me</span>]] ‚Ä¢ [[Special:Contributions/JDDJS|<span style="color:purple;">see what I've done</span>]])</span> 03:43, 4 February 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Allegheny River Lock and Dam No. 3#rfc_BE37E95|Talk:Allegheny River Lock and Dam No. 3]] expired 2019-03-06 13:01 ===
* Id: BE37E95
* User: Sbalfour
* Date: 2019-03-05 20:17:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|886366045|HIST 886366045}}
* RFC Text:

There are eight articles titled like this one, except for digit ([[Allegheny River Lock and Dam No. 2|2]], [[Allegheny River Lock and Dam No. 3|3]], [[Allegheny River Lock and Dam No. 4|4]], [[Allegheny River Lock and Dam No. 5|5]], [[Allegheny River Lock and Dam No. 6|6]], [[Allegheny River Lock and Dam No. 7|7]], [[Allegheny River Lock and Dam No. 8|8]], or [[Allegheny River Lock and Dam No. 9|9]]).  All are a modest paragraph long, and are such that what is said is likely all that will ever be said.  (You're asking, or looking for dam #1?  No, I didn't forget it.  And none of these articles mentions what happened to it.  Ha! Ha! If all of the dams were listed in one article, I'd add a paragraph on what happened to it; right now, there's no place).  I propose merging them into one article.  The title could be "Allegheny River locks and dams" or "List of locks and dams of the Allegheny River" (similar to [[List of locks and dams of the Ohio River]]).  My experience has been that editors readily or heedlessly split articles, but get contentious about merging them. . These aren't the only dams on the Allegheny, and the proposed merged article could also enumerate those.  It'd make a decent length article.

This merge won't lose any information from the encyclopedia.  It may make information more accessible, since someone looking for one of these will likely have to page back and forth between articles to locate the relevant one.  Especially on a mobile device that only displays one page at a time, that can be very tedious, and load/reload time expensive in elapsed time and data usage. [[User:Sbalfour|Sbalfour]] ([[User talk:Sbalfour|talk]]) 20:17, 5 March 2019 (UTC)}}
