=== [[Talk:List of churches in Sweden#rfc_327B699|Talk:List of churches in Sweden]] expired 2019-03-06 18:01 ===
* Id: 327B699
* User: Aurornisxui
* Date: 2019-02-04 17:31:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|881767405|MEDIA 881767405}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|886501434|MEDIA 886501434}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I would like ideas about the length and depth of this article.

This list was nominated for deletion, the outcone was "keep". I was one of the keep votes. Most everyone who wanted to keep the list commented that it wasn't in any way useful (not as an AfD argument), especially since there were virtually no locations. I have been editing the list and [[User:Aurornisxui/subpage|here]] is what I'm doing (Karlahamn Municipality (the first) is what I have decided on). But the list is massive. I would like some ideas about criteria I might use with the list to winnow out some of the entries. I have searched for other lists of churches, and, as far as I can find, there is no all-encomapssing list of all churches for an entire country. I have already limited the list somewhat by only using Church of Sweden churches. I don't know if I should include cathedrals, chapels, and ruins. I was thinking of making the list only churches recognized by the Swedish National Heritage Board, but that isn't so helpful as they look like they list nearly every church and they list churches from before 1940. Thanks for the help. [[User:Aurornisxui|Aurornisxui]] ([[User talk:Aurornisxui|talk]]) 17:31, 4 February 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_5551A12|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2019-03-10 16:01 ===
* Id: 5551A12
* User: ZiaLater
* Date: 2019-02-11 06:52:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|882774752|MEDIA 882774752}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|882774754|POL 882774754}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|882774757|PROP 882774757}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|887535704|MEDIA 887535704}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|887535708|POL 887535708}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|887535711|PROP 887535711}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
While we are at it, is [[Venezuelanalysis]] a reliable source?

Again, I will suggest the four options:
*'''Option 1:''' Generally [[WP:RS|reliable]] for factual reporting
*'''Option 2:''' Unclear or additional considerations apply
*'''Option 3:''' Generally [[WP:QUESTIONABLE|unreliable]] for factual reporting
*'''Option 4:''' Publishes false or fabricated information, and should be [[WP:DEPS|deprecated]] as in the [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard/Archive 220#Daily Mail RfC|2017 RfC]] of the ''[[Daily Mail]]''

Thank you. ----[[User:ZiaLater|<i style="text-shadow:#C0C0C0 0.2em 0.2em 0.2em; color: ForestGreen">ZiaLater</i>]] ([[User talk:ZiaLater|<span style="color: ForestGreen">talk</span>]]) 06:52, 11 February 2019 (UTC)}}


=== [[Talk:2015‚Äì2019 Iraqi protests#rfc_9A6F80D|Talk:2015‚Äì2019 Iraqi protests]] expired 2019-03-10 19:01 ===
* Id: 9A6F80D
* User: Mikrob√∏lgeovn
* Date: 2019-02-08 18:53:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|882389153|POL 882389153}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|887122089|POL 887122089}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
[[User:Jim7049]] insists that an allegation of American involvement belongs in the infobox. This is a clear violation of [[Wikipedia:Manual of Style/Infoboxes]]: ''When considering any aspect of infobox design, keep in mind the purpose of an infobox: '''to summarize (and not supplant) key facts that appear in the article''' (an article should remain complete with its summary infobox ignored). '''The less information it contains, the more effectively it serves that purpose''', allowing readers to identify key facts at a glance. Of necessity, some infoboxes contain more than just a few fields; however, wherever possible, present information in short form, and '''exclude any unnecessary content'''. Avoid links to sections within the article; the table of contents provides that function.''

Should "alleged" American support for the protestors be mentioned in the infobox? [[User:Mikrob√∏lgeovn|Mikrob√∏lgeovn]] ([[User talk:Mikrob√∏lgeovn|talk]]) 18:53, 8 February 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Michael Jackson#rfc_D0CE825|Talk:Michael Jackson]] expired 2019-03-11 14:01 ===
* Id: D0CE825
* User: Flyer22 Reborn
* Date: 2019-03-11 12:46:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|887245955|BIO 887245955}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|887245956|MEDIA 887245956}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|887245957|SOC 887245957}}
* RFC Text:

This RfC was previously opened for only a few days. It has been reopened for more opinions and a proper close. One view is that the article should be structured so that it has a dedicated section for the child sexual abuse allegations against Jackson. As seen at [[Talk:Michael Jackson#Top level section on allegations of and charges for sexual abuse/crimes?]], this was in the light of the ''[[Leaving Neverland]]'' documentary. It was felt that the ''Leaving Neverland'' material was buried in the article in [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Michael_Jackson&oldid=886956692 this] version, where it was located in the Aftermath section. It was felt that having the ''Leaving Neverland'' material covered with the other child sexual abuse material makes the material more accessible for readers. The other view is that, as noted at [[WP:Criticism]]], controversy or criticism sections can lend undue weight to a matter or draw too much negative attention to a section and therefore result in more POV editing. It was felt that, like WP:Criticism states, "The article should be divided into sections based on topics, timeline, or theme ‚Äì not viewpoint. Negative criticism should be interwoven throughout the topical or thematic sections." This style is reflected in a number of [[WP:Featured]] biographies. And it was suggested that adding a heading to the ''Leaving Neverland'' material would resolve the issue of editors not easily finding the ''Leaving Neverland'' content, and that restructuring the article for the ''Leaving Neverland'' content is or may be [[WP:Recentism]].   
Thoughts? [[User:Flyer22 Reborn|Flyer22 Reborn]] ([[User talk:Flyer22 Reborn|talk]]) 12:46, 11 March 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)#rfc_C634AF2|Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)]] expired 2019-03-13 06:01 ===
* Id: C634AF2
* Date: 2019-02-15 00:05:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|883409842|POLICY 883409842}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|883409845|TECH 883409845}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|883409847|PROP 883409847}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|887530236|POLICY 887530236}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|887530238|TECH 887530238}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|887530241|PROP 887530241}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Social media statistics, such as subscribers, followers, likes, and views may not be used in [[WP:infobox|infoboxes]] or [[MOS:LEAD|lead sections]] and may not be used to establish [[WP:N|notability]]. When it has received significant coverage from an independent [[WP:RS|reliable source]] these statistics may be used sparingly in the body of an article accompanied by the month and year that the number was reported. Best wishes, [[User:Barkeep49|Barkeep49]] ([[User_talk:Barkeep49|talk]]) 00:05, 15 February 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_BCC29A4|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2019-03-13 07:01 ===
* Id: BCC29A4
* User: ZiaLater
* Date: 2019-02-11 08:12:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|882784289|MEDIA 882784289}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|887545246|MEDIA 887545246}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|887545249|POL 887545249}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|887545251|PROP 887545251}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Sorry for the multiple posts. Came across [[TASS]] lately as well. Only a small comment; I've seen in past discussions that TASS has been used only when attribution is used.

*'''Option 1:''' Generally [[WP:RS|reliable]] for factual reporting
*'''Option 2:''' Unclear or additional considerations apply
*'''Option 3:''' Generally [[WP:QUESTIONABLE|unreliable]] for factual reporting
*'''Option 4:''' Publishes false or fabricated information, and should be [[WP:DEPS|deprecated]] as in the [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard/Archive 220#Daily Mail RfC|2017 RfC]] of the ''[[Daily Mail]]''

Again, thank you and this will be my final RfC for some time.----[[User:ZiaLater|<i style="text-shadow:#C0C0C0 0.2em 0.2em 0.2em; color: ForestGreen">ZiaLater</i>]] ([[User talk:ZiaLater|<span style="color: ForestGreen">talk</span>]]) 08:12, 11 February 2019 (UTC)}}

Editors in the discussion above generally agree that this article should display an image of an aircraft similar to the one involved in this accident; no free images are available of the actual aircraft. * Id: 0573C3B
* Date: 2019-03-09 12:07:00

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|886927282|SOC 886927282}}

{{rfcquote|text=

=== [[Talk:Culture of North Macedonia#rfc_5A3B105|Talk:Culture of North Macedonia]] expired 2019-03-16 01:01 ===
* Id: 5A3B105
* User: Future Perfect at Sunrise
* Date: 2019-02-13 23:22:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|883277804|SOC 883277804}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|887967909|SOC 887967909}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Right now, the article purports to refer to the culture of ethnic Macedonians ("Macedonian culture is the culture of the ethnic Macedonian population") and is thus appropriately titled 'Macedonian culture'. However, all the subsections refer to the culture of the country of North Macedonia (Music of North Macedonia, Cinema of North Macedonia etc.) and include many references to things like Islamic architecture and the Manaki brothers (who were Aromanians), which pertain to the country but nor the ethnic group.

On the other hand, there is no reference to anything related to ethnic Macedonians outside of North Macedonia, nor in my view should there be, since this would be covered by articles like [[Macedonian diaspora]] and [[Slavic speakers of Greek Macedonia]].

This is consistent with the practice in other similar articles ([[Culture of Greece]], [[Culture of Montenegro]], [[Culture of Bosnia Herzegovina]] etc.) which all refer to countries and not ethnic groups.  

I, therefore, suggest changing the title to 'Culture of North Macedonia' and adjusting the first sentence accordingly.


: Please start an RfC here if you want to change the long-standing scope of the article. We are having too many hasty, rushed-through changes of too many articles at once in this topic area today. It's been impossible to keep track of things. [[User:Future Perfect at Sunrise|Fut.Perf.]] [[User talk:Future Perfect at Sunrise|‚òº]] 23:22, 13 February 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Good articles#rfc_A08F906|Wikipedia talk:Good articles]] expired 2019-03-16 07:01 ===
* Id: A08F906
* User: Aircorn
* Date: 2019-02-20 08:07:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/WikiProjects_and_collaborations|prev|884225292|PROJ 884225292}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/WikiProjects_and_collaborations|prev|887998830|PROJ 887998830}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Currently when [[WP:Featured articles|Featured articles]] are demoted they are reassessed as class B or lower. Should the [[WP:Good article|Good article]] (GA) class be an option for demoted Featured Articles? See discussion at [[Wikipedia talk:Good articles#Demoted featured articles]] for background. Options include:
#''Status quo'' Class is removed from Demoted Featured articles by a bot
#Demoted Featured articles are automatically assessed as GA class and then put through a [[WP:Good article reassessment|Good article reassessment]] if further demoting might be warranted.
#When demoting a Featured article the coordinators have the added option to assign it as GA class.
[[User:Aircorn|AIR<b style="color: green;">''corn''</b>]]&nbsp;[[User talk:Aircorn|(talk)]] 08:07, 20 February 2019 (UTC)}}

Should "[[Wikipedia:Manual of Style/Accessibility/Alternative text for images|alt-text]]" be a requirement for all FAs? === [[Wikipedia:Naming conventions (Macedonia)/2019 RFC#rfc_953A48D|Wikipedia:Naming conventions (Macedonia)/2019 RFC]] expired 2019-03-17 19:01 ===
* Id: 953A48D
* Date: 2019-02-15 18:31:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|883983086|HIST 883983086}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|883983093|POL 883983093}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|883983102|STYLE 883983102}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|883983104|POLICY 883983104}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|888222910|HIST 888222910}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|888222916|POL 888222916}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|888222920|STYLE 888222920}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|888222921|POLICY 888222921}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Due to the [[Prespa agreement]], the [[Republic of Macedonia]] has been renamed to the Republic of North Macedonia. In June 2018, the Arbitration Committee [[Wikipedia:Requests for arbitration/Macedonia 2#Motion (June 2018)|authorised]] an RFC to change [[Wikipedia:Naming conventions (Macedonia)|the naming conventions for Macedonia]]. Now that the name change has occurred, we should consider what the changes should be. 18:31, 15 February 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Awards#rfc_FF10B03|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Awards]] expired 2019-03-18 16:01 ===

* User: Guilherme Burn
* Date: 2019-02-16 15:59:00

The purpose of this RfC is to discuss which categories of an adult award are notable. Which articles should be created? Which should be excluded? Which categories are encyclopedic and which ones fall into [[WP:NOT]] and should be taken from articles? There is a [[Gender bias on Wikipedia]], since there are AVN articles of Best Actress, Best Supporting Actress, Actress Female Performer of the Year, but there are none about actors, directors or films?

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Politics#rfc_904E37E|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Politics]] expired 2019-03-20 08:01 ===
* Id: 904E37E
* User: VarunSoon
* Date: 2019-02-18 07:42:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|888612453|POL 888612453}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|895758130|POL 895758130}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There are disagreements about the input for the 'political position' parameter of the infoboxes of political parties. See for example [[Talk:Liberal Party of Canada#Drop "Center-Left"]], [[Talk:Democratic Party (United States)#Political position discussion]], [[Talk:Labour Party (UK)#Centre-left to left wing]]. I have also heard that there have been edit wars over this issue (see [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Politics#Removing the 'political position' field from the party infobox]]).

The issue was also discussed at [[Wikipedia:Village_pump_(idea_lab)/Archive_27#Political_position]]. The question is whether this parameter should be removed. [[User:VarunSoon|VarunSoon]] ([[User talk:VarunSoon|talk]]) 07:42, 18 February 2019 (UTC)}}

* Id: 34C432E
* User: Snooganssnoogans

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the following text be added to this article?:

* Ernst's relationship with [[Steve King]], a House Representative known for his racially charged rhetoric and support for far-right politicians, has stirred controversy. In 2016 when King faced a primary challenge for his House seat, Ernst endorsed him, saying he "stands strong for life and liberty."<ref name=":12">{{Cite web|url=https://www.thegazette.com/subject/news/government/joni-ernst-endorses-steve-king-in-iowa-4th-district-20160425|title=Joni Ernst endorses Steve King in Iowa 4th District|last=Lynch|first=James Q.|website=The Gazette|access-date=2018-12-22}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://nymag.com/intelligencer/2019/01/steve-kings-racism-didnt-use-to-bother-republicans.html|title=Republicans Have Tolerated Steve King‚Äôs Racism for a Long Time|last=Kilgore|first=Ed|date=2019-01-14|website=Intelligencer|language=en|access-date=2019-02-18}}</ref> When King stirred controversy in 2017 by saying "we can‚Äôt restore our civilization with somebody else‚Äôs babies" and by supporting European far-right politicians, Ernst said she did not condone King's behavior but she would not ask for his resignation.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.politico.com/story/2017/03/joni-ernst-steve-king-babies-tweet-236203|title=Ernst declines to ask for King's resignation over 'babies' tweet|last=Everett|first=Burgess|website=POLITICO|language=en|access-date=2018-12-22}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://thehill.com/blogs/blog-briefing-room/news/324640-ernst-refuses-to-ask-for-king-to-resign-after-babies-tweet|title=Ernst declines to ask for King to resign after 'babies' tweet|last=Greenwood|first=Max|date=2017-03-18|website=TheHill|language=en|access-date=2018-12-22}}</ref> In 2017, the ''[[The Des Moines Register|Des Moines Register]]'' wrote a scathing editorial against King, which criticized Ernst for endorsing him in the past and not condemning him.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/the-fix/wp/2017/03/14/editorial-blasts-gop-for-denouncing-steve-kings-rhetoric-but-supporting-his-election/?utm_term=.7d007f44c97e|title=The Des Moines Register just went off on Steve King|last=|first=|date=2018|work=The Washington Post|access-date=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.desmoinesregister.com/story/opinion/editorials/2017/03/13/editorial-gop-needs-oppose-kings-re-election-not-just-kings-words/99134588/|title=Editorial: GOP needs to oppose King's re-election, not just King's words|website=Des Moines Register|language=en|access-date=2019-02-18}}</ref> In 2018, she appeared with King at a rally in his district after King had endorsed a Canadian politician with neo-Nazi ties.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2019/01/11/us/politics/steve-king-republicans-white-supremacy-.html|title=Steve King‚Äôs White Supremacy Remark Is Rebuked by Iowa‚Äôs Republican Senators|last=Gabriel|first=Trip|date=2019-01-11|work=The New York Times|access-date=2019-02-18|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}}</ref> In 2019, amid extensive criticism of King by Republican politicians after King made controversial remarks about white supremacy, Ernst rebuked him.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2019/01/14/us/politics/steve-king-white-supremacy.html|title=Steve King Removed From Committee Assignments Over White Supremacy Remark|last=Gabriel|first=Trip|date=2019-01-14|work=The New York Times|access-date=2019-02-18|last2=Martin|first2=Jonathan|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331|last3=Fandos|first3=Nicholas}}</ref> ''The New York Times'' wrote that Ernst's belated distancing to King might harm her 2020 re-election efforts, as she previously "had spent years embracing Mr. King."<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2019/01/17/us/politics/steve-king-iowa-supporters-white-supremacy.html|title=Steve King Still Has Backing in Iowa, but Even Supporters Say ‚ÄòHe‚Äôs Done‚Äô|last=Gabriel|first=Trip|date=2019-01-17|work=The New York Times|access-date=2019-02-18|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}}</ref> Art Cullen, editor of [[Storm Lake Times|The Storm Lake Times]], condemned the belated response by Ernst, describing it as "hypocrisy" for her to condemn him only weeks after campaigning with him and when his views had been well-known for a long time.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2019/jan/15/steve-king-republicans-iowa-hypocrisy|title=The epic hypocrisy of Republicans' sudden distaste for Steve King {{!}} Art Cullen|last=Cullen|first=Art|date=2019-01-15|work=The Guardian|access-date=2019-02-18|language=en-GB|issn=0261-3077}}</ref> The editorial board of the ''Des Moines Register'' questioned why it took national condemnation for Ernst to rebuke King.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.desmoinesregister.com/story/opinion/columnists/rekha-basu/2019/01/15/grassley-ernst-reynolds-steve-king-congressman-republicans/2578751002/|title=Why did it take national condemnation for Grassley, Ernst, Reynolds to call out King?|website=Des Moines Register|language=en|access-date=2019-02-18}}</ref>

{{reflist-talk}}

Please indicate whether you '''support''' or '''oppose''' something similar to the above text, along with your reasoning. [[User:Snooganssnoogans|Snooganssnoogans]] ([[User talk:Snooganssnoogans|talk]]) 13:47, 18 February 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Toledo steel#rfc_E22CD30|Talk:Toledo steel]] expired 2019-03-22 05:01 ===
* Id: E22CD30
* User: Depurplecow
* Date: 2019-03-20 16:21:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|888668587|SCI 888668587}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|888912457|SCI 888912457}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The entire article contains redundancy, unclear meaning, no/improper citations and contains unattributed claims that are are false or misleading.


Key points:

- How does a hard and flexible weapon benefit against armor?

- "most sought after weapon"

- Implies the difficult and long process makes the swords "powerful", not specific portions of the process

- mentions having material properties of both hard and soft steel, but not what they are

- "absolute best"

- "Damascus and Tamahagane steels were created in hopes of being better than Toledo steel, but that was not the case" As far as I'm aware those steels were created independently, not with the intent of recreating/surpassing another like Bulat steel made by Anosov was.

- "Damascus steel was not at all flexible" It was historically believed to be very flexible.

Overall reads like a middle schooler's essay, and may need to be rewritten.
[[User:Depurplecow|Depurplecow]] ([[User talk:Depurplecow|talk]]) 16:21, 20 March 2019 (UTC)}}

{{rfcquote|text=
The article mentions that actress Claudia Cardinale was the ‚Äúmistress‚Äù of the producer of the film, Franco Cristaldi. Other sources, among which our articles [[Claudia Cardinale]] and [[Franco Cristaldi]], as well as most any movie encyclopedia and other reference works, such as [http://www.treccani.it/enciclopedia/claudia-cardinale_%28Enciclopedia-del-Cinema%29/ Treccani encyclopedia], and the book Enrico D'Anna, <i>Volo & cinema. Storia del cinema d'aviazione</i>, Edizioni De Luca, Rome 1997 (p. 72), talking specifically about this film, say that they were married before 1969, the film's year.

Another editor, [[User:Galassi|Galassi]], has reverted twice, on different occasions, my edits in this regard, on the basis of a single web page in Russian about one of the screenwriters of the film. In the latest edit I had left both versions, ‚Äúmistress‚Äù and wife, and added D'Anna's book as a source, but was reverted too. * RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Please indicate which of the following should be in the article: (prior discussion [[Talk:Antisemitism in the UK Labour Party/Archive 8#29 Rabbis - hoax?]]

'''A''': <blockquote>In September 2018, an open letter was signed by 29 [[rabbi]]s from London [[Haredi]] communities stating that they were "shocked to learn about those that are claiming in the media that the Jews of Britain are outraged towards the Labour Party‚Äôs respected leader, Jeremy Corbyn", and went on to state that they had "no connection whatsoever" with what they described as "these irresponsible remarks". The letter was reproduced by a Twitter account calling itself "True Torah Jews" which is linked to the anti-Zionist [[Satmar]] [[Hasidic]] group.<ref name="Harkov">{{cite web |last=Harkov |first=Lahav |title=Anti-Israel Satmar Group Forges UK Rabbis' Pro-Corbyn Letter |url=https://www.jpost.com/Diaspora/Antisemitism/Anti-Israel-Satmar-group-forges-UK-rabbis-pro-Corbyn-letter-567022 |publisher=Jerusalem Post |accessdate=12 September 2018}}</ref> The authenticity of the signatories was initially dismissed as fake by the Jewish Community Council of North London,<ref name="Harkov"/> but they later backed down.<ref name="Welch2">{{cite web |last1=Welch |first1=Ben |title=Charedi rabbis' letter defending Jeremy Corbyn is genuine, insist activists |url=https://www.thejc.com/news/uk-news/charedi-jeremy-corbyn-labour-antisemitism-letter-signed-by-rabbis-1.469880 |publisher=Jewish Chronicle |accessdate=17 September 2018}}</ref> However, the two activists who took responsibility for the letter, Shraga Stern and Naftoli Friedman, said it is genuine and claimed to have gained an extra five signatures since the letter was published, taking the total to 34.<ref name="Welch2"/></blockquote>

'''B''': <blockquote>In September 2018, an open letter signed by 29 [[rabbi]]s from London [[Haredi]] communities stated they were "shocked to learn about those that are claiming in the media that the Jews of Britain are outraged towards the Labour Party‚Äôs respected leader, Jeremy Corbyn", and went on to state that they had "no connection whatsoever" with what they described as "these irresponsible remarks".<ref name="Welch2">{{cite web |last1=Welch |first1=Ben |title=Charedi rabbis' letter defending Jeremy Corbyn is genuine, insist activists |url=https://www.thejc.com/news/uk-news/charedi-jeremy-corbyn-labour-antisemitism-letter-signed-by-rabbis-1.469880 |publisher=Jewish Chronicle |accessdate=17 September 2018}}</ref></blockquote>

'''C''': <blockquote>In September 2018, a letter organized by London [[Haredi]] activist Shraga Stern in defense of Corbyn decried "fake antisemitism smears". While pro-Corbyn campaigners utilized the letter, Stern himself was condemned for saying he had the support of a large block of Stamford Hill's Haredi community by leaders of the community who said he did not speak for the community. In the January 2019 [[Holocaust Memorial Day (UK)|Holocaust Memorial Day Trust event]], after a photo was circulated of Corbyn with Stern and Stamford Hill Jewish Community Council founder Levi Schapiro, Schapiro said he was "unexpectedly dragged" into the photo and that "I don't support Corbyn and never did.".<ref>[https://www.thejc.com/news/uk-news/corbyn-hmd-row-over-claims-charedi-men-dragged-into-photos-1.479182 Jeremy Corbyn in Holocaust Memorial Day row over claims Charedi men 'dragged' into photos], Jewish Chronicle, 27 January 2019, Lee Harpin</ref></blockquote>

'''D''': Nothing at all.
{{ref-talk}}
Please indicate A, B, C, or D (or specify a ranked preference), stand state a reason.13:14, 21 February 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Criteria for speedy deletion#rfc_66F0023|Wikipedia talk:Criteria for speedy deletion]] expired 2019-03-23 19:01 ===
* Id: 66F0023
* User: Anachronist
* Date: 2019-03-13 22:59:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|888230794|POLICY 888230794}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|888230796|PROP 888230796}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|892213290|POLICY 892213290}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|892213293|PROP 892213293}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Currently [[WP:G5|G5]] is actionable for articles created by editors violating a block or ban. This is a ''personal'' block or ban: "To qualify, the edit must be a violation of the user's specific block or ban."

Well, an undisclosed paid editor is "banned" from editing, not by Wikipedia policy but by the WMF's Terms of Use. This ban isn't directed at any specific editor, but editing without disclosing payment is blockable.

A discussion on the OTRS mailing list suggests that it would make sense, as an additional deterrent, to treat articles created by such editors as any other G5 article, but the wording of G5 would need to change.

We have the Terms of Use, and we have G5, and the purpose of G5 seems like a good fit for enforcing the Terms of Use ban on undisclosed paid editing.

I suggest adding after the bullet list in G5:
:"In addition, because undisclosed paid editing is prohibited by Wikimedia Foundation policy, articles created by undisclosed paid editors are candidates for speedy deletion under G5."
Or an alternative suggested by Cryptic below:
:"In addition, because undisclosed paid editing is prohibited by Wikimedia Foundation policy, articles created by editors who have been indef-blocked for undisclosed paid editing are candidates for speedy deletion under G5."
What say everyone? ~[[User:Anachronist|Anachronist]] <small>([[User talk:Anachronist|talk]])</small> 22:59, 13 March 2019 (UTC)}}


=== [[Wikipedia talk:Criteria for speedy deletion#rfc_206252D|Wikipedia talk:Criteria for speedy deletion]] expired 2019-03-23 19:01 ===
* Id: 206252D
* User: Zackmann08
* Date: 2019-02-21 18:41:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|884453462|POLICY 884453462}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|889138483|POLICY 889138483}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should a new CSD criteria (<s>T4</s><u>T5</u>) be added for unused templates that meet the following criteria:
* '''Template is not used anywhere''', I.E. has zero transclusions excluding templates own documentation of course. 
* '''Template is NOT a substitute only template.''' Should go without saying but templates that are substitute only by definition should never have transclusions, doesn't mean the template can been speedily deleted.
* '''Template is older than 6 months.''' No speedily deleting a new template that hasn't been used just yet.
* '''Template is NOT a sometimes unused/temporary template.''' An example of this would be {{tl|help me}} which may have 0 transclusions at any given moment. 
Please discuss. --'''[[User:Zackmann08|<span style="color:#00ced1">Zack</span><span style="color:#007F94">mann</span>]]''' (<sup>[[User_talk:Zackmann08|Talk to me]]</sup>/<sub>[[Special:Contributions/Zackmann08|<span style="color:orange;">What I been doing</span>]]</sub>) 18:41, 21 February 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Talk pages consultation 2019#rfc_D72E76A|Wikipedia:Talk pages consultation 2019]] expired 2019-03-25 15:01 ===
* Id: D72E76A
* User: Jc86035
* Date: 2019-02-23 14:28:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/WikiProjects_and_collaborations|prev|884716257|PROJ 884716257}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|884716260|TECH 884716260}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/WikiProjects_and_collaborations|prev|889412503|PROJ 889412503}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|889412506|TECH 889412506}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
On 21 February 2019, the WMF informed various Wikimedia projects of [[:mw:Talk pages consultation 2019|the 2019 talk pages consultation]].

{{quote|The '''Talk pages consultation''' is a global consultation planned from February to June 2019, to bring Wikimedians and wiki-minded people together to define better tools for wiki communication. The consultation will seek input from as many different parts of the Wikimedia community as possible ‚Äì on multiple projects, in multiple languages, and with multiple perspectives ‚Äì to come up with a product direction for a set of communication features that a product team will be able to work on in the coming fiscal year.|[[:mw:Talk pages consultation 2019]]}}

An explicit objective of the consultation is to change communication on Wikimedia projects in some way, because the present wikitext communication system [[:mw:Talk pages consultation 2019#Purpose of the consultation|effectively forms a cultural barrier for new contributors, in spite of its flexibility and transparency]]. In enumerating various possible outcomes and solutions, the consultation page [[:mw:Talk pages consultation 2019#Possible solutions|notes]]: "For this process to work, we need to be open to all kinds of directions."

In this stage of the consultation, the WMF [[:mw:Talk pages consultation 2019#Phase 1: Collect information|suggests asking community members five questions]]. There are therefore five subsections for each of those questions (under [[#Suggested questions|¬ß Suggested questions]]). It may also be appropriate for other issues to be considered on this page, in separate subsections (under [[#Other topics|¬ß Other topics]]). [[User:Jc86035|Jc86035]] ([[User talk:Jc86035|talk]]) 14:28, 23 February 2019 (UTC)}}

Should the last paragraph of the section [[Ilhan Omar#Israeli‚ÄìPalestinian conflict]] be removed or kept?[[User:Legobot|Legobot]] ([[User talk:Legobot|talk]]) 12:01, 26 March 2019 (UTC)
-->

''' Neutrality (or lack of) in section titles '''

We have one major section with three subsections titled ''Targeting'' -- this is a valid POV to have but it is not valid to present it in Wikipedia's voice. Additionally, we have a section on her views on ''Militarism'' -- this is not an NPOV term regarding the existence of US military bases as the other side would say something like ''mutual defense responsibilities''. --[[User:Calthinus|Calthinus]] ([[User talk:Calthinus|talk]]) 18:21, 24 March 2019 (UTC)}}

'''Proposal:''' Create a [[WP:PROD|proposed deletion]] criterion for portals created on April 8, 2018 or later by any user. Per normal PROD rules, the page would be deleted after 7 days, but a user who objects to the deletion may remove the prod template. However, unlike regular PROD, the creator would not be allowed to remove the template (though they would of course be allowed to contest it on the talk page). ‚Äî[[User:pythoncoder|<span style="border-radius:10px;background:blue"><span style="color:aqua">¬†python</span><span style="color:#ff0">coder¬†</span></span>]] ([[User talk:pythoncoder|talk]]¬†&#124;¬†[[Special:Contribs/pythoncoder|contribs]]) 21:58, 22 March 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject United States#rfc_B75319D|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject United States]] expired 2019-03-30 17:01 ===

* User: ImprovedWikiImprovment

#The cited guideline itself uses the word "''may''" in italics, suggesting it is optional
#The flags don‚Äôt add to the article in an encyclopedic way
#The flags bring unnecessary attention to the parameters (city and state)
I‚Äôd like to see the community's opinion once and for all of what would be preferred, as there is an overall mixture of both with and without flags on U.S. city articles. === [[Talk:Gab (social network)#rfc_C2BDBB1|Talk:Gab (social network)]] expired 2019-03-31 04:01 ===
* Id: C2BDBB1
* User: GorillaWarfare
* Date: 2019-03-01 03:25:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|885611800|POL 885611800}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|890247507|POL 890247507}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_E6F9191|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2019-04-01 04:01 ===
* Id: E6F9191
* User: Jamez42
* Date: 2019-03-08 23:12:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|886856488|MEDIA 886856488}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|886856495|POL 886856495}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|886856498|PROP 886856498}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|890404445|MEDIA 890404445}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|890404446|POL 890404446}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|890404450|PROP 890404450}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There is another main Venezuelan source I would like to propose to discuss, Aporrea.

As in previous discussions, I will suggest four options:
*'''Option 1:''' Generally [[WP:RS|reliable]] for factual reporting
*'''Option 2:''' Unclear or additional considerations apply
*'''Option 3:''' Generally [[WP:QUESTIONABLE|unreliable]] for factual reporting
*'''Option 4:''' Publishes false or fabricated information, and should be [[WP:DEPS|deprecated]] as in the [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard/Archive 220#Daily Mail RfC|2017 RfC]] of the ''[[Daily Mail]]''

Many thanks in avance. --[[User:Jamez42|Jamez42]] ([[User talk:Jamez42|talk]]) 23:12, 8 March 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Muhammad#rfc_10E007D|Talk:Muhammad]] expired 2019-04-01 21:01 ===

{{rfcquote|text=
== The name of the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) '''

Peace Be Upon Him (PBUH) or Sallallahu Alaihi Wasallam (SAW) (ÿµŸÑŸâ ÿßŸÑŸÑŸá ÿπŸÑŸäŸá Ÿà ÿ≥ŸÑŸÖ) MUST be included in braces in front of the name of the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) or wikipedia might be regarded as one-sided online article publisher.

We urge you to please take effect of the corrections immediately. 

We really appreciate your effort in trying to get the correct information from reliable sources.

Thank you [[User:Abdurrahman Imam|Abdurrahman Imam]] ([[User talk:Abdurrahman Imam|talk]]) 06:18, 21 March 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Administrators' noticeboard#rfc_EE4F464|Wikipedia:Administrators' noticeboard]] expired 2019-04-02 05:01 ===
* Id: EE4F464
* User: Robert McClenon
* Date: 2019-03-03 04:21:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|888215105|POLICY 888215105}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|888215109|PROP 888215109}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|890573876|POLICY 890573876}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|890573879|PROP 890573879}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I am entering and numbering this proposal in order to get it into the record, but am requesting that action on it be deferred until the current round of MFDs are decided.

As per [[User:UnitedStatesian]], Create [[WP:CSD|Criteria for Speedy Deletion]] criterion X3, for portals created by [[User:The Transhumanist]] between April 2018 and March 2019.  Tagging the portals for speedy deletion will provide the notice to users of the portals, if there are any users of the portals.  I recommend that instructions to administrators include a request to wait 24 hours before deleting a portal.  This is a compromise between the usual 1 to 4 hours for speedy deletion and 7 days for XFD.  The availability of Twinkle for one-click tagging will make it easy to tag the pages, while notifying the users (if there are any).  [[User:Robert McClenon|Robert McClenon]] ([[User talk:Robert McClenon|talk]]) 04:21, 3 March 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Article titles#rfc_D2FF9DB|Wikipedia talk:Article titles]] expired 2019-04-02 09:01 ===
* Id: D2FF9DB
* User: NorthPark1417
* Date: 2019-03-31 01:06:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|890237216|POLICY 890237216}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|890592776|POLICY 890592776}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Hello, I am the writer of [[NGHTCRWLRS]]. It was moved to Nghtcrwlrs and changed at every instance in the article. it has never been printed as such in a source.

If every source (or most) report it as NGHTCRWLRS, it should be reflected here since Wikipedia does not infringe on artistic style, nor allow original research. This is apparent at [[iPod]], [[Guns N' Roses]], [[NSYNC]] (supported in its state by [[backronym]]), [[M√∂tley Cr√ºe]], [[k.d. lang]] and the existence of {{tl|lowercasetitle}}, instead of [[Ipod]], [[Guns n' Roses]], [[Nsync]], [[Motley Crue]], [[K.D. Lang]]. The guideline should allow for this naming. There should be an equivalent {{tl|uppercasetitle}}. This circumstance is not short living; this specific topic is reported at major media outlets such as [https://www.pastemagazine.com/articles/2016/05/10-great-bands-with-all-caps-no-vowel-names.html Paste Magazine], [https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/7460886/band-names-no-vowels-explained Billboard Magazine] - [[User:NorthPark1417|NorthPark1417]] ([[User talk:NorthPark1417|talk]]) 01:06, 31 March 2019 (UTC)}}

{{rfcquote|text=
How should the two principal positions about when centuries begin and end in modern times be described. The current article states "One is based on strict construction, while the other is based on popular perspective (general usage)" and has similar language in other parts of the article. But it is not clear that the sources aligned with the so-called "strict" view have any authority with which to impose strictness. * User: ModerateMike729
* Date: 2019-03-05 00:03:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:

{{rfcquote|text=
Would editors support the inclusion of the following sentences (or something similar--feel free to suggest changes) in the lede:  ''Omar has been accused of antisemitism by both Democrats and Republicans as well as Jewish civil rights groups for comments about Israel which they said perpetuated the [[Antisemitic canard#Dual loyalty|antisemitic canards that Jews have dual loyalty]], a charge which Omar has denied.'' There are a large range of secondary sources that corroborate this: [https://www.washingtonpost.com/powerpost/rep-omars-comments-prompt-house-democrats-to-craft-anti-semitism-measure/2019/03/04/1a4d8c12-3ea8-11e9-922c-64d6b7840b82_story.html WaPo], [https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/01/us/politics/ilhan-omar-israel.html NYT], [https://nypost.com/2019/03/04/jewish-groups-want-ilhan-omar-dropped-from-foreign-affairs-committee/ NYP], [https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/congress/rep-ilhan-omar-criticized-again-what-critics-call-anti-semitism-n978521 NBC], or whichever others editors see fit. === [[Wikipedia talk:Did you know#rfc_2A9D4DB|Wikipedia talk:Did you know]] expired 2019-04-04 02:01 ===
* Id: 2A9D4DB
* User: Narutolovehinata5
* Date: 2019-03-11 00:33:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/WikiProjects_and_collaborations|prev|887169044|PROJ 887169044}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|887169046|PROP 887169046}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/WikiProjects_and_collaborations|prev|890867647|PROJ 890867647}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|890867649|PROP 890867649}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Currently, [[WP:DYKSG#C6]] reads:
{{quote|C6: If the subject is a work of fiction or a fictional character, the hook must involve the real world in some way.}}

I am proposing that this be modified to read as (changes in italics):
{{quote|C6: If the subject is a work of fiction or a fictional character, the hook ''should ideally'' involve the real world in some way; ''however, in-universe hooks may be permitted on a case-by-case basis if consensus decides that such a hook is the most interesting and/or when the real world information in the article is considered not suitable for a hook. Such hooks must make it clear that the hook content is fictional and should not present facts in an in-universe manner.''}}

An example of a hook that would fit under this proposed change would go like {{tq|... that in the film '''''Movie X''''', Earth is depicted as a cold wasteland that has been taken over by Martians?}}. This will not necessarily mean that we should do away with requiring real world hooks for fictional material, merely that in-universe hooks ''may'' be allowed sometimes. This proposal could also help out with the problem that sometimes reviewers cannot determine if a fact is in-universe or not (for example, in video game hooks, do gameplay mechanics count as in-universe or not?). [[User:Narutolovehinata5|Narutolovehinata5]] <sup>[[User talk:Narutolovehinata5|t]][[Special:Contributions/Narutolovehinata5|c]][[WP:CSD|csd]][[Special:Newpages|new]]</sup> 00:33, 11 March 2019 (UTC)}}

* RFC Text:

=== [[Talk:List of music considered the worst#rfc_B58A26A|Talk:List of music considered the worst]] expired 2019-04-05 22:01 ===
* Id: B58A26A
* User: Wanna Know My Name? Later
* Date: 2019-03-06 21:25:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|886534843|MEDIA 886534843}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|891134067|MEDIA 891134067}}
* RFC Text:

The album [[Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band]], by [[The Beatles|the Beatles]], is in this article. According to many Wikipedians, this album should not be included, since it is considered one of the best albums of all time; at the same time, other Wikipedians argue that this album has been named as one of the worst by some sources. Instead of reverting our edits again and again, I propose you answer the question:

"Should the album Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band be included in the article List of music considered the worst?"

With the answer '''Yes''' or '''No''', accompanied by your reasons. <font face="Verdana">[[User:Wanna Know My Name? Later|WKMN? Later]] </font><font face="Tahoma" size="1">[ [[User talk:Wanna Know My Name? Later|Let's talk]] ]</font> 21:25, 6 March 2019 (UTC)}}
{{rfcquote|text=
}}

=== [[Talk:List of film spoofs in Mad#rfc_83580DE|Talk:List of film spoofs in Mad]] expired 2019-04-09 03:01 ===
* Id: 83580DE
* User: TenPoundHammer
* Date: 2019-03-10 02:12:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|887023797|MEDIA 887023797}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|891615916|MEDIA 891615916}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This comment applies to both [[List of television show spoofs in Mad]] and [[List of film spoofs in Mad]]. <s>'''Is the inclusion of the artist and writer running afoul of [[WP:IINFO]]?''' Especially since there are many occasions from the mid-1980s onward where the artist and/or writer worked under a pseudonym (for instance, thanks to inside contacts on a Facebook group, I have been told that several names on the TV list are actually pseudonyms of [[Arnie Kogen]], who used the pen names because of his additional prolificacy as a television script writer). A couple other names on the list are pseudonyms of ''some''one, but there is no clear information as to whom these pen names belong, nor have they been verified in any reliable sources. So should the artist/writer section be done away with entirely?</s> '''Should the artist/writer credits be done away with?''' Many of the artists and writers don't seem to pass [[WP:GNG]], and there are multiple instances of pen names -- however, I know of the pen names only through personal contact, and cannot directly verify any pen names without violating [[WP:OR]]. <span style="color:green">'''Ten Pound Hammer'''</span> ‚Ä¢ <sup>([[User talk:TenPoundHammer|What did I screw up now?]])</sup> 02:12, 10 March 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:1976 Tangshan earthquake#rfc_761033D|Talk:1976 Tangshan earthquake]] expired 2019-04-09 20:01 ===
* Id: 761033D
* Date: 2019-03-10 19:22:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|887130241|HIST 887130241}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|887130247|STYLE 887130247}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|891728311|HIST 891728311}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|891728318|STYLE 891728318}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should reported death figures for a historical event use boldface, emphasis, or any other type of typographic or semantic emphasis? The editors <s>and</s> <u>are</u> unsure of the options and standards. One editor is against the use of boldface per [[MOS:NOBOLD]] and advocates for the use of italics or {{tl|em}}, while the other editor would like a typographic way to highlight the death figures as indices. See [[Talk:1976 Tangshan earthquake#Bold vs emphasis|the above section]] for past discussion and additional proposed alternatives. 19:22, 10 March 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Culture of the United States#rfc_F186784|Talk:Culture of the United States]] expired 2019-04-12 01:01 ===
* Id: F186784
* User: ElectroChip123
* Date: 2019-03-27 15:10:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|889732000|HIST 889732000}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|889732004|MEDIA 889732004}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|889732006|POL 889732006}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|889732009|RELI 889732009}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|889732015|SOC 889732015}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|892074458|HIST 892074458}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|892074462|MEDIA 892074462}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|892074464|POL 892074464}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|892074467|RELI 892074467}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|892074468|SOC 892074468}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
 
{{tq|I propose to merge [[Sexuality in the United States]] into [[Culture of the United States]]. I think that the content of Sexuality in the United States can easily be explained in the context of the Culture of the United States, and the Culture of the United States article is of a reasonable size that the merging of Sexuality in the United States will not cause any problems as far as article size is concerned. Plus, it makes sense to include it with the other elements of culture (such as marriage).}} All of the content in the "sexuality in the united states" can be fit into it's culture, religion, and marriage pages. That said, like culture, religion and marriage have an effect on it, and as such, it is more related to our culture. Hence, I am proposing to merge it into "Culture of the United States" over the other two options. [[User:ElectroChip123|ElectroChip123]] ([[User talk:ElectroChip123|talk]]) 15:10, 27 March 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Mary Kay Letourneau#rfc_9E4B2C3|Talk:Mary Kay Letourneau]] expired 2019-04-14 03:01 ===
* Id: 9E4B2C3
* User: Flyer22 Reborn
* Date: 2019-03-15 02:09:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|887829736|BIO 887829736}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|887829740|MEDIA 887829740}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|887829743|SOC 887829743}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|892374378|BIO 892374378}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|892374381|MEDIA 892374381}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|892374383|SOC 892374383}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
One view is that since many or most reliable sources state that Fualaau was 12 at the time, while other sources state that he was 13, we should either go with age 12 or state "12 or 13." This view argues that we should do either per [[WP:Due weight]]. The other view is that going with age 12 is more "titillating" and that we should go with age 13 because it is being "conservative." This argument is made per [[WP:BLP]] stating that "Biographies of living persons ('BLPs') must be written conservatively and with regard for the subject's privacy." A counterargument regarding the interpretation of "conservative" was also made. 

For those seeing this from the RfC page, see [[Talk:Mary Kay Letourneau#age of victim]] for more discussion on the matter. [[User:Flyer22 Reborn|Flyer22 Reborn]] ([[User talk:Flyer22 Reborn|talk]]) 02:09, 15 March 2019 (UTC)}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|890996317|BIO 890996317}}

As mentioned above, just in terms of pure word count, the coverage of this single incident makes up over 53% of the article length. The potential split of this [[WP:EVENT|event]] into a separate article was discussed in a previous RfC (above) and should therefore require consensus in a new RfC to come to a different decision. Since March 1st, this subsection of the article has grown by 56%. All the same arguments apply: the event meets [[WP:GNG]], [[WP:SUMMARY]] and [[WP:EVENT]]. Those who !voted some variation of "wait to split," have you changed your minds now that it has grown to overshadow most of the rest of the article content? [[User:AlexEng|<span style="color:#00C5CD">'''Alex'''</span><span style="color:#9CBA7F">'''Eng'''</span>]]<sup><small style="font-size:80%;">([[User_talk:AlexEng|<span style="color:#FF83FA">TALK</span>]])</small></sup> 22:11, 4 April 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Chronic prostatitis/chronic pelvic pain syndrome#rfc_5A7E23D|Talk:Chronic prostatitis/chronic pelvic pain syndrome]] expired 2019-04-14 11:01 ===
* Id: 5A7E23D
* Date: 2019-03-15 10:22:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|887871202|SCI 887871202}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|892415003|SCI 892415003}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The source says "prostatitis [is] more accurately diagnosed [as] pelvic floor dysfunction. This alternative paradigm suggests pelvic pain arises from chronic pelvic floor irritation initiated by anxiety-provoked chronic muscular guarding of the pelvic floor leading to pelvic floor hypertonicity. This behavioral complex perpetuates a self-feeding cycle of pelvic tissue irritation, tension, pain, and anxiety."

;Proposal 1
One proposal is that CP/CPPS is a [[psychological]] as well as a [[neuromuscular disorder]].<ref name=And2018/> The suggestion is that anxiety results in long term contraction of the pelvic floor muscles which results in pain.<ref name=And2018/> The pain results in further anxiety and thus worsening of the condition.<ref name=And2018/>

;Proposal 2
One theory is that CPPS is caused by chronic tension in the pelvic floor musculature. Long-term contraction of the pelvic floor muscles results in tissue irritation, spasm, damage, and pain. This chronic tension of the pelvic floor muscles is often the result of muscular guarding, caused by anxiety. It can become a self-reinforcing cycle, whereby pain and anxiety caused by the condition can cause further pelvic floor muscle tension, thereby worsening the condition.

10:22, 15 March 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Requests for adminship#rfc_4ECEC7C|Wikipedia talk:Requests for adminship]] expired 2019-04-14 16:01 ===
* Id: 4ECEC7C
* Date: 2019-04-13 00:38:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|892225046|POLICY 892225046}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|892446467|POLICY 892446467}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I haven't posted here in nearly three years. I hoped to never do so again. But with my 2015 reforms now front and center, we need to settle this. Get to the point and have a straight up-or-down RfC on bureaucrat discretion.

'''Question''': ''Should the discretion of bureaucrats in Requests for Adminship be absolutely confined to the range between 65% and 75% (inclusive) raw support, with no exceptions and, for this sole purpose, notwithstanding any other Wikipedia principle, policy and/or guideline that might be interpreted as permitting otherwise?''  

If your answer to the above is "yes," support. If your answer is "no," oppose.

For supporters, also specify whether rounding is acceptable. Does anything from 64.50% to 64.99%, or anything from 75.01% to 75.49%, fall within the discretionary range?

[[User_talk:Biblioworm#top|Biblio]] ([[User_talk:Biblioworm#top|talk]])  00:38, 13 April 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Requests for adminship#rfc_46626C1|Wikipedia talk:Requests for adminship]] expired 2019-04-14 19:01 ===
* Id: 46626C1
* User: WereSpielChequers
* Date: 2019-04-14 10:01:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|892415006|POLICY 892415006}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|892467931|POLICY 892467931}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Whether on not the Crats have discretion outside the 65%-75% discretionary zone, there are various things that have been posited as factors that crats should or should not take into account when weighing RFA consensus. Some of these may not have been discussed by the community for some time, by discussing them individually hopefully we can reaffirm or end consensus as to which of these considerations are reasonable for the crats to focus on in crat chats. 

'''Question''': ''Should the discretion of bureaucrats in Requests for Adminship include giving a little extra benefit of the doubt for very long established members of the community? (In practice this would mean that an RFA candidate who had been here for over ten years would, all other things being equal, be more likely to pass RFA at 65% than someone who had only been here five or six years)?

If your answer to the above is "yes," support. If your answer is "no," oppose.

''[[User:WereSpielChequers|<span style="color:DarkGreen">œ¢ere</span>]][[User talk:WereSpielChequers|<span style="color:DarkRed">Spiel</span>]]<span style="color:#CC5500">Chequers</span>'' 10:01, 14 April 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:35 mm film#rfc_1BB1099|Talk:35 mm film]] expired 2019-04-17 00:01 ===
* Id: 1BB1099
* User: King of Hearts
* Date: 2019-03-17 23:54:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|888258996|SCI 888258996}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|888259000|MEDIA 888259000}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|892801876|SCI 892801876}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|892801878|MEDIA 892801878}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Currently, I think our coverage of the various formats referred to as "35mm" is a mess. We have four articles:
* [[35 mm film]], on the movie film
* [[135 film]], on the still photographic film
* [[35mm format]], on the 36√ó24 mm size in still photographic film or digital photography
* [[Full frame]], on a particular gate size of the movie film

I think it is safe to say that the topic of each article is [[WP:PRECISE|not readily apparent from its title]]. There are several issues I'd like to address:
# Do we really need four articles? I'm open to any solutions, such as merging existing articles, moving things around, creating new overview articles or disambiguation pages, etc.
# Is there a less confusing way to title the articles? If you google "35mm film" or "35 mm film", almost all of the top results discuss the still photographic film, suggesting to me that the movie film is not the [[WP:PRIMARYTOPIC]] for this term. Likewise, "Full frame" should probably be turned into a disambiguation page based on a cursory Google search.
# We have one article called "35 mm film", and another called "35mm format". Should there be a space between "35" and "mm"?

Thanks, [[User:King of Hearts|King of]] [[User:King of Hearts|<font color="red">&hearts;</font>]] [[User talk:King of Hearts|<font color="red">&diams;</font>]] [[Special:Contributions/King of Hearts|<font color="black">&clubs;</font>]] &spades; 23:54, 17 March 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Template talk:Infobox officeholder#rfc_60047B2|Template talk:Infobox officeholder]] expired 2019-04-17 00:01 ===
* Id: 60047B2
* Date: 2019-03-17 23:09:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|888259002|POL 888259002}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|888259010|TECH 888259010}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|892801880|POL 892801880}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|892801884|TECH 892801884}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The [[Template:Infobox officeholder/doc|current policy]] regarding ordinal numbering is that an infobox should only mention someone is the ''n''th President, Prime-Minister, senator, etc. if this is well established practice in the country the person holds office in. Recently, [[User:CroGamer 1|CroGamer 1]] has called for this policy to change. The problem lies in the fact that ordinal numbering is subjective; if someone is elected non-consecutively, how does the numbering works? What about a temporarily acting officeholder? At the same time, knowing that someone was the "11th President of X" can be useful to know. If there is a well established usage in the relevant country, we should still follow that. If this isn't the case, should we continue our policy of not mentioning it, or should we have a wiki-wide policy for all these countries in which we establish how to number? 23:09, 17 March 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)#rfc_A02FEC7|Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)]] expired 2019-04-17 04:01 ===
* Id: A02FEC7
* User: BrownHairedGirl
* Date: 2019-04-04 19:57:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|890975503|STYLE 890975503}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|895515183|STYLE 895515183}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should all Wikipedia categories which use the word "organisation"/"organization" as part of a descriptive name per [[WP:NDESC]] be standardized to use the "Z" spelling, i.e. "organi'''z'''ation" rather than "organi'''s'''ation"?

Note that this proposal does ''not'' apply to proper names, such as [[:Category:International Labour Organization]], which should use the name selected per [[WP:Article titles]] for the title of the head article.  It applies only to the descriptive category titles invented by Wikipedia editors per [[WP:NDESC]], such as [[:Category:Agricultural organizations based in the Caribbean]], [[:Category:Organizations established in the 19th century]], [[:Category:Religious organizations by faith or belief]], [[:Category:Sports organisations of Ireland]], and [[:Category:Paramilitary organisations based in the United Kingdom]]. --[[User:BrownHairedGirl|<span style="color:#663200;">Brown</span>HairedGirl]] <small>[[User talk:BrownHairedGirl|(talk)]] ‚Ä¢ ([[Special:Contributions/BrownHairedGirl|contribs]])</small> 19:57, 4 April 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Detransition#rfc_44831E4|Talk:Detransition]] expired 2019-04-17 06:01 ===
* Id: 44831E4
* User: A145GI15I95
* Date: 2019-03-18 06:00:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|888294186|SCI 888294186}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|888294187|RELI 888294187}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|888294189|SOC 888294189}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|892837055|SCI 892837055}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|892837058|RELI 892837058}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|892837059|SOC 892837059}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Seeking fresh, outside, neutral opinions on the "Occurrence" section's sources, per the Medref tag, please. Previous discussion is at [[Talk:Detransition#Medref_tag]]. Please note this page is tagged "Controversial". 

The Medref tag was added 2017 December 27, 15 months ago. At that time, the article overall had 16 sources, all from the news. The medical section referenced 5 of those news sources, 2 of which referred to the same story.

Today, the article has 61 sources: 5 from books, 13 from medical journals, 32 of which are from news, and 11 from online sources. The medical section references 26 of those sources: 2 from books, 11 from journals, 15 from news, 1 from general online. Of the 11 journal sources, 2 of them reference the other 9. 

Regarding this expansion of quantity and quality of sources, is the Medref tag still needed? 

Thank you, [[User:A145GI15I95|A145GI15I95]] ([[User talk:A145GI15I95|talk]]) 06:00, 18 March 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Fermat's Last Theorem#rfc_3FF79B6|Talk:Fermat's Last Theorem]] expired 2019-04-18 08:01 ===
* Id: 3FF79B6
* Date: 2019-03-19 07:24:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|888454639|SCI 888454639}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Moving a page#rfc_BFF9F83|Wikipedia talk:Moving a page]] expired 2019-04-18 13:01 ===
* Id: BFF9F83
* User: StraussInTheHouse
* Date: 2019-03-19 11:03:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|888473263|TECH 888473263}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|893021557|TECH 893021557}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Page movers and administrators have the ability to [[WP:MOR|move pages over redirects]].  However, they can only perform this operation if the redirect ''has no other edits to it except its creation''.  This is with good reason, because it prevents abuse e.g. a page mover or administrator could [[WP:BLAR|blank and redirect]] a really important page and then move another page over it, thus deleting it.

I am proposing a change to how the system works.  [[Special:Diff/888467529|This]] is the latest example of many requested moves I have closed, hoping to move over a redirect, only to find that a bot, usually [[User:RussBot]] or [[User:Avicbot]], have made one minor edit to it, such as fixing a double redirect.  These edits are marked as minor, however, it still means that a [[WP:ROUNDROBIN|round robin]] move is required, which not only makes the page history look more confusing to the untrained eye, but also uses up more moves than is really necessary.  The anti-abuse measure would still work because pages with any history whatsoever could not be blanked and deleted in an abusive way due to the "all minor" restriction.

Therefore, I propose '''that the MediaWiki [[WP:MOR|move over redirect]] function be changed to allow users with +extendedmover to move over a redirect only if the redirect, or its talk page, has no edits which are not marked as minor in its page history, apart from its creation.''' '''<span style="font-family: Arial">[[User:StraussInTheHouse|<span style="color: red">SITH</span>]] [[User talk:StraussInTheHouse|<span style="color: blue">(talk)</span>]]</span>''' 11:03, 19 March 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Template talk:Rfc#rfc_80332A9|Template talk:Rfc]] expired 2019-04-18 21:01 ===
* Id: 80332A9
* User: Hellknowz
* Date: 2019-04-18 10:09:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|893010497|TECH 893010497}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|893078397|TECH 893078397}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
[[Wikipedia talk:Templates for discussion]] has two RfCs, which leads me to guess that that might be an issue. Can the bot handle two RfCs on the same page? ‚Äî&nbsp;<small>&nbsp;[[user:Hellknowz|<span style="color: #B00;">HELL</span>KNOWZ]]&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;‚ñé[[User talk:Hellknowz|TALK]]</small> 10:09, 18 April 2019 (UTC)}}

* Date: 2019-03-22 21:14:00

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|889027619|SOC 889027619}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|889257225|HIST 889257225}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|893511447|BIO 893511447}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|893511453|SOC 893511453}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
*Within each section, should the entries by sorted alphabetically or chronologically?
*Should date of birth and date of death be added to entries?
*Should nationality, date of birth, and date of death information be supported using reliable sources if that information is in the entry's corresponding article?
*Is the Photographers' Identity Catalog (PIC) a reliable source for nationality, date of birth, and date of death?
*If a source is deemed reliable, should there be a limit on how many times it is used?
*Should the unsourced attributes listed in the key (abs, adv, aer, etc.) be retained?
[[User:ThatMontrealIP|ThatMontrealIP]] ([[User talk:ThatMontrealIP|talk]]) 21:14, 22 March 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Template talk:Infobox#rfc_94E0DE0|Template talk:Infobox]] expired 2019-04-22 15:01 ===
* Id: 94E0DE0
* User: NorthPark1417
* Date: 2019-04-22 08:53:00

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the infobox link location and language?

{{Infobox magazine
| title = Brigitte
| image_file =
| image_size = 
| image_caption = 
| editor = Brigitte Huber
| frequency = Biweekly
| circulation = 
| category = [[Women's magazine]]
| company = [[Gruner + Jahr]]
| publisher =
| founded = {{start date and age|1886}}
| country = [[Germany]]
| based = [[Hamburg]]
| language = [[German language|German]]
| website = [http://www.brigitte.de/ brigitte.de]
}}

{{Infobox magazine
| title           = Jersey Beat
| logo            = 
| logo_size       = 
| image_file      = 
| image_size      = 
| image_alt       = 
| image_caption   =
| editor          = Jim Testa
| editor_title    = 
| previous_editor = 
| staff_writer    = {{hidden|ta1=left|Columnists|Tony B.<br>James Damion<br>Deborah Draisin<br>Jesse Gillett<br>Stephen Gritzan<br>Rich Quinlin<br>Paul Silver<br>Jim Testa<br>Eric Walls<br>Joe Wawzyrniak}}
| photographer    = 
| category        = [[Music]]
| frequency       = 
| circulation     = [[triannual]] (print, ended 2007)
| publisher       = Not a Mongo
| founder         = Jim Testa
| founded         = 
| firstdate       = {{Start date|1982|03}}
| company         = 
| country         = United States
| based           = [[Weehawken, New Jersey]]
| language        = English
| website         = {{URL|jerseybeat.com}}
| issn            =  
| oclc            = 61183832
}}

*'''Yes''' - The infobox, like the navbar, ably utilizes navigational links. This offers relief from over-linking in the article, when they are connected to topics of a higher branch. ([[No Me Queda M√°s|Format, genre, label, songwriter(s), producer(s)]], [[Yasser Arafat|Born, died, nationality]], [[Pope John Paul II|Denomination]])- [[User:NorthPark1417|NorthPark1417]] ([[User talk:NorthPark1417|talk]]) 08:53, 22 April 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/China and Chinese-related articles#rfc_8F4D9F7|Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/China and Chinese-related articles]] expired 2019-04-23 07:01 ===
* Id: 8F4D9F7
* User: King of Hearts
* Date: 2019-03-24 06:09:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|891621769|HIST 891621769}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|891621775|STYLE 891621775}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|900217970|HIST 900217970}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|900217976|STYLE 900217976}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Recently the [[WP:ITN]] nomination of [[2019 Xiangshui chemical plant explosion]] made me realize that we don't have a consistent style for [[administrative divisions of China]]. Here's the full example:
<blockquote>
On 21 March 2019, a major explosion occurred at a chemical plant in [[:zh:ÈôàÂÆ∂Ê∏ØÈïá|Chenjiagang (Town)]], [[Xiangshui County|Xiangshui (County)]], [[Yancheng]], [[Jiangsu|Jiangsu (Province)]], [[China]].
</blockquote>
Each of these parentheses represents an optional descriptor which can be seen in many English-language sources about China. (I have omitted the [[prefecture-level city|city]] level as it is very uncommon to append "city" or "prefecture" to the end of these.) For each level in question ([[Towns of China|town]], [[Counties of China|county]], [[Provinces of China|province]]), we want to answer:
# Should the administrative level descriptor be present?
# If so, should it be written in uppercase (Chenjiagang Town) or lowercase (Chenjiagang town)?
Thanks, [[User:King of Hearts|King of]] [[User:King of Hearts|<font color="red">&hearts;</font>]] [[User talk:King of Hearts|<font color="red">&diams;</font>]] [[Special:Contributions/King of Hearts|<font color="black">&clubs;</font>]] &spades; 06:09, 24 March 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Adam Leitman Bailey#rfc_A4D92D2|Talk:Adam Leitman Bailey]] expired 2019-04-23 13:01 ===
* Id: A4D92D2
* User: Cook907
* Date: 2019-04-09 23:48:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|891755020|BIO 891755020}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|893766292|BIO 893766292}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I believe the line stating ‚ÄúHe is presently under a four-month suspension from the practice of law after a finding of misconduct. [7]‚Äù should be removed from the first paragraph along with the removal of the line ‚ÄúIt was announced on April 2, 2019 that attorney Adam Leitman Bailey will have his law license suspended for a 4 month term. [10] [11]‚Äù in the background section. It is rare to have this sort of information in any introductory paragraph for a biographaphical page. For example Linda Addison <ref>https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linda_Addison_(lawyer)</ref> or  William F. Aldinger III <ref>https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_F._Aldinger_III</ref>, both being former attorneys from New York, only have basic life timeline information in their first paragraphs. It makes sense for this information to be noted in the lawsuit against bailey section, but to have it in 3 separate locations across the page is a bit absurd for such a short biography page noting that the suspension is only for 4 months out of an entire lifetime/career. [[User:Cook907|Cook907]] ([[User talk:Cook907|talk]]) 23:48, 9 April 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Rigel#rfc_2D0F986|Talk:Rigel]] expired 2019-04-24 06:01 ===
* Id: 2D0F986
* User: Casliber
* Date: 2019-03-25 05:09:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|889357353|SCI 889357353}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|893883487|SCI 893883487}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Rigel has five stars requiring us to call them something in this article. They had been called Rigel A, Ba, Bb, C and D. However the IAU has ruled that the name "Rigel" applies to the main star, leaving some confusion as to the rest. SIMBAD lists as 'Beta Orionis B' [http://simbad.u-strasbg.fr/simbad/sim-id?Ident=NAME+Rigel&NbIdent=query_hlinks&Coord=05+14+32.27210-08+12+05.8981&parents=1&siblings=1&submit=siblings&hlinksdisplay=h_all here]. At least two sources use Rigel B,C and D.[http://stars.astro.illinois.edu/sow/rigel.html] [https://books.google.com.au/books?redir_esc=y&id=40JzBYGREL0C&q=Rigel#v=snippet&q=Rigel&f=false]. The IAU at the bottom of page 5 [https://www.iau.org/static/science/scientific_bodies/working_groups/280/wg-starnames-triennial-report-2015-2018.pdf here] says "As these useful nicknames with the form [proper name] [letter component] often appear in the literature, many appear in the SIMBAD database." but notes they are unofficial. Other names - STF 688B for Rigel B, and BU 555Ba, BU555Bb, BC 555C and BU 555 D for Rigel Ba, Bb, C and D respectively - are almost never used, and only rarely seen in journals. So we have a choice - Rigel A, Ba, Bb, C and D....Beta Orionis Ba, Bb, C and D...or...what? Can people denote their choices below. [[User:Casliber|Cas Liber]] ([[User talk:Casliber|talk]] '''¬∑''' [[Special:Contributions/Casliber|contribs]]) 05:09, 25 March 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Republic of China (1912‚Äì1949)#rfc_873C0C4|Talk:Republic of China (1912‚Äì1949)]] expired 2019-04-24 11:01 ===
* Id: 873C0C4
* User: Matthew hk
* Date: 2019-03-25 11:01:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|889392189|HIST 889392189}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|889392197|POL 889392197}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|893911339|HIST 893911339}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|893911340|POL 893911340}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Rfc on using which map is more suitable for encyclopedic purpose.

A. existing SVG map [[:File:Republic of China (orthographic projection, historical).svg]] draw by wiki user (note, in case of anything wrong , we can ask the user to redraw the SVG)

B. use [[:File:China 1933.jpg]]

C. other proposal such as use {{para|alt_map}}.

Note that both map (A,B) are ''de jure'' border. The border of effective control was constantly change due to foreign occupied (semi)-colony area ([[Outer Manchuria]], etc.), as well as Japanese invasion (Taiwan, [[Manchukuo]], etc) as well as self-declared independence ([[Mongolia]], 1921), etc. [[User:Matthew hk|Matthew hk]] ([[User talk:Matthew hk|talk]]) 11:01, 25 March 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:1947‚Äì1949 Palestine war#rfc_B3D3FA7|Talk:1947‚Äì1949 Palestine war]] expired 2019-04-25 21:01 ===
* Id: B3D3FA7
* User: Onceinawhile
* Date: 2019-03-26 20:29:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|893784110|HIST 893784110}}
