* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
It has been suggested that we break this discussion down into pieces. As a first step, please could editors comment on whether the three articles under discussion here should have a common prefix? Examples of this structure could include:
* Main article: "[xxxxxx]"; Sub articles: "[xxxxxx] (first phase)" and "[xxxxxx] (second phase)"
* Main article: "[xxxxxx]"; Sub articles: "[xxxxxx] (civil war phase)" and "[xxxxxx] (Arab‚ÄìIsraeli phase)"
* Main article: "[xxxxxx]"; Sub articles: "[xxxxxx] (Nov 1947 ‚Äì May 1948)" and "[xxxxxx] (May 1948 ‚Äì Jan 1949)"

Views on this overall concept, rather than what the common prefix should be, would be greatly appreciated. [[User:Onceinawhile|Onceinawhile]] ([[User talk:Onceinawhile|talk]]) 20:29, 26 March 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of the Mesozoic life of Wyoming#rfc_785D81A|Talk:List of the Mesozoic life of Wyoming]] expired 2019-04-25 23:01 ===
* Id: 785D81A
* User: Abyssal
* Date: 2019-04-25 19:15:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|894122951|UNSORTED 894122951}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|894143666|UNSORTED 894143666}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Our lists of prehistoric life by US state require a lot of images since most prehistoric life will be unfamiliar to most readers. I've been reformatting the way images are displayed on these articles using multiple image templates hoping to minimize visual clutter and distraction from the main text while maintaining an informative quantity of images. That being said, there are potential drawbacks. On the [[Cenozoic life of Washington state]] [[Talk:List of the Cenozoic life of Washington (state)|talk page]] {{ping|Kevmin}} disagreed with the aforementioned approach, saying: {{blockquote|I see that the images are being grouped into tiny little mutiple image boxes.  I have to say I'm not a fan of the results, which are hard to see images, seemingly large blocks of text, and massive amounts of white space in the list again.  The simple one image per box format filled the article better and made the images much more accessible.}}
Since the recent changes proved controversial, I wanted to raise a discussion about the best way to display images in these articles. I moved the discussion here because this article was already completely redone in the newer style. Examples of previous styles can be found at:

* The [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_the_Mesozoic_life_of_Wyoming&oldid=872526598 original style]
* The [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_the_Mesozoic_life_of_Wyoming&oldid=891636468 previous style] with use of wider 2 or 3 image multiple image templates.
* The [[List of the Mesozoic life of Wyoming|current style]] with heavy use of a narrower-widthed multiple image template.
Any or none of these might provide a good reference point on how to proceed. How do you think we should display images on these articles? [[User:Abyssal|Abyssal]] ([[User talk:Abyssal|talk]]) 19:15, 25 April 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Lisdexamfetamine#rfc_CC0110F|Talk:Lisdexamfetamine]] expired 2019-04-26 06:01 ===
* Id: CC0110F
* User: Doc James
* Date: 2019-04-22 04:49:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|893550876|SCI 893550876}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|894187816|SCI 894187816}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
High quality sources disagree. Thus for "dependence liability: physical" we should put either "controversial" or "disputed".

We have multiple high quality sources that support physical dependence. We have the following text under the heading for "lisdexamfetamine" in this medical textbook.

{{Quote|Physical dependence. Chronic amphetamine use produces physical dependence. If amphetamines are abruptly withdrawn from a dependent person, an abstinence syndrome will ensue. Symptoms include exhaution, depression, prolonged sleep...

{{cite book |last1=Rosenthal |first1=Laura |last2=Burchum |first2=Jacqueline |title=Lehne's Pharmacotherapeutics for Advanced Practice Providers - E-Book |date=2017 |publisher=Elsevier Health Sciences |isbn=9780323447799 |url=https://books.google.ca/books?id=gfYoDgAAQBAJ&pg=PA293 |language=en}}}}

We also have the current source which says

{{Quote|cessation of cocaine use and the use of other psychostimulants in dependent individuals does not produce a physical withdrawal syndrome but may produce dysphoria, anhedonia, and an intense desire to reinitiate drug use.}}
[[User:Doc James|<span style="color:#0000f1">'''Doc James'''</span>]] ([[User talk:Doc James|talk]] ¬∑ [[Special:Contributions/Doc James|contribs]] ¬∑ [[Special:EmailUser/Doc James|email]]) 04:49, 22 April 2019 (UTC)}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|894207915|POLICY 894207915}}

{{rfcquote|text=

=== [[Talk:Planned Parenthood 2015 undercover videos controversy#rfc_96A511D|Talk:Planned Parenthood 2015 undercover videos controversy]] expired 2019-04-26 17:01 ===
* Id: 96A511D
* User: Swood100
* Date: 2019-04-24 21:49:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|894045365|POL 894045365}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|894092048|SOC 894092048}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|894092049|POLICY 894092049}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|894255255|POL 894255255}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|894255256|SOC 894255256}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|894255261|POLICY 894255261}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
In the absence of any contradictory secondary source is there any reason why the article titled "Planned Parenthood 2015 undercover videos controversy" cannot include the following verbatim quotes from secondary sources: (1) According to reports, an anti-abortion group heavily edited the videos to make it appear Planned Parenthood was selling fetal tissue. But on appeal, the Fifth Circuit said that's not what happened.  (2) "The record reflects that [the Texas Office of Inspector General] had submitted a report from a forensic firm concluding that the video was authentic and not deceptively edited," Judith Edith Jones wrote for the appeals panel. (3) Jones said the plaintiffs did not identify any particular omission or addition in the video footage. That was enough to support the decision by health and human service officials. (4) The Fifth Circuit, however, found that Planned Parenthood Gulf Coast has sold tissue for outside research. [[User:Swood100|Swood100]] ([[User talk:Swood100|talk]]) 21:49, 24 April 2019 (UTC)}}

*'''Option 1:''' Generally [[WP:RS|reliable]] for factual reporting
*'''Option 2:''' Unclear or additional considerations apply
*'''Option 3:''' Generally [[WP:QUESTIONABLE|unreliable]] for factual reporting
*'''Option 4:''' Publishes false or fabricated information, and should be [[WP:DEPS|deprecated]] as in the [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard/Archive 220#Daily Mail RfC|2017 RfC]] of the ''[[Daily Mail]]''

Thanks.----[[User:ZiaLater|<i style="text-shadow:#C0C0C0 0.2em 0.2em 0.2em; color: ForestGreen">ZiaLater</i>]] ([[User talk:ZiaLater|<span style="color: ForestGreen">talk</span>]]) 13:05, 12 April 2019 (UTC)}}

Dear bio friends,

Bear with me for the second question, I am practicing to write wikipedia lead paragraph for bio, and my educational question is: Would it be more appropriate that the lead paragraph start with something like 

: "Martin Luther King. Jr (year-year) is an American civil right leader, minister of..."(slightly changing order of the current version). 

My reason is Civil right leader is what he is mostly known and recognized for. Please educate me why this is better or not than the current version. Thank you!

=== [[Talk:Donors Trust#rfc_638380B|Talk:Donors Trust]] expired 2019-05-02 13:01 ===
* Id: 638380B
* Date: 2019-04-02 12:56:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|890615562|ECON 890615562}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|890615565|POL 890615565}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|895167853|ECON 895167853}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|895167858|POL 895167858}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Looking at the section above; there's a debate about whether DonorsTrust "offers anonymity" to people, or basically "conceals identities".

Which one of these is the most [[WP:N|neutral]] wording?

'''Current wording''' - "''Like all donor-advised funds, Donors Trust can offer anonymity to its clients who do not wish to make their donations public''"

'''Proposed wording''' - "''Donors Trust conceals the identity of political donors who do not wish to make their donations public.''"

If you have an alternate wording proposal, let us know!
12:56, 2 April 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Cannabidiol#rfc_7804542|Talk:Cannabidiol]] expired 2019-05-03 15:01 ===
* Id: 7804542
* User: Petrarchan47
* Date: 2019-04-19 09:41:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|893147913|SCI 893147913}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|895334659|SCI 895334659}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This is a two-part question:

1) Should the following text be added to the [[Cannabidiol|CBD]] article?
:
2) If yes, should it be added to the [[Cannabidiol#Epilepsy|Epilepsy]] or to the [[Cannabidiol#Research|Research]] section? 
:
{{tq2|Researchers compared the potential therapeutic properties of "purified CBD" with full-plant, CBD-rich cannabis extracts for treating [[Disease#Refractory_disease|refractory]] [[epilepsy]]. CBD-rich extracts were found to have a "better therapeutic potential" and fewer adverse effects than purified CBD. The daily average dose for people using full-plant extracts was more than four times lower than for those using purified CBD, indicating a possible synergistic ([[entourage effect|''entourage'']]) effect between CBD and other plant compounds.}}
:
Source:
{{cite journal | last=Pamplona | first=Fabricio A. | last2=da Silva | first2=Lorenzo Rolim | last3=Coan | first3=Ana Carolina | title=Potential Clinical Benefits of CBD-Rich Cannabis Extracts Over Purified CBD in Treatment-Resistant Epilepsy: Observational Data Meta-analysis | journal=Frontiers in Neurology | volume=9 | pages=759 | date=12 September 2018 | issn=1664-2295 | pmid=30258398 | pmc=6143706 | doi=10.3389/fneur.2018.00759}}
: '''<span style="text-shadow:7px 7px 8px  #B8B8B8;">[[User:Petrarchan47|<font color="#A0A0A0">petrarchan47</font>]][[User talk:Petrarchan47|<font color="deeppink">‡∏Ñ‡∏∏</font>]][[Special:Contributions/Petrarchan47|<font color="orangered">‡∏Å</font>]]</span>''' 09:41, 19 April 2019 (UTC)}}

* Id: E9765E9

* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|893635593|POL 893635593}}

=== [[Talk:Voodoo Doughnut#rfc_5F366B2|Talk:Voodoo Doughnut]] expired 2019-05-03 20:01 ===
* Id: 5F366B2
* User: Graywalls
* Date: 2019-04-03 19:26:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|890826966|POLICY 890826966}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|892744857|ECON 892744857}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|912653734|ECON 912653734}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|912653742|POLICY 912653742}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Questions on inclusion of self published contents and slip streaming things into existing contents. 

I'm still foggy after reading through [[WP:YT]] and [[WP:ELNO]] given a line like. "Any site that does not provide a unique resource beyond what the article would contain if it became a featured article". Please see "Voodoo doc film" section in this talk page. Initially, I removed a YouTube video from the article [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Voodoo_Doughnut&type=revision&diff=889907193&oldid=888995975 here]. The video was made by three individuals and hosted on one of the individual creators' personal YouTube. The subject of video is about the article's company. Anyone with a camcorder, some skills and editing can call themselves a director. So if someone, or a group of indie directors make a short video about a company, when would it be generally acceptable to be inserted? At the time I removed it, there was no context of why it should have been there. It was restored later which referenced a source that mentioned the video (one line) in an announcement in another city that a location of VooDoo was opening in that city. 
On Wikipedia, it's too common to see something like "notable people such as A, B, C, D, E..." only to see F, G, H and so on getting added onto it. I've even come across people who go and insert certain people/companies as examples into many articles. Since YouTube carries monetizing potential, it's especially a concern that motivates people to find a way to insert something into a high view count articles.  [[User:Graywalls|Graywalls]] ([[User talk:Graywalls|talk]]) 19:26, 3 April 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Adam Leitman Bailey#rfc_3C614A6|Talk:Adam Leitman Bailey]] expired 2019-05-04 17:01 ===
* Id: 3C614A6
* User: Cook907
* Date: 2019-04-09 23:48:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|895392088|POLICY 895392088}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|895494047|POLICY 895494047}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I believe the line stating ‚ÄúHe is presently under a four-month suspension from the practice of law after a finding of misconduct. [7]‚Äù should be removed from the first paragraph along with the removal of the line ‚ÄúIt was announced on April 2, 2019 that attorney Adam Leitman Bailey will have his law license suspended for a 4 month term. [10] [11]‚Äù in the background section. It is rare to have this sort of information in any introductory paragraph for a biographaphical page. For example Linda Addison <ref>https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linda_Addison_(lawyer)</ref> or  William F. Aldinger III <ref>https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_F._Aldinger_III</ref>, both being former attorneys from New York, only have basic life timeline information in their first paragraphs. It makes sense for this information to be noted in the lawsuit against bailey section, but to have it in 3 separate locations across the page is a bit absurd for such a short biography page noting that the suspension is only for 4 months out of an entire lifetime/career. [[User:Cook907|Cook907]] ([[User talk:Cook907|talk]]) 23:48, 9 April 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)#rfc_3A556F9|Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)]] expired 2019-05-04 20:01 ===
* Id: 3A556F9
* User: Cunard
* Date: 2019-04-29 00:00:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|894507389|POLICY 894507389}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|895522015|POLICY 895522015}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I propose adding the following text to [[Wikipedia:General sanctions#Community sanctions]]:

{{quotation box|1=<s>Administrators can bypass [[Wikipedia:Deletion process|deletion discussion]] and immediately delete Wikipedia pages or media that are within scope of a community general sanction only when the pages or media meet the requirements for [[Wikipedia:Criteria for speedy deletion|speedy deletion]].</s> <u>Administrators cannot delete pages or media within the scope of a community general sanction without a [[Wikipedia:Deletion process|deletion discussion]] unless the pages or media fall under the [[Wikipedia:Criteria for speedy deletion|criteria for speedy deletion]].</u> Such deletions are ordinary speedy deletions so have no special restrictions on reversibility and can be appealed at [[Wikipedia:Deletion review|deletion review]]. Page-level sanctions refer to limitations on the ability to edit pages, or to edit pages in a particular manner, not to deleting pages.</s>}}

The first sentence was stricken by [[User:Cunard|Cunard]] ([[User talk:Cunard|talk]]) at 00:00, 29 April 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Kamarupi Prakrit#rfc_B8DEE70|Talk:Kamarupi Prakrit]] expired 2019-05-06 11:01 ===
* Id: B8DEE70
* User: Robert McClenon
* Date: 2019-05-05 03:48:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|895567635|HIST 895567635}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|895567637|LANG 895567637}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|895763650|HIST 895763650}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|895763651|LANG 895763651}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The following names have been proposed:  
:A.  Kamarupi Prakrit.
:B.  Proto-Kamarupa language.
:C.  Old Kamrupi language.
:D.  Old Kamarupi dialect
:E.  Kamrupi language.
:F.  Kamrupi Apabhramsa.

Please specify your first choice, and rank other choices, in the Survey section.  Threaded discussion may be in the Threaded Discussion section.  Due to the large number of possible names, we may request a [[WP:SNOW|snowball]] closure to exclude some of the choices and restart the RFC for the remaining choices.
[[User:Robert McClenon|Robert McClenon]] ([[User talk:Robert McClenon|talk]]) 03:48, 5 May 2019 (UTC)}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Hello. I'm hoping to add under section 7.6 (Israeli-Palestinian conflict) details of the recent publication of an anti-semitic cartoon and acknowledgement of such by the NYT editorial board<ref> https://www.nytimes.com/2019/04/30/opinion/cartoon-nytimes.html</ref>. This is the first time NYT has acknowledged the publication of something which in its opinion, contained anti-semitic tropes.
 
This is especially to better counter-balance the statement in source citation 244 that by the NYT public editor Clark Hoyt that the newspaper "has tried its best to do a fair, balanced and complete job ‚Äî and has largely succeeded".

I also think comment from the cartoonist can be added, in which he contends that there was no anti-semitic intent: <ref>https://www.jpost.com/Diaspora/Cartoonist-of-NYT-caricature-to-Post-I-have-nothing-against-the-Jews-588291</ref>

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Notability (academics)#rfc_A0F207E|Wikipedia talk:Notability (academics)]] expired 2019-05-10 14:01 ===
* Id: A0F207E
* User: Netoholic
* Date: 2019-05-07 19:57:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|896011195|BIO 896011195}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|896334909|POLICY 896334909}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|896439423|BIO 896439423}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|896439426|POLICY 896439426}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
<blockquote>'''Current wording''':  Academics/professors meeting ''any '''one''' '' of the following conditions, as substantiated through [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources|reliable sources]], are notable.<br/><br />
'''Proposed wording''':  Academics/professors meeting '''''one or more''''' of the following conditions, as substantiated using multiple [[WP:PUBLISHED|published]], [[WP:Reliable sources|reliable]], [[WP:Secondary sources|secondary]] sources which are [[WP:Independent sources|independent]] of the subject and each other, are notable.</blockquote>

Shall the wording in the section [[Wikipedia:Notability (academics)#Criteria]] be changed to the proposed wording above? -- [[User:Netoholic|Netoholic]] [[User talk:Netoholic|@]]  19:57, 7 May 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Requests for adminship#rfc_C6C53D2|Wikipedia talk:Requests for adminship]] expired 2019-05-12 11:01 ===
* Id: C6C53D2
* User: Sideways713
* Date: 2019-04-12 10:11:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|892125017|POLICY 892125017}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|896709109|POLICY 896709109}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
In future, should the discretionary range be understood primarily as '''A)''' a unit (bureaucrats should close Requests for Adminship based entirely or almost entirely on the strength of the arguments for supporting and opposing, and the raw percentage of supporters should not be a significant factor), or '''B)''' a spectrum (the strength of the arguments does matter, but the default expectation should be that RfAs with support near the upper end of the discretionary range are likely to pass and RfAs near the lower end are likely to fail)? [[User:Sideways713|Sideways713]] ([[User talk:Sideways713|talk]]) 10:11, 12 April 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Civil Rights Act of 1968#rfc_597CC60|Talk:Civil Rights Act of 1968]] expired 2019-05-17 13:01 ===
* Id: 597CC60
* User: Mitchumch
* Date: 2019-04-17 12:18:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|893010491|HIST 893010491}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|893010492|POL 893010492}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|893010493|SOC 893010493}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|897498514|HIST 897498514}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|897498521|POL 897498521}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|897498528|SOC 897498528}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
A request to merge the [[Fair Housing Act]] and [[Indian Civil Rights Act of 1968]] into the [[Civil Rights Act of 1968]]. The [[Indian Civil Rights Act of 1968]] and [[Fair Housing Act]] are the core components of this act, excluding Titles I and X.  Both of those articles are start-class.  They also posses overlapping content with this article that would further reduce their size.

I'm trying to restructure the article Civil Rights Act of 1968 (see [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Civil_Rights_Act_of_1968&diff=prev&oldid=890416891 before]) to better reveal the basic parts of the act. Alot of sections of this article are empty. The empty sections can be filled in with content from those other articles.  Perhaps in the future content for both of those articles would become substantial enough to warrant a separate article.  That future has not currently arrived. [[User:Mitchumch|Mitchumch]] ([[User talk:Mitchumch|talk]]) 12:18, 17 April 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Template talk:Infobox officeholder#rfc_AA63B13|Template talk:Infobox officeholder]] expired 2019-05-17 19:01 ===
* Id: AA63B13
* Date: 2019-03-17 23:09:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|893028564|POL 893028564}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|893028568|POLICY 893028568}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|893028569|TECH 893028569}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|897544941|POL 897544941}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|897544947|POLICY 897544947}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|897544950|TECH 897544950}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The [[Template:Infobox officeholder/doc|current policy]] regarding ordinal numbering is that an infobox should only mention someone is the ''n''th President, Prime-Minister, senator, etc. if this is well established practice in the country the person holds office in. Recently, [[User:CroGamer 1|CroGamer 1]] has called for this policy to change. The problem lies in the fact that ordinal numbering is subjective; if someone is elected non-consecutively, how does the numbering works? What about a temporarily acting officeholder? At the same time, knowing that someone was the "11th President of X" can be useful to know. If there is a well established usage in the relevant country, we should still follow that. If this isn't the case, should we continue our policy of not mentioning it, or should we have a wiki-wide policy for all these countries in which we establish how to number? 23:09, 17 March 2019 (UTC)}}

* Id: 242FE10
* User: Aviartm
* Date: 2019-04-17 20:45:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:

=== [[Help talk:Citation Style 1#rfc_6222B48|Help talk:Citation Style 1]] expired 2019-05-18 13:01 ===
* Id: 6222B48
* User: Crissov
* Date: 2019-05-08 10:07:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|897606741|UNSORTED 897606741}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|897643947|UNSORTED 897643947}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
}</code> (used as <code>{{{input1}}}</code> in {{tl|Citation/identifier}}). 

I could probably use generic <code>{{{id}}}</code>, but I wish there was a way to make it simpler and generate more harmonized formatting. I found {{tl|cite ISO standard}}, which seems very limited, and tried to add something similar to the respective [[Template:Citation/identifier/sandbox|sandbox]] by introducing a new identifier <code>iso</code>.
I would like to see some general advice and automation. 

Standards are reliable sources, of course, but only few are available for free, which makes them less popular references. On the other hand, several standards do have a distinguished Wikipedia article, e.g. [[ISO 9]], or provide a redirect to a more generic description of their topic, e.g. [[Romanization of Cyrillic]]. The following mockup is overly verbose, but it shows metadata that could be used. ‚Äî [[User:Crissov|Christoph]] [[User talk:Crissov|P√§per]] 10:07, 8 May 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Pacific War#rfc_72C8632|Talk:Pacific War]] expired 2019-05-20 00:01 ===
* Id: 72C8632
* User: Cinderella157
* Date: 2019-04-19 23:36:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|892815151|HIST 892815151}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|897882478|HIST 897882478}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The conflict infobox is intended to provide a brief summary. The question for comment here relates to striking a balance between concision and completeness. Specifically, this RfC is to establish in ''broad terms'' the  belligerents and commanders to be listed and not specific individuals and countries. For background, see the discussion immediately above. The options arising from the discussion are identified as follows:

'''Option 1:''' Maintain the ''status quo'' as represented by [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Pacific_War&diff=next&oldid=886416739 this version] or a more recent version that might be agreed upon but is not substantially different.
:*Which particular version best represents the ''status quo'' might emerge from further discussion but is ultimately immaterial (in the first instance) to support for maintaining the ''status quo''. If it is not apparent in the first instance, it might be subsequently clarified once (and if) the ''status quo'' becomes the consensus.

'''Option 2:''' Parse the infobox (particularly the belligerents and the leaders) IAW the example set at [[World War II]].
:*There is no specific example for the Pacific War but, as a broad option, it would likely limit the Allies listed to three or so and the commanders to the principle prime minister/president of each. It would also refer to a more complete list of Allies involved.

'''Option 3:''' Expand entries under the section for "commanders and leaders" - particularly for the Allies.
:*<u>Clarify: this option expands the ''status quo''.</u> <small>clarifying this option. [[User:Cinderella157|Cinderella157]] ([[User talk:Cinderella157|talk]]) 23:36, 19 April 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Ainu language#rfc_3DC31F8|Talk:Ainu language]] expired 2019-05-20 22:01 ===
* Id: 3DC31F8
* User: ABCEdit
* Date: 2019-05-11 00:55:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|896642450|LANG 896642450}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|898025464|LANG 898025464}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Current [[Ainu language]] article treats only Hokkaido, but "Ainu language" contains not only Hokkaido but also Kuril and Sakhalin. It is absolutely incorrect that only Hokkaido one is called "Ainu language". It is "Hokkaido Ainu language". And the coexistence of ‚Äú[[Ainu languages]]‚Äù and ‚ÄúAinu language‚Äùpages is very confusing. Obviously, current [[Ainu language]] article should be renamed to "Hokkaido Ainu language". So I requested move on this page. But a few users oppose it. They claim that the name "Hokkaido Ainu language" is on the "borderline of [[WP:OR|OR]]". I showed above that "Hokkaido Ainu language" is not OR. But one of them stubbornly does not admit it and the discussion is stagnant. --[[User:ABCEdit|ABCEdit]] ([[User talk:ABCEdit|talk]]) 00:55, 11 May 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of the Mesozoic life of Wyoming#rfc_113847C|Talk:List of the Mesozoic life of Wyoming]] expired 2019-05-25 20:01 ===
* Id: 113847C
* User: Abyssal
* Date: 2019-04-25 19:15:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|894143649|HIST 894143649}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|894143651|SCI 894143651}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|898767245|HIST 898767245}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|898767247|SCI 898767247}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Our lists of prehistoric life by US state require a lot of images since most prehistoric life will be unfamiliar to most readers. I've been reformatting the way images are displayed on these articles using multiple image templates hoping to minimize visual clutter and distraction from the main text while maintaining an informative quantity of images. That being said, there are potential drawbacks. On the [[Cenozoic life of Washington state]] [[Talk:List of the Cenozoic life of Washington (state)|talk page]] {{ping|Kevmin}} disagreed with the aforementioned approach, saying: {{blockquote|I see that the images are being grouped into tiny little mutiple image boxes.  I have to say I'm not a fan of the results, which are hard to see images, seemingly large blocks of text, and massive amounts of white space in the list again.  The simple one image per box format filled the article better and made the images much more accessible.}}
Since the recent changes proved controversial, I wanted to raise a discussion about the best way to display images in these articles. I moved the discussion here because this article was already completely redone in the newer style. Examples of previous styles can be found at:

* The [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_the_Mesozoic_life_of_Wyoming&oldid=872526598 original style]
* The [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_the_Mesozoic_life_of_Wyoming&oldid=891636468 previous style] with use of wider 2 or 3 image multiple image templates.
* The [[List of the Mesozoic life of Wyoming|current style]] with heavy use of a narrower-widthed multiple image template.
* [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_the_Mesozoic_life_of_Wyoming&oldid=894238684 Another style] with heavy use of a wider multiple image template.

Any or none of these might provide a good reference point on how to proceed. How do you think we should display images on these articles? [[User:Abyssal|Abyssal]] ([[User talk:Abyssal|talk]]) 19:15, 25 April 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Feminist views on transgender topics#rfc_56CF0AB|Talk:Feminist views on transgender topics]] expired 2019-05-25 23:01 ===
* Id: 56CF0AB
* User: LokiTheLiar
* Date: 2019-04-25 22:09:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|894143653|POL 894143653}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|894143656|SOC 894143656}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|898788939|POL 898788939}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|898788943|SOC 898788943}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The article currently has four templates: 
# too many quotations
# too many primary sources 
# lacks NPOV
# undue weight to (trans-exclusionary) radical feminist views

There has been some controversy on this talk page about whether to remove these templates, especially the NPOV and due weight ones. Should we remove any of these templates, and if so, which? 

Please comment with '''Remove [number(s)]''' and/or '''Keep [number(s)]''', and explain your reasoning. [[User:LokiTheLiar|LokiTheLiar]] ([[User talk:LokiTheLiar|talk]]) 22:09, 25 April 2019 (UTC)}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|898961479|POL 898961479}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|898961481|SOC 898961481}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|898961487|POLICY 898961487}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Is it appropriate for the Wikipedia article about the Planned Parenthood 2015 undercover videos controversy to include the following text? Each numbered line is a proposed item of text.

(1) a panel of judges from the U.S. Fifth Circuit Court of Appeals said  that the Center for Medical Progress had not deceptively edited the videos<ref name=‚Äúfindlaw‚Äù>{{cite web |url=https://blogs.findlaw.com/fifth_circuit/2019/01/planned-parenthood-medicaid-coverage-slashed-as-texas-wins-appeal.htm |title= Planned Parenthood Medicaid Coverage Slashed as Texas Wins Appeal |publisher=findlaw.com |access-date=2019-01-24|date =2019-01-19 }}</ref><ref name=‚Äùcountable‚Äù>{{cite web |url=https://www.countable.us/articles/19764-appeals-court-sides-texas-effort-bar-planned-parenthood-medicaid-sting-videos-case |title= Appeals Court Sides With Texas in Effort to Bar Planned Parenthood From Medicaid in ‚ÄòSting Videos‚Äô Case |publisher=countable.us |access-date=April 30, 2019|date = January 18, 2019}}</ref>

(2) a panel of judges from the U.S. Fifth Circuit Court of Appeals said that the authenticity of the videos was supported by a forensic firm<ref name=‚Äúfindlaw‚Äù/>

(3) a panel of judges from the U.S. Fifth Circuit Court of Appeals said  that Planned Parenthood did not identify a single omission or addition in the video footage<ref name=‚Äúfindlaw‚Äù/>

(4) The Fifth Circuit also found that Planned Parenthood has sold fetal tissue for use in outside research<ref name=‚Äùcourthousenews‚Äù>{{cite web |url=https://www.courthousenews.com/fifth-circuit-slashes-planned-parenthood-medicaid-coverage/ |title= Fifth Circuit Slashes Planned Parenthood Medicaid Coverage |publisher= www.courthousenews.com|access-date=2019-01-24|date =2019-01-18 }}</ref>

{{reflist-talk}}[[User:Swood100|Swood100]] ([[User talk:Swood100|talk]]) 18:12, 1 May 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)#rfc_1A3F5EA|Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)]] expired 2019-05-29 02:01 ===
* Id: 1A3F5EA
* User: Cunard
* Date: 2019-05-05 07:28:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|895582078|POLICY 895582078}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|900226806|POLICY 900226806}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The arbitration policy's section on "[[Wikipedia:Arbitration/Policy#Ratification and amendment|Ratification and amendment]]" says, "Proposed amendments may be submitted for ratification only after being approved by a majority vote of the Committee, or having been requested by a petition signed by at least one hundred editors in good standing."

This is the petition part of the amendment process. The ratification process may be started if and when the petition is signed by at least one hundred editors in good standing.

{{Ivmbox|1=The first paragraph of the "[[Wikipedia:Arbitration/Policy#Policy and precedent|Policy and precedent]]" section of the arbitration policy is amended to add the following underlined text:

:{{tq|The arbitration process is not a vehicle for creating new policy by fiat. The Committee's decisions may interpret existing policy and guidelines, recognise and call attention to standards of user conduct, or create procedures through which policy and guidelines may be enforced. The Committee does not rule on content, but may propose means by which community resolution of a content dispute can be facilitated. <u>The Committee's [[Wikipedia:Arbitration Committee/Discretionary sanctions|discretionary sanctions]] must not authorise the deletion, undeletion, moving, blanking, or redirection of pages in any namespace.</u>}}
}}

See [[#Rationale by Cunard|the "Rationale by Cunard" subsection]] for further background and [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia:Administrators%27_noticeboard&oldid=895572630#Proposed_amendment_to_Wikipedia:Arbitration/Policy_regarding_the_Arbitration_Committee's_power_to_authorise_deletions this AN discussion] for discussion about the drafting of this petition.<p>There is a parallel discussion at [[#RfC: community general sanctions and deletions]] that should not be confused with this one about the Arbitration Committee's discretionary sanctions.<p>[[User:Cunard|Cunard]] ([[User talk:Cunard|talk]]) 07:28, 5 May 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Anti-German sentiment#rfc_918CA77|Talk:Anti-German sentiment]] expired 2019-05-29 14:01 ===
* Id: 918CA77
* User: Icewhiz
* Date: 2019-04-29 09:08:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|894677263|HIST 894677263}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|894677265|MEDIA 894677265}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|894677267|POL 894677267}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|894677272|SOC 894677272}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|899354787|HIST 899354787}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|899354789|MEDIA 899354789}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|899354793|POL 899354793}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|899354797|SOC 899354797}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the contents in [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Anti-German_sentiment&diff=894664464&oldid=893431129 this diff] be included in the article:
{{tq2|The anti-German poem ''[[Rota (poem)|Rota]]'',[1][2][3][4][5][6][7] was proposed in the 1920 as the national anthem by the Polish right which opposed the [[J√≥zef Pi≈Çsudski]] government.[2] In the 1930s amidst anti-German violence against the German minority, ''Rota'' was sung so frequently that some considered it the second national anthem.[6] During World War II, the Communists used ''Rota'' to demonize the German enemy and the song was made the official anthem the [[1st Tadeusz Ko≈õciuszko Infantry Division]].[1] ''Rota'' is taught at Polish schools, and despite its use by the communist governments to drive up anti-German feelings in Poland it was also sung in Polish churches. Almost every Polish person educated during the communist period is familiar with the song.[3] It is the official anthem of the [[Polish People's Party]]. In the beginning of ceremonies by self-professed "patriotic" movements, such as the [[All-Polish Youth]], ''Rota'' is sung.[5]}}
Please indicate '''Yes''', '''No''', or something else - with a rationale. [[User:Icewhiz|Icewhiz]] ([[User talk:Icewhiz|talk]]) 09:08, 29 April 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Airports#rfc_D5B21BB|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Airports]] expired 2019-06-02 08:01 ===
* Id: D5B21BB
* User: Aerostar3
* Date: 2019-05-03 06:24:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|895287219|ECON 895287219}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|899921705|ECON 899921705}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
While all or almost all airport articles have a destination table that lists destinations the airline and destination city, making a distinction of the major airline's name, such as United Airlines, Delta Airlines, or Aer Lingus, as well as the affiliated regional airline's name, such as United Express, Delta Connection, or Aer Lingus Regional, is it unacceptable to treat airlines differently within the same article, for example, listing the United Express and United Airlines destinations under United Airlines but listing Delta Connection destinations separately from Delta Airlines within the same airport article.[[User:Aerostar3|Aerostar3]] ([[User talk:Aerostar3|talk]]) 06:24, 3 May 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Bitcoin Cash#rfc_DACA4D0|Talk:Bitcoin Cash]] expired 2019-06-02 09:01 ===
* Id: DACA4D0
* User: Jtbobwaysf
* Date: 2019-05-03 08:29:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|895297708|ECON 895297708}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|895297710|SOC 895297710}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|899928749|ECON 899928749}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|899928754|SOC 899928754}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Bitcoin Cash has an [[WP:ALTNAME]] "Bcash." A new source exists from The Verge [https://www.theverge.com/2018/4/12/17229796/bitcoin-cash-conflict-transactions-fight] that asserts the term Bcash is pejorative. This vote is if we:

* A: Should follow the verge source take the position that the ALTNAME is pejorative, diff [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Bitcoin_Cash&type=revision&diff=895176723&oldid=895135256]
* B: Use the version in which we take no position if the term is pejorative or not, diff [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Bitcoin_Cash&type=revision&diff=895295011&oldid=895176723]. 

Thanks! [[User:Jtbobwaysf|Jtbobwaysf]] ([[User talk:Jtbobwaysf|talk]]) 08:29, 3 May 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:TERF#rfc_90F8280|Talk:TERF]] expired 2019-06-03 05:01 ===
* Id: 90F8280
* User: 98.162.170.103
* Date: 2019-06-03 02:43:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|900044820|MEDIA 900044820}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|900044821|POL 900044821}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|900044824|SOC 900044824}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|900060881|MEDIA 900060881}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|900060883|POL 900060883}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|900060884|SOC 900060884}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=TERF&oldid=899683990 This] is the previous lead. [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=TERF&oldid=900017163 This] is the current lead. A comparison of the leads are in the [[Talk:TERF#Discussion|Discussion]] section.

[[Talk:TERF#The lead and two pieces in the responses section|The dispute]] is about whether or not the second version adheres to [[WP:WIKIVOICE]]. A concern has been expressed that the because the term is controversial, disputed (by both those to whom the term is applied to and by some academics), and is broad (also referring to people who are not feminists, and to views that may not be transphobic or are contested as transphobic), the lead should not use "transphobic" in Wikipedia's voice, at not least without qualifiers such as "considered to be," which are qualifiers used in both the lead of the [[Feminist views on transgender topics]] page and in the "Coinage and usage" of the TERF page. At the moment, the lead presents academics as only being for the side that supports use of the term "TERF." Counterarguments are that the lead is fine as is because views from people called TERFs are usually transphobic. Because a statement such as "trans women are not women" is widely considered transphobic by feminists, we should just state "transphobic" in Wikipedia's voice. Because people referred to as TERFs are a minority, we should present the "transphobic" text as fact. To do otherwise might be sending the message that Wikipedia promotes transphobia. So which incarnation should we use? Or should we use different wording? [[Special:Contributions/98.162.170.103|98.162.170.103]] ([[User talk:98.162.170.103|talk]]) 02:43, 3 June 2019 (UTC)}}

* Id: 9E0CCEB
* User: Mike Peel

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)#rfc_E97EDAB|Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)]] expired 2019-06-03 19:01 ===
* Id: E97EDAB
* User: Cyberpower678
* Date: 2019-05-17 17:45:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|897537834|PROP 897537834}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|902120315|PROP 902120315}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Since May 2015, [[User:InternetArchiveBot]], aka IABot, has been continuously working to restore dead URLs by relinking them to archive snapshots.  While IABot primarily links to Wayback Machine URLs, it‚Äôs able to handle over 20 different archive services.  To date more than 10 million ‚Äúbroken‚Äù links have been repaired.  This has helped a great deal to enforcing and maintaining [[WP:VERIFIABILITY]].

Today, I am proposing a new feature of IABot to add links to referenced books from Archive.org.  IABot will search for books referenced in enwiki articles and link to any it finds available at archive.org.  Book references containing page numbers will link straight to those pages allowing editors and readers to more easily verify the contents of an article referencing the book.  [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Martin_Luther_King_Jr.&diff=892626553&oldid=892625155 Here] is an example of such an edit IABot would be making to an article.

An example of the benefit of this proposal can be seen on this article: [[Martin Luther King Jr.]]  where pages from 54 referenced books are now just a click away from readers.  For example Citation #1.  As can be seen, any book reference with page numbers will make the title and the page numbers link straight to the desired page of the referenced book.  References that have the title wiki-linked elsewhere will only have the page numbers linked.‚Äî[[User:Cyberpower678|'''<span style="color:darkgrey;font-family:monospace">CYBERPOWER</span>''']] <span style="font-family:Rockwell">([[User talk:Cyberpower678|<span style="color:olive">Chat</span>]])</span> 17:45, 17 May 2019 (UTC)}}


=== [[Talk:Republic of China (1912‚Äì1949)#rfc_9D38B7C|Talk:Republic of China (1912‚Äì1949)]] expired 2019-06-04 06:01 ===
* Id: 9D38B7C
* User: Cunard
* Date: 2019-05-05 05:29:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|895572315|HIST 895572315}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|895572317|POL 895572317}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|900217970|HIST 900217970}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|900217971|POL 900217971}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Rfc on using which map is more suitable for encyclopedic purpose.

A. existing SVG map [[:File:Republic of China (orthographic projection, historical).svg]] draw by wiki user (note, in case of anything wrong , we can ask the user to redraw the SVG)

B. use [[:File:China 1933.jpg]]

C. other proposal such as use {{para|alt_map}}.

Note that both map (A,B) are ''de jure'' border. The border of effective control was constantly change due to foreign occupied (semi)-colony area ([[Outer Manchuria]], etc.), as well as Japanese invasion (Taiwan, [[Manchukuo]], etc) as well as self-declared independence ([[Mongolia]], 1921), etc. <small>RfC relisted by [[User:Cunard|Cunard]] ([[User talk:Cunard|talk]]) at 05:29, 5 May 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Indigenous intellectual property#rfc_DD46CFD|Talk:Indigenous intellectual property]] expired 2019-06-05 17:01 ===
* Id: DD46CFD
* User: SolarStorm1859 (lostpwd)
* Date: 2019-05-31 20:33:00

=== [[Talk:The New York Times#rfc_40D72B0|Talk:The New York Times]] expired 2019-06-06 04:01 ===
* Id: 40D72B0
* User: Joshgladwin
* Date: 2019-05-07 03:31:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|895935500|MEDIA 895935500}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|900505650|MEDIA 900505650}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Hello. I'm hoping to add under section 7.6 (Israeli-Palestinian conflict) details of the recent publication of an anti-semitic cartoon and acknowledgement of such by the NYT editorial board [https://www.nytimes.com/2019/04/30/opinion/cartoon-nytimes.html]. This is the first time NYT has acknowledged the publication of something which in its opinion, contained anti-semitic tropes.
 
This is especially to better counter-balance the statement in source citation 244 that by the NYT public editor Clark Hoyt that the newspaper "has tried its best to do a fair, balanced and complete job ‚Äî and has largely succeeded".

I also think comment from the cartoonist can be added, in which he contends that there was no anti-semitic intent: [https://www.jpost.com/Diaspora/Cartoonist-of-NYT-caricature-to-Post-I-have-nothing-against-the-Jews-588291]
[[User:Joshgladwin|Joshgladwin]][[User:Joshgladwin|Joshgladwin]] ([[User talk:Joshgladwin|talk]]) 03:31, 7 May 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Jean-Pierre Petit#rfc_6B2C53A|Talk:Jean-Pierre Petit]] expired 2019-06-06 21:01 ===
* Id: 6B2C53A
* User: Theoretical1A9
* Date: 2019-05-07 20:32:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|896011197|SCI 896011197}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|900646660|SCI 900646660}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Request for comment to help with article, which is currently at risk of becoming an edit war. Article is strongly biased and suggests that the individual is a prominent and influential scientist with wide community support. However individual is a fringe pseudoscientist that claims to have conversed with aliens. Supporters are regularly spamming other Wiki pages (see [[Bimetric gravity]] and [[Thibault Damour]] which borders on the defamatory and is completely inaccurate) and removing their valuable content. For example, a recent change to the page includes lots of misleading information: including that there has been a peer-reviewed paper from Petit that has answered critics (in [[Progress in Physics]] which is a crackpot journal), and claimed that various papers (by Bodarenko and others) were speaking positively of Petit's work (which they did not do, they just politely mention it!). This is misleading for actual scientists and young scientists that learn from Wikipedia. Most posts all come from a single user, which others have also complained about. Please help to find sensible balance on this article. [[User:Theoretical1A9|Theoretical1A9]] ([[User talk:Theoretical1A9|talk]]) 20:32, 7 May 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Biographies of living persons#rfc_CEC0488|Wikipedia talk:Biographies of living persons]] expired 2019-06-08 21:01 ===
* Id: CEC0488
* User: Bender235
* Date: 2019-05-26 18:19:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|898916660|BIO 898916660}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|900974908|BIO 900974908}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
{{TL;DR}} (i) We do not need [[WP:DOB]], because we have [[WP:RS]]. (ii) If there exists a reliable source for a notable person‚Äôs birthdate that ''we'' can find, that same source can be found by any potential identity thieve, hence the privacy concern is a red herring. (iii) We should only censor a reliably-sourced DOB if the article‚Äôs subject takes active measures that indicate their privacy concern, such as [[WP:OTRS|filing an OTRS ticket]]. --[[User:Bender235|bender235]] ([[User talk:Bender235|talk]]) 18:19, 26 May 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style#rfc_84E0F1F|Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style]] expired 2019-06-09 20:01 ===
* Id: 84E0F1F
* User: Kees08
* Date: 2019-05-10 19:15:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|896395181|STYLE 896395181}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|901114630|STYLE 901114630}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I propose copying NASA's style guidelines verbatim: "In general, all references to the space program should be non-gender-specific (e.g., human, piloted, unpiloted, robotic, as opposed to manned or unmanned). The exception to the rule is when referring to the Manned Spaceflight Center (also known as the Manned Spacecraft Center), the predecessor of Johnson Space Center in Houston, or to any other historical program name or official title that included ‚Äúmanned‚Äù (e.g., Associate Administrator for Manned Spaceflight)." '''<span style="background:#B1810B; padding:2px; border-style:solid; border-width:1px">[[User:Kees08|<span style=color:#FFFFFF;">Kees08</span>]][[User talk:Kees08|<span style=color:#FFFFFF;"> (Talk)</span>]]</span>''' 19:15, 10 May 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Call-out culture#rfc_B9E10D7|Talk:Call-out culture]] expired 2019-06-12 00:01 ===
* Id: B9E10D7
* User: Bacondrum
* Date: 2019-05-12 23:44:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|896800686|SOC 896800686}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|901454431|SOC 901454431}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
 
I've edited this page down to a paragraph basically, because the article as it [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Call-out_culture&oldid=894960329 was] contained mostly primary sources - op-eds - and these were mostly authored by people in completely unrelated fields, with no expertise on the subject. I may have missed something, but the page did not read like an encyclopedic entry and the citations were completely inappropriate, across the board. I'd like feedback about sources and the page in general, I personally think the page should be deleted or merged, failing that it should be concise, encyclopedic, accurate and properly cited, not a meandering list of opinion, cited with opinion pieces. Other editors want to reinstate the assertions backed by op-eds, I think these assertions, based on op-eds are opinion 100% POV and should not be published here. [[User:Bacondrum|Bacondrum]] ([[User talk:Bacondrum|talk]]) 23:44, 12 May 2019 (UTC)}}

* {{tq|Posting another editor's personal information is harassment, unless that person has voluntarily posted their own information, or links to such information, on Wikipedia.}}

# {{tq|unless that person has voluntarily posted their own information, or links to such information, <u>on the English Wikipedia or another public Wikimedia project</u>.}}
# {{tq|unless that person has voluntarily posted their own information, or links to such information, <u>on the English Wikipedia</u>.}}

=== [[Talk:LGBT rights in the Pitcairn Islands#rfc_810694D|Talk:LGBT rights in the Pitcairn Islands]] expired 2019-06-13 21:01 ===
* Id: 810694D
* User: 42.3.195.74
* Date: 2019-06-01 15:55:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|899817725|POL 899817725}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|913717590|POL 913717590}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
When did same-sex sexual activity decriminalised in the Pitcairn Islands?

The current version citing the 2015 State-Sponsored Homophobia report by ILGA says it was in 2001. However after some research, I found that the laws in force in England are generally apply to the Pitcairn Islands, especially the laws related to sexual offences. [[Pitcairn sexual assault trial of 2004]] showed that the [[Sexual Offences Act 1956]] was applicable to the Pitcairn Islands. The Judicature Ordinance 1961 of the Pitcairn Islands stated that

‚Äò7. Subject to the provisions of section 8 of this Ordinance the substance of the law for the time being in force in and for England shall be in force in the Islands.

8. All of the laws of England extended to the Islands by this Ordinance shall be in force therein so far only us the local circumstances and the limits of local jurisdiction permit and subject to any existing or future Ordinance and for the purpose of facilitating the application of the said laws it shall be lawful to construe the same with such formal alterations not affecting the substance as to names, localities, courts, officers, persons, moneys, penalties and otherwise as may be necessary to render the same applicable to the circumstances.' ([http://www.paclii.org/pn/cases/PNSC/2005/1.html] para 93)

Therefore I think the [[Sexual Offences Act 1967]] which decriminalised same-sex sexual activity should also applicable to the Pitcairn Islands.--[[Special:Contributions/42.3.195.74|42.3.195.74]] ([[User talk:42.3.195.74|talk]]) 15:55, 1 June 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Audi Q3#rfc_2E29172|Talk:Audi Q3]] expired 2019-06-16 23:01 ===
* Id: 2E29172
* User: Vauxford
* Date: 2019-06-16 13:04:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|902091787|UNSORTED 902091787}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|902152421|UNSORTED 902152421}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
[[File:Audi Q3 1Y7A4914.jpg|thumb|Current one]]
[[File:2019 Audi Q3 S Line 35 TDi S-A 2.0 Front.jpg|thumb|Proposed change]]
[[File:2019 Audi Q3 S Line 35 TFSi 1.5.jpg|thumb|Alternative photo]]
I dispute the previous consensus, because it was ended prematurely by a user. A lot of the reason for the closing were more personal rather then about the image and I find this unfair and both the initial proposed and alternative image I added on there didn't get a chance to be evaluate properly, again, it was mostly personal remarks about the user (me) then the actual photo. I just want to see what others think/decide which of the follow should be used at a unbiased, neutral approach on it. 

Main reason why I oppose the grey image being used is stuff such as the white reflection effect on the windshield and bonnet on the grey car, the blue one has less then that and the headlights aren't fogged up due to where it was taken and are clear and sharp. It also been taken from a weird elevated place while the blue one was photographed at standing height. There also red splodge sources around the grille and bumper which the blue car also doesn't has. The image tilted which I believe was done so it can be promoted to QI, since one of the guidelines for promoting a image to QI is the tilt/perspective should be corrected, even if it means the car isn't at a angle you want it to be. I also believe preferring a image over the other simply because it a QI (the grey car) is irrational due to the several problems I stated above. --[[User:Vauxford|Vauxford]] ([[User talk:Vauxford|talk]]) 13:04, 16 June 2019 (UTC)}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|897643939|POL 897643939}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|902229279|HIST 902229279}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|913717590|POL 913717590}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There is a dispute between points of view on that page. The dispute has grown around the fact that there is already an article ‚Äì [[Government of the Soviet Union]], therefore there is no need to make an article about one period of the Soviet Government - Council of People's Commissars of the Soviet Union (1923‚Äì1946). I argue that the article is important, because it describes a significant part of the activities of the Government of Leninist and the early Stalinist Soviet Union. This article describes certain features of the Government of the Soviet Union, which were already foreign to the successor, Council of Ministers of the Soviet Union (Council of Ministers of the Soviet Union page was deleted and redirected to the Government of the Soviet Union too, I'm not the creator of that page). In the Russian Wikipedia, there is a separate article for the Council of People's Commissars and the Council of Ministers of the Soviet Union. To not make this an edit war, I hope that Wikipedia community will review that problem and will make a subsequent decision. [[User:MarcusTraianus|MarcusTraianus]] ([[User talk:MarcusTraianus|talk]]) 12:18, 18 May 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Chuck Tingle#rfc_7CAC8FF|Talk:Chuck Tingle]] expired 2019-06-17 15:01 ===
* Id: 7CAC8FF
* User: JasonAQuest
* Date: 2019-05-22 21:13:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|898338860|MEDIA 898338860}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|902874296|MEDIA 902874296}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
From time to time, as the "Bibliography" section has grown to dominate the article (due to the author sometimes releasing several new items each month), editors have suggested/executed removal of it, or editing it for noteworthiness. Other editors have objected to this, and restored it. -[[User:JasonAQuest|Jason A. Quest]] ([[User talk:JasonAQuest|talk]]) 21:13, 22 May 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Talk pages consultation 2019/Phase 2#rfc_EEACA60|Wikipedia:Talk pages consultation 2019/Phase 2]] expired 2019-06-17 15:01 ===
* Id: EEACA60
* User: Jc86035
* Date: 2019-05-18 14:03:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/WikiProjects_and_collaborations|prev|897663585|PROJ 897663585}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|897663590|TECH 897663590}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/WikiProjects_and_collaborations|prev|902245509|PROJ 902245509}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|902245511|TECH 902245511}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
{{Anchor| ph2 timetable}}Phase 2 of the [[:mw:Talk pages consultation 2019|2019 talk pages consultation]] began on 17 May 2019 and is tentatively scheduled to end on 15 June 2019.

Feedback from the first phase, which occurred between 21 February 2019 and 6 April 2019, has been evaluated and turned into [[:mw:Talk pages consultation 2019/Phase 1 report|a report]]. Based on the first phase's discussions, six main questions are being asked. (The questions, their section headers and the contextual information are quoted verbatim in the subsections below, under [[#Main questions|¬ß Main questions]].) Anyone may also begin a new discussion of their choice under [[#Other discussions|¬ß Other discussions]].

In the first phase, the English Wikipedia was registered as a single "participant group"; this is to be the same in Phase 2. About 100 editors participated in [[Wikipedia:Talk pages consultation 2019/Phase 1|the local discussion]], and more than 300 other editors participated elsewhere. In this phase, there is also to be an option to give feedback through a Qualtrics survey (which has not been opened yet); as in the first phase, feedback can also be given [[:mw:Talk pages consultation 2019/Individual feedback#Phase 2 questions|on mediawiki.org]] and in discussions on other fora.

As in the first phase, [[#ph2 timetable|at the end of the discussion]], a summary is to be posted to mediawiki.org. [[User:Jc86035|Jc86035]] ([[User talk:Jc86035|talk]]) 14:03, 18 May 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Princess Michael of Kent#rfc_84C0774|Talk:Princess Michael of Kent]] expired 2019-06-18 07:01 ===
* Id: 84C0774
* Date: 2019-05-19 06:05:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|897764843|BIO 897764843}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|902352032|BIO 902352032}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There are two different allegations in this section, the truth of which cannot be confirmed and apparently she hasn't responded to them. The first one is her alleged reaction to "research by Dorothy Cheney and Robert Seyfarth seemed to indicate that rank among female baboons is hereditary." While some may argue in favor of keeping this one, the second one, which has been made by her daughter's ex-boyfriend could potentially be a lie. He has alleged that while he was dating her daughter he realized that she had named two sheep after Venus and Serena Williams. This is just a rumor made by an attention-seeking person and, in my opinion, has no basis whatsoever. Should we keep them or remove them? <span style="font:'Pristina'">[[user:Keivan.f|<span style="color: #1E7HDC">Keivan.f</span>]]</span><span style="font:'Pristina'"><sup>[[user_talk:Keivan.f|<span style="color: purple">Talk</span>]]</sup></span> 06:05, 19 May 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Catholic Church and homosexuality#rfc_4543613|Talk:Catholic Church and homosexuality]] expired 2019-06-19 10:01 ===
* Id: 4543613
* User: Contaldo80
* Date: 2019-06-19 05:25:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|902490487|UNSORTED 902490487}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|902510123|UNSORTED 902510123}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The article describes a protest in St Patrick's cathedral by some gay activists. Should we keep the term "Eucharist" when describing their actions or is another term more relevant here?
''No'' - There are four sources cited for this section in the article. None of them uses the term "Eucharist" (which is a term only Roman Catholics use). Instead the sources use "communion wafer". The [[Eucharist]] more correctly refers to the rite in which sacramental bread is used.[[User:Contaldo80|Contaldo80]] ([[User talk:Contaldo80|talk]]) 05:25, 19 June 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Kodomo no Jikan#rfc_1477E77|Talk:Kodomo no Jikan]] expired 2019-06-19 14:01 ===
* Id: 1477E77
* User: Sk8erPrince
* Date: 2019-05-20 13:46:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|897965419|MEDIA 897965419}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|917192339|MEDIA 917192339}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
It's time to put an end to this dispute. I, for one, believe that Kodomo no Jikan is undeniably [[lolicon]], as it is blatantly pedophilic in nature. Why? Because of the [[:File:Kodomo no Jikan TV-DVD comparison.jpg|sexualization]] of 9 year old girls, the forbidden relationship between the 23 year old teacher (the main character) and his 9 year old student (they even engage in sexual intercourse in the manga's final chapter), and the fact that this stance is further validated by an industry professional, Zac Bertschy, who writes for [[Anime News Network]]. Quoting his [https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/answerman/2007-05-18 Answerman entry], " This is - I think, anyway - the first '''lolicon''' title that's explicit enough to be released here with shrinkwrap, so the potential for danger is probably higher than it is with yaoi manga, but for right now I'm not sure I'd be panicked about this release." [[User:Sk8erPrince|Sk8erPrince]] ([[User talk:Sk8erPrince|talk]]) 13:46, 20 May 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Electric smoking system#rfc_77CF4EF|Talk:Electric smoking system]] expired 2019-06-25 02:02 ===
* Id: 77CF4EF
* User: QuackGuru
* Date: 2019-06-16 17:29:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|902120308|ECON 902120308}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|902120310|SCI 902120310}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|906566957|ECON 906566957}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|906566961|SCI 906566961}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=

=== [[Talk:China‚ÄìUnited States trade war#rfc_ABC3F61|Talk:China‚ÄìUnited States trade war]] expired 2019-06-26 17:01 ===
* Id: ABC3F61
* Date: 2019-05-27 16:46:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|899062400|ECON 899062400}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|899584106|POL 899584106}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|903598424|ECON 903598424}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|913717590|POL 913717590}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This is effectively an [[WP:ATTACK|attack page]]. Its only purpose is to disparage its subject (China) by presenting the topic with a significant pro-U.S. slant, to the extent that it reads more like sinophobic propaganda rather than neutral encyclopedic content. I have no explicit views on the matter, but this article really wants me to support the Trump administration. That is not what Wikipedia articles are intended to be.

I had cold feet on actually nominating this for speedy deletion ''as'' an attack page, but then I realized that might be considered [[WP:POINT]]y (since usually a G10 is used for actual libel. I have not seen it applied to any article whose content has reached a point that it is effectively a biased attack against one of its subjects‚Äîperson, [[Corporate personhood|corporate person]], nation, or not). I think this article, at this rate, needs to be restarted and rewritten neutrally from the start, so that we can present objective information without bias on this crucial trade dispute. <span style="border:1px solid #445A38;padding:1px;">[[User:ViperSnake151|<span style="color:#8f5902">ViperSnake151</span>]] [[User_talk:ViperSnake151|<span style="color:#fff;background:#88A976;">&nbsp;Talk&nbsp;</span>]] </span> 16:46, 27 May 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_410FD03|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2019-06-28 14:01 ===
* Id: 410FD03
* User: PluniaZ
* Date: 2019-05-30 04:16:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|899461418|MEDIA 899461418}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|899461420|POL 899461420}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|903975274|MEDIA 903975274}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|903975278|PROP 903975278}}

Which of the following best describes the [[WP:RS|reliability]] of ''[[Campaign_Life_Coalition#LifeSiteNews|LifeSiteNews]]''?
*'''Option 1:''' Generally [[WP:RS|reliable]] for factual reporting
*'''Option 2:''' Unclear or additional considerations apply
*'''Option 3:''' Generally [[WP:QUESTIONABLE|unreliable]] for factual reporting
*'''Option 4:''' Publishes false or fabricated information, and should be [[WP:DEPS|deprecated]] as in the [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard/Archive 220#Daily Mail RfC|2017 RfC]] of the ''[[Daily Mail]]''
--[[User:PluniaZ|PluniaZ]] ([[User talk:PluniaZ|talk]]) 04:16, 30 May 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Disambiguation#rfc_30B3DD6|Wikipedia talk:Disambiguation]] expired 2019-06-29 02:01 ===
* Id: 30B3DD6
* Date: 2019-05-30 01:18:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|899439161|POLICY 899439161}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|903959037|POLICY 903959037}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Until a few years ago the sole purpose of PRIMARYTOPIC was to arrange articles by titles in a manner that made the articles most likely to be sought the easiest (fewest clicks) ones to find. As such, the only criteria associated with it was the usage criteria:
* {{tq|A topic is '''primary''' for a term with respect to {{em|usage}} if it is highly likely‚Äîmuch more likely than any other single topic, and more likely than all the other topics combined‚Äîto be the topic sought when a reader searches for that term.}}
The idea is that anyone searching with, say, "wish you were here" is most likely looking for the Pink Floyd album, and so that's where they should be taken. However, some editors felt "primary" implied some level of relative long-term importance, and, after much discussion, the long-term significance criteria was added so that there was policy basis for taking relative importance under consideration when deciding on primary topic. However, this leads to conflicting guidance in situations where the two criteria indicate different titles.  Should we help readers get to the Pink Floyd album because that's what the vast majority are seeking, or should we put a dab page at [[Wish You Were Here]] and make everyone go through all that even though the vast majority is looking for the album?

I've long believed that if PRIMARYTOPIC was named something else, without the term "primary", then people wouldn't be so hung up on putting what they believe to be the "most important" article at the basename of the title.  Therefore, in order to resolve these conflicts in a consistent fashion, and to help our users by arranging our articles so that articles most likely to be sought with a given term are where those terms lead, I hereby propose:
# Rename PRIMARYTOPIC to MOSTSOUGHTTOPIC
# Remove the long-term significance criteria

--[[User:Born2cycle|–í¬≤C]] [[User_talk:Born2cycle#top|‚òé]] 01:18, 30 May 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Supernova#rfc_08BF6D2|Talk:Supernova]] expired 2019-06-29 15:01 ===
* Id: 08BF6D2
* Date: 2019-06-29 04:07:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|903975280|UNSORTED 903975280}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|904036420|UNSORTED 904036420}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
{{u|Attic Salt}} contends that : "A supernova  is a transient astronomical event that occurs during the last stages of the life of a massive star or white dwarf, the destruction of which is marked by a titanic explosion."[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Supernova&action=historysubmit&type=revision&diff=903964658&oldid=903956147]  They justify this addition by saying: "Since the article discusses SN from both massive stars and white dwarfs, the defining first sentence can't mention one without mentioning the other, otherwise the reader will be confused."[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Talk%3ASupernova&action=historysubmit&type=revision&diff=903870377&oldid=903839965] Yet they still think: "No, it doesn‚Äôt say ‚Äúall‚Äù white dwarfs, but rather ‚Äúa‚Äù white dwarf."[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Supernova&type=revision&diff=903964658&oldid=903956147]

As white dwarf stars above the limit (called the Chandrasekhar limit) of about 1.4 Solar masses will go supernova, but as given in initial statement (above) plainly infers that ALL white dwarfs go supernova.

There is also a contradiction, in that saying: "...that occurs during the last stages of the life of a massive star or white dwarf‚Ä¶", when a white dwarf is considered as ended its life as a star because it no longer creates energy by fusion while energy by a white dwarf is created by gravitational contraction.

This statement is therefore false and a fallacy. 

Knowing that the number of these stars near 1.4 solar masses are rare, with the majority being less than this mass. Also these single white dwarf stars were likely once massive stars. Furthermore, the vast majority of massive stars, do go supernova.

Should "or white dwarf" in this statement be removed to fix this fallacy? 04:07, 29 June 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Air Force Amy#rfc_A0F7D02|Talk:Air Force Amy]] expired 2019-06-29 21:01 ===
* Id: A0F7D02
* User: John B123
* Date: 2019-05-30 20:43:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|899558742|BIO 899558742}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|904079025|BIO 904079025}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Over the past few months, DOB & birth name has been multiple times, mainly by an IP but on 1 occasion by {{u|Airforceamy}}. Myself and other editors have reverted these changes. The edit summary (where given), started with ''"showing my DOB is destroying my business"'' and has grown into ''"I implore you to remove my real name and DOB. None of my work is cited as Deanne Salinger. This whole page is about my stage and work name Deanne Salinger. Please see this article to see some of the dangers of having my really famous prostitute name published along with my stage name. i feel in danger due to this. If you can't remove my name and DOB, remove my page altogether."''

Her name and DOB are freely available online, for example [https://www.imdb.com/name/nm1209170/bio?ref_=nm_ov_bio_sm] and [https://www.whosdatedwho.com/dating/air-force-amy], so any stalker/wrongdoer could easily obtain them whether they are on WP or not.

Should this information be included on the article? --[[User:John B123|John B123]] ([[User talk:John B123|talk]]) 20:43, 30 May 2019 (UTC)}}
