=== [[Talk:List of French marquisates#rfc_3A36825|Talk:List of French marquisates]] expired 2019-07-01 16:01 ===
* Id: 3A36825
* User: Robert McClenon
* Date: 2019-06-01 15:46:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|899817721|HIST 899817721}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|899817730|SOC 899817730}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|904352338|HIST 904352338}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|904352342|SOC 904352342}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Which of the following criteria should be used for inclusion in the list?

A.  This list also contains "marquisates of usage", which may only be courtesy titles used by descendants of those who assumed titles, or may be legally created but incompletely documented marquisates. Due to loss of records in fires, wars and deliberate destruction during the French revolution, it has not been established that these seigneuries were ever raised to formal marquisates. Recent archive findings have shown that some titles previously believed to be only courtesy titles are, in fact, raised marquisates.

B.  For reasons of reliability, this list must contains only legal and authentic titles of marquisates with reference sources and not [[courtesy titles]] of marquisates without any evidence that these titles were officialy raised or recognized as marquisates by a French sovereign.

State your opinion only with a brief reason in the Survey as A or B, where A is the previous version of the criterion.  Do not reply to other statements in the Survey.  You may discuss civilly in the Threaded Discussion. [[User:Robert McClenon|Robert McClenon]] ([[User talk:Robert McClenon|talk]]) 15:46, 1 June 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of WWE personnel#rfc_A0E6C5B|Talk:List of WWE personnel]] expired 2019-07-02 21:01 ===
* Id: A0E6C5B
* Date: 2019-07-02 16:19:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|904507758|UNSORTED 904507758}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|904539090|UNSORTED 904539090}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This has been disputed several times recently, so I am starting an official RFC on the matter. Does [[Shane McMahon]] winning the [[SmackDown Tag Team Championship]] mean he becomes an active roster participant rather than administrative role? Does [[Drake Maverick]] winning the [[WWE 24/7 Championship]] mean that he is now a 205 wrestler rather than GM? Does [[Becky Lynch]] winning the [[Raw Women's Championship]] mean that she is a Raw wrestler while still being listed as SmackDown on WWE.com?

Does winning a championship make you a wrestler? Should a wrestler winning a different brand's championship mean they should switch brands? In short, does winning a championship dictate your placement, or should it just be included as a note. - '''''[[User:Galatz|<span style="color: #000080">Galatz ◊í◊ê◊ú◊ô◊•</span>]][[User_talk:Galatz|<span style="color: #FF0000"><sup>◊©◊ô◊ó◊î Talk</sup></span>]]''''' 16:19, 2 July 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Today's featured article#rfc_B0E2514|Wikipedia talk:Today's featured article]] expired 2019-07-08 04:01 ===
* Id: B0E2514
* User: Coffeeandcrumbs
* Date: 2019-06-08 03:33:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|900870774|HIST 900870774}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|900870778|POLICY 900870778}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|905284354|HIST 905284354}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|905284358|POLICY 905284358}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
: ''See also {{Oldid2|892305910|RFC_Ignore_All_Rules_for_50th_anniversary_of_the_Apollo_11_moon_landing|RfC to IAR for DYK}}''
This RfC is to determine what to do on the Main Page during the week of the 50th anniversary of Apollo 11.

Here are some possible options:
*'''Option 1''': Run all the FAs ([[Neil Armstrong]], [[Buzz Aldrin]], [[Michael Collins (astronaut)]], and [[Apollo 11]]) during the week of July 16 thru July 24 with exact dates to be determined later.
*'''Option 2''': Only have [[Neil Armstrong]] as TFA and construct the July 21 Main Page something like so: [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Space 2019/Main Page/July 21]] with Collins appearing at DYK, Aldrin at OTD, and Apollo 11 at TFP. However, reserve the TFAs of [[Michael Collins (astronaut)]] and [[Buzz Aldrin]] to be posted at a later date (like their birthdays, etc.). Also reserve [[Apollo 11]] for a later date.
*'''Option 3''': A combination of the above two options where all FAs appear during the week and July 21 is constructed like [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Space 2019/Main Page/July 21]].
*'''Option 4''': Follow the established policies and guidelines. Do not have so many similar subjects featured on the Main Page during the same week.
*''Added'' '''Option 5''': Use the Obama/McCain model, randomizing which FA appears on July 21.
*''Added'' '''Option 5a''': Use the Obama/McCain model, randomizing all 4 FAs to appear for 48 hours on July 20 and July 21.
Options 1, 2 and 3 require a some application of [[WP:IAR]]. Note that there has been [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia_talk:Did_you_know&oldid=892305910#RFC_Ignore_All_Rules_for_50th_anniversary_of_the_Apollo_11_moon_landing a previous RfC about DYK]. 
A notice has been posted at the Village Pump, WT:DYK, WT:POTD, and WT:OTD to garner wider input.---&nbsp;[[User talk:Coffeeandcrumbs|<span style="color:#CC2200">Coffee</span>]]<nowiki/>and[[Special:Contributions/Coffeeandcrumbs|<span style="color:#663366">crumbs</span>]] 03:33, 8 June 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of one-hit wonders in the United States#rfc_6349843|Talk:List of one-hit wonders in the United States]] expired 2019-07-09 18:01 ===
* Id: 6349843
* User: CaptainPrimo
* Date: 2019-07-09 06:57:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|905456193|MEDIA 905456193}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|905526741|MEDIA 905526741}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
One hit wonder is not a neutral term and kind of offensive. I don't think Wikipedia should be labeling artists as such in an article. If Wikipedia has to have such an article however it should be based on on objective standard. Wayne Jancik is someone who has devoted himself to the study of the phenomena and has come up with a concrete definition that has been sanctioned by being published by Billboard the official arbiter of American pop music charts. In America placing on the Top 40 is widely considered the defining quality of being a hit. It is not based on how much a song is remember by a particular audience which varies based on the musical interests of the audience in question anyways. I for one know and love a lot of songs by the artists currently listed on this page. I can overlook their inclusion if these songs are unknown by a significant enough number of people as calculated by their failure to place on the Top 40. What annoys me though is artists like A Flock of Seagulls and a-ha being listed even while having multiple songs that placed on the Top 40 and are still listened to by a lot of people are included.

A major argument against the Top 40 criteria was that this constitutes original research. Since Jancik's series of books list every artist to place in the Top 40 up to about 1992 it wouldn't be original research to list the one hit wonders of the 50s, 60s, 70s and 80s as represented by objective data. These eras were free of complications like artists without physical releases not placing on the charts, artists being featured on tracks of others that become hits (as has become common since the 2000s) and the like - so not a lot of complications would arise from this. The Top 40 was indisputably the metric to judge what constitutes a hit in this period. [[User:CaptainPrimo|CaptainPrimo]] ([[User talk:CaptainPrimo|talk]]) 06:57, 9 July 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Sabine Weyand#rfc_C0D0808|Talk:Sabine Weyand]] expired 2019-07-09 23:01 ===

* User: Oska
* Date: 2019-06-09 22:56:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|901136275|BIO 901136275}}

Perceived [[WP:Coatrack]] issue with this biography article. Comments requested on whether there was a coat-rack problem with the older version of the article and, if so, whether the newer, reworked version restores the focus onto the subject of the article and restores balance. [[User:Oska|Oska]] ([[User talk:Oska|talk]]) 22:56, 9 June 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Eurovision Song Contest 2020#rfc_C7F339A|Talk:Eurovision Song Contest 2020]] expired 2019-07-10 10:01 ===
* Id: C7F339A
* User: 93.159.251.2
* Date: 2019-07-01 12:37:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|904331085|POL 904331085}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|904331088|SOC 904331088}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|905633218|POL 905633218}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|905633223|SOC 905633223}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Catalonia is part of Spain, so the autonomous community taking part in the Eurovision Song Contest (2020) is unlikely and probably not feasible due the European Broadcasting Union's rules for entering the contest. However, Catalonia's CCMA and TV3 have aspirations to join similar to other, fully-fledged countries, which has been reported on frequently in the past. This leaves the question, should Catalonia be included in our list of potential candidate broadcasters? This is an [[WP:RFC|RfC]], please reply with either '''Include''' or '''Exclude''', coupled with an explanation for the stance provided. As long as this discussion is open, Catalonia should not be removed from the list to avoid edit warring. [[Special:Contributions/93.159.251.2|93.159.251.2]] ([[User talk:93.159.251.2|talk]]) 12:37, 1 July 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Christchurch mosque shootings#rfc_B39DB4A|Talk:Christchurch mosque shootings]] expired 2019-07-10 12:01 ===
* Id: B39DB4A
* User: 161.29.221.149
* Date: 2019-06-14 08:01:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|905595021|UNSORTED 905595021}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|905644286|UNSORTED 905644286}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
== Can you say "Brenton Tarrant" in the lead yet? '''

I've only just read this article today and it seems bizarre that Tarrant's name is not mentioned in the lead or infobox. I see there was a previous RFC, the objections were along the lines of:

''[[WP:NOTNEWS]] Too soon to include the name of the suspect.'' 

:Most of these votes were within days of the shooting and was right and proper to wait for reliable sources in the wake of a major incident. Since then Tarrant has appeared in court several times with 92 charges brought against him. There are plenty of reliable sources stating that he is the suspect and what the charges against him are.

''[[WP:BLPCRIME]] This is a living person with the right to the presumption of innocence.'' 

:The lead and info box must make it very clear that at this time Tarrant a '''suspect''' charged with the crimes and not refer to him in any other way which would pre-judge the outcome of the case.

''[[WP:NOTNOTABLE]] Undue prominence of a non notable person.'' 
:There is strong evidence that Tarrant seeks notoriety and people are loath to give his name more prominence that is absolutely necessary. There was a period of self censorship of Tarrant's name in New Zealand news media and even the New Zealand Prime Minister has vowed to not speak his name. However, the fact is that Tarrant has gained instant notoriety as the suspect in this mass shooting and there is no name suppression. 

Let's remember [[WP:NOTCENSORED]]. Put Tarrant's name in the lead and infobox as the suspect in this case, the article is incomplete without it.

[[Special:Contributions/161.29.221.149|161.29.221.149]] ([[User talk:161.29.221.149|talk]]) 08:01, 14 June 2019 (UTC)}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the following passage be included in the article:

Although famine had occurred during other periods in Bengal at times of water shortage due to low rainfall, a 2019 study published in ''[[Geophysical Research Letters]]'' analyzed weather records and found that rain levels were above average, and asserts that the 1943 famine was "completely due to the failure of policy during the British era".<ref name="Safi 2019">{{cite web | last=Safi | first=Michael | title=Churchill's policies contributed to 1943 Bengal famine ‚Äì study | website=the Guardian | date=2019-03-29 | url=http://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/mar/29/winston-churchill-policies-contributed-to-1943-bengal-famine-study | access-date=2019-03-29}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal |last= Mishra|first=Vimal|display-authors=etal. |date= 2019|title=Drought and Famine in India, 1870‚Äì2016|url= |journal=[[Geophysical Research Letters]]|volume=46 |issue=4 |pages=2075‚Äì2083|doi=10.1029/2018GL081477}}</ref>
{{reftalk}}
--[[User:C.J. Griffin|C.J. Griffin]] ([[User talk:C.J. Griffin|talk]]) 21:21, 11 June 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_BBB9E72|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2019-07-12 06:01 ===
* Id: BBB9E72
* User: Cambial Yellowing
* Date: 2019-06-28 11:19:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|903868226|ECON 903868226}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|908238773|POL 908238773}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There is very little comment on this publication. It is self-evidently somewhat to the right, but that is [[Wikipedia:Reliable_sources/Noticeboard/Archive_96#Wall_Street_Journal_is_usually_bogus|not an impediment to being accepted as a reliable source]] (given that all non-scientific publications will always carry ''some'' degree of bias). It has variously been described herein as a [[Wikipedia:Reliable_sources/Noticeboard/Archive_76#Independent_Political_Report|"major site"]], [[Wikipedia:Reliable_sources/Noticeboard/Archive_125#The_"Independent_Political_Report"|"reliable source"]], and [[Wikipedia:Reliable_sources/Noticeboard/Archive_3#Think_Tanks_as_A_Source|"reputable yet biased"]]. It includes much comment from academics and current and former (mostly the latter) intergovernmental agency and government staff members. Seeking comment as it is a significant site. <span style="white-space:nowrap;text-shadow:#4682B4 0.1em 0.1em 1.5em,#4682B4 -0.1em -0.1em 1.5em;color:#000000">[[User:Cambial Yellowing|<i style="color:#999900">Cambial Yellowing</i>]][[User talk:Cambial Yellowing|(‚ùß)]]</span> 11:19, 28 June 2019 (UTC)}}

[[User:Masumrezarock100|<u style="color:#087643;font-face:arial;text-shadow:gray 0.2em 0.2em 0.4em;">'''''Masum Reza'''''</u>]][[User_talk:Masumrezarock100|<sup style="color:orange;">''üìû''</sup>]] 12:01, 28 June 2019 (UTC)}}


=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (technical)#rfc_764B6B9|Wikipedia:Village pump (technical)]] expired 2019-07-14 14:01 ===
* Id: 764B6B9
* User: Nosebagbear
* Date: 2019-06-14 13:11:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|901821569|TECH 901821569}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|901821570|PROP 901821570}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|906229050|TECH 906229050}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|906229051|PROP 906229051}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Currently, one of the most backlogged processes is [[WP:ACC|Request an Account (ACC)]] , which exists mainly (though not entirely) for helping with 3 purposes: Those having trouble completing CAPTCHA; enabling the choosing of a username that is too similar to an existing username under certain circumstances & creating an account for those hindered by a rangeblock.

The current backlog on pending requests is 4 months.

In the last couple of months multiple editors have signed up to be ACC tool users, Tool users are signed up to the confidentiality agreement and meet various [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Request_an_account/Guide#Qualifications_for_using_the_interface other criteria]. 

Currently here are limits, however, on both their ability to create accounts. Two options could ease their work. 

#Raise the local account creation rate limit from 4 to 10. The new limit only to extended-confirmed users to prevent any abusive behaviour from IPs.
#Automatically grant [[Wikipedia:Account creator|account creator]] permission, on request, to new ACC tool users. This would allow them both to bypass the limit entirely, but would also let them ignore the antispoof and title blacklist when making accounts. 

<small>Pinging all participants in the local chat discussion: {{ping|Ajraddatz|FlightTime|xaosflux|TheSandDoctor|AfroThundr|QEDK|Oshwah}} [[User:Nosebagbear|Nosebagbear]] ([[User talk:Nosebagbear|talk]]) 13:11, 14 June 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Casio F-91W#rfc_748EC71|Talk:Casio F-91W]] expired 2019-07-16 02:01 ===
* Id: 748EC71
* User: Jacepulaski
* Date: 2019-06-17 14:01:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|902236927|SCI 902236927}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|906471407|SCI 906471407}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I am requesting comment on the acceptability of having the release year mentioned in this article changed from 1991 to 1989. I believe the 1991 release year stated in the article is incorrect, possibly due to citogenesis. There is an article [https://news3lv.com/around-the-web/the-case-of-an-iconic-watch-how-wikipedia-and-writers-create-false-facts-from-thin-air here] and a parts listing [https://www.pacparts.com/library/model.cfm?mfg=Casio&model_id=F91W-1&action=list_part&back=0 here] pointing to the correct release date being June of 1989. I have posted to RSN regarding reliability of the former source (news3lv) and have been told it's a reliable secondary source. The latter source (PacParts listing) was mentioned to be a usable primary source regarding release year in the same RSN response.

For full disclosure, this topic has been mentioned in a watch enthusiast discord that I({{u|Jacepulaski}}), {{u|Casio F91W-1}} and {{u|J0kerNL}} all participate in. I am very new to editing Wikipedia and have never done so before, and as such have had recent help from participants in [[WP:Discord]] to learn about contributing to talk page discussions but who also instructed me of their [[WP:CANVASS]]ing concerns. This has not been my intention, and I have asked all members of the watch enthusiasts discord to either not participate in this RFC, or to self-identify as being a member of it.[[User:Jacepulaski|Jacepulaski]] ([[User talk:Jacepulaski|talk]]) 14:01, 17 June 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Audi Q3#rfc_EE57D96|Talk:Audi Q3]] expired 2019-07-16 14:01 ===
* Id: EE57D96
* User: Vauxford
* Date: 2019-06-16 13:04:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|902152412|ECON 902152412}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|902152418|SCI 902152418}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|906537326|ECON 906537326}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|906537330|SCI 906537330}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
[[File:Audi Q3 1Y7A4914.jpg|thumb|Current one]]
[[File:2019 Audi Q3 S Line 35 TDi S-A 2.0 Front.jpg|thumb|Proposed change]]
[[File:2019 Audi Q3 S Line 35 TFSi 1.5.jpg|thumb|Alternative photo]]
I dispute the previous consensus, because it was ended prematurely by a user. A lot of the reason for the closing were more personal rather then about the image and I find this unfair and both the initial proposed and alternative image I added on there didn't get a chance to be evaluate properly, again, it was mostly personal remarks about the user (me) then the actual photo. I just want to see what others think/decide which of the follow should be used at a unbiased, neutral approach on it. 

Main reason why I oppose the grey image being used is stuff such as the white reflection effect on the windshield and bonnet on the grey car, the blue one has less then that and the headlights aren't fogged up due to where it was taken and are clear and sharp. It also been taken from a weird elevated place while the blue one was photographed at standing height. There also red splodge sources around the grille and bumper which the blue car also doesn't has. The image tilted which I believe was done so it can be promoted to QI, since one of the guidelines for promoting a image to QI is the tilt/perspective should be corrected, even if it means the car isn't at a angle you want it to be. I also believe preferring a image over the other simply because it a QI (the grey car) is irrational due to the several problems I stated above. --[[User:Vauxford|Vauxford]] ([[User talk:Vauxford|talk]]) 13:04, 16 June 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Beitar Illit#rfc_81DE115|Talk:Beitar Illit]] expired 2019-07-16 16:01 ===
* Id: 81DE115
* User: Debresser
* Date: 2019-07-16 14:15:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|906544839|UNSORTED 906544839}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|906552013|UNSORTED 906552013}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Recently, [[User:Nableezy]] added <code><nowiki>{{short description|Israeli settlement in the West Bank/Golan Heights}}</nowiki></code> to this article and a bunch of others. It is my opinion that this short description should be refined, here as well as in those other articles. In the case of Beitar e.g. that should be "Israeli city in the West Bank", in the case of [[Neve Ativ]] e.g. "Israeli moshav in the Golan Heights", etc.

Likewise it is my opinion that the first sentence of these articles should avoid wording like "Israeli settlement incorporated as a city/moshav", which these articles presently is part of their lead sentence in many cases. This is 1. unnecessarily verbose, 2. not the way we usually start article about [[human settlement]]s, and 3. redundant to the continuation of the lead which invariably contains some explanation to the fact that "The international community considers Israeli settlements in the West Bank/Golan Heights illegal under international law, but the Israeli government disputes this."

I am well aware that all of these are [[Israeli settlement]]s, just hold that the short description should be as refined as possible, while the fact that these cities/moshavs etc. are in the West Bank or the Golan Heights explains clearly enough that they are in the general category of "Israeli settlements". [[User:Debresser|Debresser]] ([[User talk:Debresser|talk]]) 14:15, 16 July 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Electric smoking system#rfc_75784EF|Talk:Electric smoking system]] expired 2019-07-16 18:02 ===
* Id: 75784EF
* User: QuackGuru
* Date: 2019-06-24 18:22:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|903598424|ECON 903598424}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|903598426|SCI 903598426}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|906574477|ECON 906574477}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|906574479|SCI 906574479}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
[[:Electric smoking system]] ‚Üí {{no redirect|Heat-not-burn product}} ‚Äì '''Heat-not-burn product''' is the only name I can think of that covers all the various types of heat-not-burn products discussed in the current article and therefore is the best option for the rename. [[User:QuackGuru|<b style="color: #e34234;">QuackGuru</b>]] ([[User talk:QuackGuru|<span style="color: #B02200;">talk</span>]]) 18:22, 24 June 2019 (UTC)}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should this article have a lead image? One view is that we shouldn't use a lead image because no lead image can adequately represent this topic, and [[MOS:LEADIMAGE]] addresses this type of thing. Another view is that a single lead image does not give the impression of representing all people, but simply represents an example of a person or persons. For backstory on this matter, see the [[Talk:African Americans#Reverted recently added lead image]] section on the article's talk page. [[User:Flyer22 Reborn|Flyer22 Reborn]] ([[User talk:Flyer22 Reborn|talk]]) 06:45, 20 June 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Waskom, Texas#rfc_B8BE77F|Talk:Waskom, Texas]] expired 2019-07-21 02:01 ===
* Id: B8BE77F
* User: WhisperToMe
* Date: 2019-06-21 01:40:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|902759390|POL 902759390}}

{{rfcquote|text=
[https://www.washingtonpost.com/nation/2019/06/13/waksom-texas-outlaws-abortion-five-men/?utm_term=.7b8c20fef7a2 There was a vote from the Waskom, Texas city council to ban abortion], even though abortion is allowed nationwide as per a Supreme Court ruling; this was covered in national newspapers. As of writing it is too early to tell how often/whether coverage of the same event will continue at national, statewide, and local levels.

The question is whether this vote is a significant enough detail to include in the history of the town. One editor argues that as per [[WP:NOTNEWS]] it is not significant enough, while myself and another editor disagree.  Please see the above discussion.
[[User:WhisperToMe|WhisperToMe]] ([[User talk:WhisperToMe|talk]]) 01:40, 21 June 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Apostles#rfc_238A6A7|Talk:Apostles]] expired 2019-07-21 02:01 ===
* Id: 238A6A7
* User: ApexUnderground
* Date: 2019-06-21 01:32:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|902759392|RELI 902759392}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|907177679|RELI 907177679}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I want to include the list of the Twelve Apostles in the lede by including a short pullquote from the [[Book of Luke]], which lists all twelve traditional apostles. Now this quote is dated from an exact moment in history, according to the Bible, where Jesus appointed the Twelve, before the removal of Judas Iscariot, and before his replacement with Paul of Tarsus. 

User:Epinoia makes it clear that he's firmly against the inclusion of the list, and has come up with a number of reasons, most of which are a kind of argument of Biblical errancy (sic "inerrancy"), where quoting the Book of Luke is improper because the same list doesn't appear in the other Gospels, and the number "Twelve" is some kind of fabrication, either because at some point there were dozens of apostles, or because Judas and Paul were simultaneously apostles, bumping the number up to thirteen. My argument is that the Twelve be identified and listed, quoting directly from the Bible, on the topic of the "Twelve Apostles" which is one of the subtitles of the article. -[[User:ApexUnderground|ApexUnderground]] ([[User talk:ApexUnderground|talk]]) 01:32, 21 June 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Domestic violence#rfc_916D00E|Talk:Domestic violence]] expired 2019-07-21 14:01 ===
* Id: 916D00E
* User: Musicwaves
* Date: 2019-06-21 13:46:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|902822210|POL 902822210}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|907236819|POL 907236819}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
In the second paragraph, it states that women are the overwhelming victims of domestic violence.  Fiebert's 2014 updated annotation of bibliographies describes 343 scholarily investigations (270 empirical studies and 73 reviews) demonstrating that women are as physically agressive as men.  The aggregate sample size exceeds 440,850 people.  [ https://pdfs.semanticscholar.org/dcac/54bf80668b0266694e7514c8145c669c3a2e.pdf?_ga=2.265962119.986327977.1555679684-652266393.1555679684]  [https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007%2Fs12119-013-9194-1]  Given such a  huge study, should the term '''overwhelming''' be used? [[User:Musicwaves|Musicwaves]] ([[User talk:Musicwaves|talk]]) 13:46, 21 June 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Wikipedia#rfc_6095EBF|Talk:Wikipedia]] expired 2019-07-21 21:01 ===
* Id: 6095EBF
* User: Aceing Winter Snows Harsh Cold
* Date: 2019-07-21 05:37:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|907200004|UNSORTED 907200004}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|907286290|UNSORTED 907286290}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I stumbled on the page after being a bit fidgety with the search box, when a result hint for the page in question came up.  Based on its name, I was curious to know what were some of the future plans for Wikipedia.  My prediction for what the page contained was somewhat correct, as it contained what seemed to be a to-do list with what changes are to be done with [[Wikipedia]].  It even talks about some of the yearly [[Peer Reviews]] and [[FAC]]s.  Well that is what it seems to have originally been intended for.  Unfortunately however, as I will discuss somewhere bellow, the page was visited and overridden by other Wikipedians, as well as multiple IP users, who used the page as a to-do list for what they wanted to do on Wikipedia.  Also, some of the tasks there seem convoluted and unrelated or hard to understand.  

It seems that the page is originally intended for bettering the article [[Wikipedia]], so that it can become a featured article.  Thus more caution must come when changing or deleting content that is on that page; I hope you know what is the name of this website, otherwise there is an issue.  Because of that, I felt that placing the page on any 'for deletion' noticeboard would be a bit wrong, as it would require a consensus from a lot more users.  [[User:Aceing Winter Snows Harsh Cold|Aceing_Winter_Snows_Harsh_Cold]] ([[User talk:Aceing Winter Snows Harsh Cold|talk]]) 05:37, 21 July 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Recusancy#rfc_5B99025|Talk:Recusancy]] expired 2019-07-22 21:01 ===
* Id: 5B99025
* User: GreenC

* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|903000517|BIO 903000517}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|903000521|RELI 903000521}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|903000524|SOC 903000524}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|907430963|BIO 907430963}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|907430968|HIST 907430968}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This RfC is for determining what to do if anything with the extensive database of family names contained in the article. Namely the two paragraphs of family names in the sections "Recusant families" and "Convert families" (should be evident they are long blocks of names in prose format).

Options are:

# Do nothing keep as-is
# Delete anything that isn't sourced per [[WP:V]]
# Delete them all except perhaps a short list of notable names 
# Another solution

The RfC will poll responses in the survey section and discussions in the discussion section. -- [[User:GreenC|<span style="color: #006A4E;">'''Green'''</span>]][[User talk:GreenC|<span style="color: #093;">'''C'''</span>]] 20:14, 22 June 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of music considered the worst#rfc_0E1FBA9|Talk:List of music considered the worst]] expired 2019-07-25 19:01 ===
* Id: 0E1FBA9
* User: Electricburst1996
* Date: 2019-07-25 16:50:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|907843767|MEDIA 907843767}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|907858115|MEDIA 907858115}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
It has been proposed that for an album or song to be included on the list, the album or song must have been considered "the worst" in multiple reliable sources, and the general consensus of the reviews must be negative. An album or song does not meet the criteria for inclusion if the general consensus of the reviews is positive.

Would anyone be on board with this inclusion criteria for this article? [[User:Electricburst1996|<font color="000FF">Electric</font>]][[User:Electricburst1996|<font color="00FFFF">Burst</font>]]<sup>([[User talk:Electricburst1996|Electron firings]])</sup><sub>([[Special:Contributions/Electricburst1996|Zaps]])</sub> 16:50, 25 July 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Greta Thunberg#rfc_22B6A3A|Talk:Greta Thunberg]] expired 2019-07-25 21:01 ===
* Id: 22B6A3A
* User: –†–∞–º–º–æ–Ω
* Date: 2019-07-25 16:49:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
* [[Deutsche Welle]] [https://www.dw.com/en/family-memoir-explores-childhood-of-climate-activist-greta-thunberg/a-48592700 asserts]: "Greta was finally diagnosed with Asperger's syndrome, her younger sister Beata turned out to have an attention deficit hyperactivity disorder ([[ADHD]])".
* [[The New Yorker]] [https://www.newyorker.com/news/our-columnists/the-fifteen-year-old-climate-activist-who-is-demanding-a-new-kind-of-politics asserts]: "both Greta and her younger sister, Beata, have been diagnosed with autism, A.D.H.D., and other conditions."
: {{u|Wikisaurus}} [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=prev&oldid=907835979 choosed] to believe in Deutsche Welle. But I suppose that others reliable sources support The New Yorker's version:
# [[The Guardian]] [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/mar/11/greta-thunberg-schoolgirl-climate-change-warrior-some-people-can-let-things-go-i-cant asserts] that Greta has [[obsessive‚Äìcompulsive disorder]] (OCD) and [[selective mutism]];
# Greta [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EAmmUIEsN9A&t=1m46s said]: "I was diagnosed with Asperger's syndrom, OCD and selective mutism".
: What other editors think about it? [[User:–†–∞–º–º–æ–Ω|–†–∞–º–º–æ–Ω]] ([[User talk:–†–∞–º–º–æ–Ω|talk]]) 16:49, 25 July 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Millennials#rfc_1C8C78F|Talk:Millennials]] expired 2019-07-27 08:01 ===

=== [[Talk:Main Page#rfc_E6AB19A|Talk:Main Page]] expired 2019-07-29 02:01 ===
* Id: E6AB19A
* User: Amakuru
* Date: 2019-07-13 22:06:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|906391488|POLICY 906391488}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|908334069|POLICY 908334069}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Hi all

I just wanted to query the POTD currently scheduled at [[Template:POTD/2019-10-28]]. As far as I'm aware, the convention has been that even though [[WP:NOTCENSORED]] applies to articles, we don't include very graphic images of genitalia on the main page. Thus images such as [[:File:Tako to ama retouched.jpg|this]], [[:File:Indecency2.jpg|this]], and even [[:File:Michele Merkin 1.jpg|this]] are listed at [[Wikipedia:Picture of the day/Unused]] as images which, despite being featured pictures, are not suitable for POTD. I personally think that's a sensible policy, and I've added the hermaphrodite picture to the unused list, but would welcome second/third opinions here please. Pinging {{u|Adam Cuerden}}, who created the template in question. Thanks &nbsp;&mdash;&nbsp;[[User:Amakuru|Amakuru]] ([[User talk:Amakuru|talk]]) 22:06, 13 July 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Supernova#rfc_269B917|Talk:Supernova]] expired 2019-07-29 05:01 ===
* Id: 269B917
* Date: 2019-06-29 04:07:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|904036415|SCI 904036415}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|908349825|SCI 908349825}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
{{u|Attic Salt}} contends that : "A supernova  is a transient astronomical event that occurs during the last stages of the life of a massive star or white dwarf, the destruction of which is marked by a titanic explosion."[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Supernova&action=historysubmit&type=revision&diff=903964658&oldid=903956147]  They justify this addition by saying: "Since the article discusses SN from both massive stars and white dwarfs, the defining first sentence can't mention one without mentioning the other, otherwise the reader will be confused."[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Talk%3ASupernova&action=historysubmit&type=revision&diff=903870377&oldid=903839965] Yet they still think: "No, it doesn‚Äôt say ‚Äúall‚Äù white dwarfs, but rather ‚Äúa‚Äù white dwarf."[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Supernova&type=revision&diff=903964658&oldid=903956147]

As white dwarf stars above the limit (called the Chandrasekhar limit) of about 1.4 Solar masses will go supernova, but as given in initial statement (above) plainly infers that ALL white dwarfs go supernova.

There is also a contradiction, in that saying: "...that occurs during the last stages of the life of a massive star or white dwarf‚Ä¶", when a white dwarf is considered as ended its life as a star because it no longer creates energy by fusion while energy by a white dwarf is created by gravitational contraction.

This statement is therefore false and a fallacy. 

Knowing that the number of these stars near 1.4 solar masses are rare, with the majority being less than this mass. Also these single white dwarf stars were likely once massive stars. Furthermore, the vast majority of massive stars, do go supernova.

Should "or white dwarf" in this statement be removed to fix this fallacy? 04:07, 29 June 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Spelling#rfc_31D96EC|Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Spelling]] expired 2019-07-29 09:01 ===
* Id: 31D96EC
* User: Adam9007
* Date: 2019-07-28 19:12:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|908293137|STYLE 908293137}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|908372311|STYLE 908372311}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I made [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia%3AManual_of_Style%2FSpelling&type=revision&diff=908161019&oldid=904019837 this edit], because that statement gave the impression that is is okay to use that spelling in BrE articles (an impression heavily contradicted by [[Wikipedia_talk:Manual_of_Style/Archive_194#Use_of_alternative,_uncommon_spellings|this discussion]]), but [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia:Manual_of_Style/Spelling&diff=next&oldid=908161019 it was reverted] and I was asked for a link to a consensus for it. [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia:Manual_of_Style/Spelling&diff=next&oldid=908249530 I provided one], but [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia:Manual_of_Style/Spelling&diff=next&oldid=908275299 it was again reverted] on the basis that it is in common use. In a [[Wikipedia_talk:Manual_of_Style/Dates_and_numbers#Kilogram_vs._kilogramme|related discussion]], consensus seems to be that it is no longer in common use. So, I need to ask: was my edit a good one? [[User:Adam9007|Adam9007]] ([[User talk:Adam9007|talk]]) 19:12, 28 July 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:2019 Hong Kong anti-extradition bill protests#rfc_F57E7D7|Talk:2019 Hong Kong anti-extradition bill protests]] expired 2019-07-29 09:01 ===
* Id: F57E7D7
* User: Mariogoods
* Date: 2019-07-28 22:14:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|908314749|UNSORTED 908314749}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|908372312|UNSORTED 908372312}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I am prepared to change the section title Censorship into Censorship and propaganda. However, "propaganda" may be suggestive because it is often used as derogatory term which may discredit Chinese media‚Äôs every report are totally propagation. The reason why I change the title is for presenting current changes (such as Sina Weibo allows the topic appear but must maintain an official view)  Should we change the title or not, or we have better choices?[[User:Mariogoods|Mariogoods]] ([[User talk:Mariogoods|talk]]) 22:14, 28 July 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Community response to the Wikimedia Foundation's ban of Fram#rfc_7B36696|Wikipedia talk:Community response to the Wikimedia Foundation's ban of Fram]] expired 2019-08-01 06:01 ===
* Id: 7B36696
* User: DrewieStewie
* Date: 2019-07-07 02:22:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|905134062|POLICY 905134062}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|909548031|POLICY 909548031}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Summary for the RFC listing: Should any FRAM-related resignation where the resigning editor performed controversial actions relating to WP:FRAM be considered [[WP:CLOUD|under a cloud?]] 
I am asking because of the following quotation from the July 2 WMF Board statement: 
{{tq|We do not consider any of the admin resignations related to the current events to be ‚Äú[[WP:CLOUD|under a cloud]]‚Äù (under suspicion) though we also realize that the final decision with respect to this lies with the community.}}
I am asking in the hypothetical event that users who resigned under controversial circumstances relating to WP:FRAM such as [[User:Floquenbeam|Floquenbeam]], [[User:BU Rob13|BU Rob 13]], [[User:WJBScribe|WJBScribe]], and any other past or possible future resigner resigning under controversial circumstances relating to WP:FRAM would ask for their tools back. If they're not considered to be under a cloud, they can simply request them back at the [[Wikipedia:Bureaucrats' Noticeboard|Bureaucrats' Noticeboard]], but if they are considered to be under a cloud, then they'll have to go through the standard RFA procedure. According to the board, while they don't consider these under a cloud, it's up to us as a community to decide whether or not they're under a cloud, and I felt it would be smart to have that consensus ready in advance, even if these requests are unlikely to occur from those I just mentioned. A "no-consensus" result would leave the Board's view as precedent, leaving the effects of a "no consensus" the same as a "no" !vote consensus in response to the question, should the result be "no consensus".

Proposer: [[User:DrewieStewie|DrewieStewie]] ([[User talk:DrewieStewie|talk]]) 02:22, 7 July 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of WWE personnel#rfc_21A6522|Talk:List of WWE personnel]] expired 2019-08-01 17:01 ===
* Id: 21A6522
* Date: 2019-07-02 16:19:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|904539085|SOC 904539085}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|908884216|SOC 908884216}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This has been disputed several times recently, so I am starting an official RFC on the matter. Does [[Shane McMahon]] winning the [[SmackDown Tag Team Championship]] mean he becomes an active roster participant rather than administrative role? Does [[Drake Maverick]] winning the [[WWE 24/7 Championship]] mean that he is now a 205 wrestler rather than GM? Does [[Becky Lynch]] winning the [[Raw Women's Championship]] mean that she is a Raw wrestler while still being listed as SmackDown on WWE.com?

Does winning a championship make you a wrestler? Should a wrestler winning a different brand's championship mean they should switch brands? In short, does winning a championship dictate your placement, or should it just be included as a note. - '''''[[User:Galatz|<span style="color: #000080">Galatz ◊í◊ê◊ú◊ô◊•</span>]][[User_talk:Galatz|<span style="color: #FF0000"><sup>◊©◊ô◊ó◊î Talk</sup></span>]]''''' 16:19, 2 July 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:T. Rex (band)#rfc_D3BF63A|Talk:T. Rex (band)]] expired 2019-08-02 09:01 ===
* Id: D3BF63A
* User: Romomusicfan
* Date: 2019-07-03 08:15:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|904613255|MEDIA 904613255}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|908984643|MEDIA 908984643}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Myself and {{u|Woovee}} disagree about the inclusion of a short section in this article about the bands [[Mickey Finn's T-Rex]] and [[X-T. Rex]] (formerly [[Bill Legend's T. Rex]]) which feature former T.Rex members (and either currently or formerly featured members of the "classic" 1971-1973 lineup) and which both promote themselves as reunions of T.Rex. <br> 
Woovee's opinion is that these bands should not be mentioned in the T.Rex article as they are irrelevant and an offence to the principle that there can be no T.Rex without the involvement of [[Marc Bolan]] and that such a section only serves to promote these two bands.<br>
My opinion is that these bands both have their own Wikipedia articles (and one of the two is undoubtely Wiki-notable, the other at least deserves a redirect) and so are significant spin-offs of the band regardless of their authenticity as T.Rex lineups, and that in any case "''No Bolan No T.Rex''" is a POV. [[User:Romomusicfan|Romomusicfan]] ([[User talk:Romomusicfan|talk]]) 08:15, 3 July 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Antifa (United States)#rfc_C460E19|Talk:Antifa (United States)]] expired 2019-08-02 18:01 ===
* Id: C460E19
* User: Atsme
* Date: 2019-07-21 04:06:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|907191702|POL 907191702}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|911639759|POL 911639759}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The purpose of this RfC is to gain consensus for adding a new section titled '''Antifa activism''' for the purpose of creating and maintaining a timeline of notable antifa events, demonstrations, riots and various other forms of anti-fascist activities. Antifa supporters are recognizable by their [[black bloc]] attire, the targets they choose and/or their ideological behavior which does not rule out violence. They are also referred to as anti-fascists, or they could be individuals who act out and identify as antifascist but are not connected to a specific antifa group. Following is an example of a timeline with notable dates of past events involving antifa. Each date will include a description of the event per cited RS, and will closely adhere to [[WP:PAG]]. [[User:Atsme|<span style="text-shadow:#F8F8FF 0.2em 0.2em 0.4em,#F4BBFF -0.2em -0.3em 0.6em,#BFFF00 0.8em 0.8em 0.6em;color:#A2006D"><sup>Atsme</sup></span>]] <sub>[[User talk:Atsme|<small>Talk</small>]]</sub> [[Special:EmailUser/Atsme|üìß]] 04:06, 21 July 2019 (UTC)}}


=== [[Talk:Antifa (United States)#rfc_9F65C65|Talk:Antifa (United States)]] expired 2019-08-02 18:01 ===
* Id: 9F65C65
* User: Ahrtoodeetoo
* Date: 2019-07-03 17:23:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|904669532|POL 904669532}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|909045542|POL 909045542}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Which of the following is preferable treatment of [https://www.politico.com/story/2017/09/01/antifa-charlottesville-violence-fbi-242235 this Politico source] with respect to terrorism? 
* '''Option A (status quo):''' {{tq|By 2017, the FBI and DHS reported that they were monitoring suspicious Antifa activity in relation to terrorism.}}
* '''Option B:''' {{tq|DHS and FBI intelligence assessments indicated monitoring of antifa protesters before the [[2016 United States presidential election|2016 elections]]. By 2017, DHS had formally classified antifa's activities as "domestic terrorist violence".}}
* '''Option C:''' Exclude both of the above.
* '''Option D:''' {{tq|Per ''Politico'', by 2017, the FBI and DHS reported that they were monitoring suspicious Antifa activity in relation to terrorism, and that DHS had formally classified Antifa's activities as "domestic terrorist violence." It is unclear what legal or security implications such a classification might have.}}
* '''Option E:''' ???

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|909461655|POL 909461655}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I would like to pursue the point about whether the amount of material on Corbyn pre his leadership is WP:UNDUE in this article. I think there is some relevance but that the length is excessive, particularly as it is covered on his profile where it is available for reference. Moreover, reducing this section will contribute to reducing the overall length of the article, which I anticipate continuing to grow. Can I suggest we have a vote on this to clear it up by everyone putting these three options in order of preference with regard to section 6.1. in this article i.e. ''Events involving Jeremy Corbyn as a backbencher''?

'''A'''  Replace the section in this article with a sentence and link to the relevant section in his profile

'''B'''  Replace the section in this article with the relevant [[Jeremy Corbyn#Allegations of antisemitism|section in his profile]], resulting in the two articles having the same text regarding the period before he became leader. The section in his profile is shorter and was arrived at after some discussion and amendment amongst the editors involved.

'''C'''  Leave section 6.1 unchanged. [[User:Jontel|Jontel]] ([[User talk:Jontel|talk]]) 15:56, 6 July 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Non-free content#rfc_07D65E5|Wikipedia talk:Non-free content]] expired 2019-08-05 16:01 ===
* Id: 07D65E5
* User: Tvx1
* Date: 2019-07-18 17:48:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|906850193|SOC 906850193}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|906850194|POLICY 906850194}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|909461662|POLICY 909461662}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|911263528|SOC 911263528}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
‚ÄéHi, I start this RFC a follow up to [[Wikipedia talk:Non-free content/Archive 66#Application of WP:NFC#UUI #17|this discussion]], which did not yield a clear consensus. It's an issue of the applicability of WP:NFC#UUI #17 to football teams and clubs. The questions the community have been disputed about for years are actually very simple:

Taking into account [[WP:NFC#UUI #17]],
# Are the premier (i.e. those that compete in the premier competitions like the FIFA World Cup and continual cups) national teams (both mem and women's) child entities of the national football associations?
# Are the junior national football teams (e.g. U21, U19,...) child entities of the premier national football teams or of the national football associations?
# Are women's football clubs child entities of men's football clubs?

The final question that strems from the above three question's answers is:
*Is it acceptable per the NFC guidelines to add the shirt badges/crests to the articles on either premier national football teams, junior national football teams and/or women's football clubs?

Please post your responses below.[[User:Tvx1|T]][[User Talk:Tvx1|v]][[Special:Contributions/Tvx1|x]]1 17:48, 18 July 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Music#rfc_5D25464|Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Music]] expired 2019-08-06 02:01 ===
* Id: 5D25464
* Date: 2019-07-07 01:31:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|905129674|MEDIA 905129674}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|909541404|MEDIA 909541404}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Hello there. I'd like to see what other editors think in regards to the use of the word "The" in band names in parentheses in the titles of articles about songs and albums. Here's an example of what I mean by this: there is currently an article titled "[[Revolver (Beatles album)|''Revolver'' (Beatles album)]]". However, there are also numerous articles where this is NOT the case: for example, "[[Smile (The Beach Boys album)|''Smile'' (The Beach Boys album)]]" or "[[Smash Hits (The Jimi Hendrix Experience album)|''Smash Hits'' (The Jimi Hendrix Experience album)]]". I've looked at [[MOS:TITLE]], [[MOS:THECAPS]], [[MOS:THEMUSIC]], and [[WP:NCTHE]], but I'm not really seeing any indication of what the protocol should be here. ‚Äì'''''[[User:MatthewHoobin|<span style="color:#0640e0; text-shadow:#66ff66 0.2em 0.2em 0.4em;">Matthew]]</span>''''' - <span style="font-size:80%">([[User_talk:MatthewHoobin|talk]])</span> 01:31, 7 July 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Neolithic Subpluvial#rfc_2D30EEA|Talk:Neolithic Subpluvial]] expired 2019-08-07 16:01 ===
* Id: 2D30EEA
* User: Jo-Jo Eumerus
* Date: 2019-07-08 15:11:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|905354703|HIST 905354703}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|905354709|SCI 905354709}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|909784765|HIST 909784765}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|909784766|SCI 909784766}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
That is {{la|African humid period}} (disclaimer: I am the author of that) and {{la|Neolithic Subpluvial}}, which both currently cover a similar, if not identical, topic. The former is considerably longer than the latter and was written in late 2018, while Neolithic Subpluvial was written in August 2007.

First off, a ''mea culpa'': When I wrote African humid period I did not at first think about what the relationship between the two pages should be, and I should have. This led to a [[Talk:African_humid_period#Merger_discussion_with_Neolithic_subpluvial|merger discussion in January-February 2019 which ended in no consensus due to lack of participation and concerns about the size of the resulting merged page]], and an [[Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Neolithic Subpluvial|Articles for deletion discussion]] (arguably not a good place, as the question was not really about deletion) a few weeks ago which ended today into a no consensus as well with a variety of opinions and with several suggestions of redirection or redefinition. The closing statement indicated that if further discussion is warranted - and even the most conservative statements in the AFD indicated that some repurposing of Neolithic Subpluvial would be necessary - it should take place on a talk page.

So the question here (taken from the deletion discussion) is whether Neolithic Subpluvial should a) be merged/redirected into AHP, b) it should be redefined to a Sahara/Sahel-specific variant of AHP, c) redefined (and possibly renamed) to cover "green Sahara" periods more generally i.e not limited to the late [[Pleistocene]]-early [[Holocene]] version thereof or d) something else altogether. [[User:Jo-Jo Eumerus|Jo-Jo Eumerus]] ([[User talk:Jo-Jo Eumerus|talk]], [[Special:CentralAuth/Jo-Jo Eumerus|contributions]]) 15:11, 8 July 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Once Upon a Time in Hollywood#rfc_BEB859F|Talk:Once Upon a Time in Hollywood]] expired 2019-08-08 10:01 ===
* Id: BEB859F
* User: Betty Logan
* Date: 2019-07-09 09:20:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|905474724|MEDIA 905474724}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|905474725|POLICY 905474725}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|909897567|MEDIA 909897567}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|909897569|POLICY 909897569}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The article includes a plot summary for a film that has not entered general release, and is not sourced to secondary citations. [[MOS:FILMPLOT]] does not usually require a citation because the film itself is regarded as a primary source; however, exceptions to this include "upcoming" and "lost" films which are not available to the public to verify, and in such cases MOS:FILMPLOT requires a secondary source. Since the film is not currently "available to the public to verify" (it was made briefly available to a select audience at the Cannes film festival) does the lack of availability and a secondary citation mean that the summary violates [[WP:Verifiability]] and [[MOS:FILMPLOT]]? If so should the plot summary be removed from the article until general release, in the absence of a citation? [[User:Betty Logan|Betty Logan]] ([[User talk:Betty Logan|talk]]) 09:20, 9 July 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Articles for deletion#rfc_C048856|Wikipedia talk:Articles for deletion]] expired 2019-08-08 18:01 ===
* Id: C048856
* User: Doc James
* Date: 2019-07-09 17:51:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|905774892|POLICY 905774892}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|909951942|POLICY 909951942}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
We struggle with issues of undisclosed paid editors both supporting and opposing AfD. Example include [[User:Sora Sailor]].

Some of these undisclosed paid editor accounts do so to try to extort money out of people (for deletion). And others so they can get money from the person in question.

In my opinion this probably will be partly helped by limiting these discussions to extended auto confirmed users. French Wikipedia does something similar were they move all comments that are made by an editor with less than 50 edits. [[User:Doc James|<span style="color:#0000f1">'''Doc James'''</span>]] ([[User talk:Doc James|talk]] ¬∑ [[Special:Contributions/Doc James|contribs]] ¬∑ [[Special:EmailUser/Doc James|email]]) 17:51, 9 July 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:People's Party (Spain)#rfc_C13AC20|Talk:People's Party (Spain)]] expired 2019-08-09 00:01 ===
* Id: C13AC20
* User: Helper201
* Date: 2019-07-09 23:44:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|906095407|POL 906095407}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|909995364|POL 909995364}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I think that liberal-conservavism label should be removed from the opening parapgraph and the infobox. It is cited in the ''Leadership of Casado and 2019 election'' section that the party shifted further to the right in 2018. Both sources that cite the party as liberal-conservative are years before this (one is from 2014 and one is from 2005). This is when the party was under different leadership and not as far to the right as it is today. I have seen no sources since Pablo Casado became the leader of the party that describe it as liberal-consevative, so I would say this is out of date and should be removed. However, this is cited information, so I'm looking to form a consenus here before removing it. Please leave any and all thoughts below. [[User:Helper201|Helper201]] ([[User talk:Helper201|talk]]) 23:44, 9 July 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Urolagnia#rfc_F249543|Talk:Urolagnia]] expired 2019-08-11 05:01 ===
* Id: F249543
* User: L'Origine du monde
* Date: 2019-07-12 04:38:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|905892640|LANG 905892640}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|905892643|SCI 905892643}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|910309905|LANG 910309905}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|910309906|SCI 910309906}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the lede and overview characterise Urolagnia as a paraphilia, or as a sexual tendency? 

The overview currently starts "Urolagnia is a paraphilia." The lede currently starts "Urolagnia (also urophilia, undinism, golden shower and watersports) is a paraphilia in which sexual excitement is associated with the sight or thought of urine or urination." 
The OED defines Urolagnia as "A tendency to derive sexual pleasure from the sight or thought of urination." The OED defines Paraphilia as "A condition characterized by abnormal sexual desires, typically involving extreme or dangerous activities."[[User:L'Origine du monde|<span style="font-family:Edwardian Script ITC;font-size:15px; text-shadow: 0 0 .2"><b><font color="red">‚ô• L'Origine du monde ‚ô•]]</font></b></span> <sup><font color="blue">‚ô• [[User talk:L'Origine du monde|Talk]]‚ô• </font></sup> 04:38, 12 July 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Constantinople#rfc_7C319F5|Talk:Constantinople]] expired 2019-08-11 11:01 ===
* Id: 7C319F5
* User: WhisperToMe
* Date: 2019-07-12 10:53:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|905921483|HIST 905921483}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|910337266|HIST 910337266}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Dear editors, 
Currently the top notice says that the article covers until 1453, with Ottoman Constantinople discussed at [[Istanbul]]. I want to change the "hard limit" of the page until 1930, for the following reasons:
# The city was known in the west and in western languages as "Constantinople" until the Turkish law required the use of Istanbul in 1930 (I believe it was officially known as Constantinople ''in Turkish'' prior to 1923?)
# [[Istanbul]] is currently a featured article, and covering too much detail about Ottoman history there may put undue weight as people reading that page may want more of a focus on ''modern'' Istanbul. Having this set to 1930 allows adding of additional info that may not necessarily fit at "Istanbul".
# Many aspects covered in city articles (such as Media, formal western Education, and formal diplomatic relations) were undeveloped in Byzantine periods and did not develop until late Ottoman rule: it can comfortably cover the types of schools in the city, the newspapers printed in the city, etc.
:* Note: I am not advocating for removing all traces of Ottoman Constantinople from [[Istanbul]], but instead I want to allow adding of Ottoman info and the first seven years of the Turkish republic to this article, with these two periods sort of overlapping with [[Istanbul]]. In other words, have Ottoman stuff go in both [[Constantinople]] and "Istanbul" but with the amount of coverage/detail differing according to weight.

Even though there is no recent talk page discussion on this, I felt filing an RFC would be for the best since the Ottoman Empire project is moribund, and it may be good to get many editors to discuss this.
[[User:WhisperToMe|WhisperToMe]] ([[User talk:WhisperToMe|talk]]) 10:53, 12 July 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_789F9AE|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2019-08-12 01:01 ===
* Id: 789F9AE
* User: Elizium23
* Date: 2019-07-14 00:53:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|906156001|POLICY 906156001}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|906161173|PROP 906161173}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|910575614|POLICY 910575614}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|910575621|PROP 910575621}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
&#32;
*Should we agree to halt the use of RFCs containing four options for "general (un)reliability" of a source, particularly when said RFC contains no specific instances of claims or citations?
*While it may be useful to [[WP:RSP|deprecate heavily-used and clearly-unreliable sources]], the corollary is not true: Wikipedia is unable to promote a source to "reliable for any assertion about any topic whatsoever"; [[WP:IRS|reliability is always assessed based on the nature of the claims being made]].
*With these parameters in mind, is it futile for us to continually open RFCs here on [[WP:RSN]] if an outcome of "generally reliable for everything" is counter-productive and misleading?
**Sub-question: should such RFCs be permitted as long as they include at least one concrete example of an assertion of fact, such as one which is currently in dispute on an article's talk page?
[[User:Elizium23|Elizium23]] ([[User talk:Elizium23|talk]]) 00:53, 14 July 2019 (UTC)}}

* User: Adam9007

{{rfcquote|text=
I made [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia%3AManual_of_Style%2FSpelling&type=revision&diff=908161019&oldid=904019837 this edit], because that statement gave the impression that is is okay to use that spelling in BrE articles (an impression heavily contradicted by [[Wikipedia_talk:Manual_of_Style/Archive_194#Use_of_alternative,_uncommon_spellings|this discussion]]), but [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia:Manual_of_Style/Spelling&diff=next&oldid=908161019 it was reverted] and I was asked for a link to a consensus for it. [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia:Manual_of_Style/Spelling&diff=next&oldid=908249530 I provided one], but [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia:Manual_of_Style/Spelling&diff=next&oldid=908275299 it was again reverted] on the basis that it is in common use. In the above discussion, consensus seems to be that it is no longer in common use. So, I need to ask: was my edit a good one? (copied from [[Wikipedia_talk:Manual_of_Style/Spelling#RfC:_Gramme]]) [[User:Adam9007|Adam9007]] ([[User talk:Adam9007|talk]]) 15:08, 29 July 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Stanley Kubrick#rfc_74FD40C|Talk:Stanley Kubrick]] expired 2019-08-14 19:01 ===
* Id: 74FD40C
* User: HAL333
* Date: 2019-08-14 03:50:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|910741911|UNSORTED 910741911}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|910829424|UNSORTED 910829424}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
'''Background:''' Adding an infobox to this article has long been discussed and contested. Last year, I promised that I would make an Rfc in 2019, I waited 9 months as a sort of moratorium, and believe it is time to address the topic once again, hopefully for the last time. The last Rfc to propose adding a non-collapsible infobox was in January of 2017, which failed to determine a consensus. That was over two years ago, and a [[WP:CONSENSUSCANCHANGE|consensus may have developed]] in that time. 

'''Question:''' Should an infobox be added to this page? 

Hopefully we can have a civil and productive discussion, thanks [[User:HAL333|<span style="background:red; color:white; padding:2px;">HAL</span>]][[User talk:HAL333|<span style="background:black; color:white; padding:2px;">333</span>]] 03:50, 14 August 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:White Croats#rfc_245AF60|Talk:White Croats]] expired 2019-08-14 21:01 ===
* Id: 245AF60
* User: Nicoljaus
* Date: 2019-07-15 20:37:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|906364443|HIST 906364443}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|906364444|LANG 906364444}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|910843810|HIST 910843810}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|910843812|LANG 910843812}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Modern researchers separate the "White Croats" from the Eastern (Carpathian) Croats and do not consider any Early Medieval "Croatian tribes" outside modern-day Croatia as "White Croats".  In accordance with this, is it worth changing the article ‚ÄúWhite Croats‚Äù, which currently mixes at least three different issues and often incorrectly uses sources?--[[User:Nicoljaus|Nicoljaus]] ([[User talk:Nicoljaus|talk]]) 20:37, 15 July 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Beitar Illit#rfc_9ED0023|Talk:Beitar Illit]] expired 2019-08-15 15:01 ===
* Id: 9ED0023
* User: Debresser
* Date: 2019-07-16 14:15:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|906552006|HIST 906552006}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|910943413|HIST 910943413}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Recently, [[User:Nableezy]] added <code><nowiki>{{short description|Israeli settlement in the West Bank/Golan Heights}}</nowiki></code> to this article and a bunch of others. It is my opinion that this short description should be refined, here as well as in those other articles. In the case of Beitar e.g. that should be "Israeli city in the West Bank", in the case of [[Neve Ativ]] e.g. "Israeli moshav in the Golan Heights", etc.

Likewise it is my opinion that the first sentence of these articles should avoid wording like "Israeli settlement incorporated as a city/moshav", which these articles presently is part of their lead sentence in many cases. This is 1. unnecessarily verbose, 2. not the way we usually start article about [[human settlement]]s, and 3. redundant to the continuation of the lead which invariably contains some explanation to the fact that "The international community considers Israeli settlements in the West Bank/Golan Heights illegal under international law, but the Israeli government disputes this."

I am well aware that all of these are [[Israeli settlement]]s, just hold that the short description should be as refined as possible, while the fact that these cities/moshavs etc. are in the West Bank or the Golan Heights explains clearly enough that they are in the general category of "Israeli settlements". [[User:Debresser|Debresser]] ([[User talk:Debresser|talk]]) 14:15, 16 July 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:SNC-Lavalin affair#rfc_3E73104|Talk:SNC-Lavalin affair]] expired 2019-08-16 18:01 ===
* Id: 3E73104
* Date: 2019-07-17 17:59:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|906710516|POL 906710516}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|911127883|POL 911127883}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The [[Talk:SNC-Lavalin_affair#RfC:_political_scandal?|last RfC]] concluded with consensus for "controversy" and consensus for "scandal" in the article's [[MOS:LEAD|lead]]. There was no consensus around how to phrase the [[MOS:FIRST|first sentence]] of the article.

Which of the following should be used as the first sentence?

#Omit "scandal" and "controversy"
#:{{tqb|The SNC-Lavalin affair in Canada involves allegations that the Prime Minister's Office (PMO) politically interfered with the justice system.}}
#Call it a "scandal"
#:{{tqb|The SNC-Lavalin affair is a political scandal in Canada involving allegations that the Prime Minister's Office (PMO) politically interfered with the justice system.}}
#Call it a "controversy"
#:{{tqb|The SNC-Lavalin affair is a political controversy in Canada involving allegations that the Prime Minister's Office (PMO) politically interfered with the justice system.}}
#Call it a "controversy or scandal"
#:{{tqb|The SNC-Lavalin affair is a political controversy or scandal in Canada involving allegations that the Prime Minister's Office (PMO) politically interfered with the justice system.}}
#Call it a "dispute"
#:{{tqb|The SNC-Lavalin affair is a political dispute in Canada involving allegations that the Prime Minister's Office (PMO) politically interfered with the justice system.}}

You may rank your choices if you would like. ‚Äì [[user talk:Anne drew Andrew and Drew|<span style="color:#074">Anne&nbsp;drew</span>]] 17:59, 17 July 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of last words#rfc_F489B8C|Talk:List of last words]] expired 2019-08-16 20:01 ===
* Id: F489B8C
* User: Gaioa
* Date: 2019-07-17 19:27:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|906724428|BIO 906724428}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|906724430|HIST 906724430}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|911142542|BIO 911142542}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|911142546|HIST 911142546}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
As the original author of this article, I formulated some (kinda out-of-thin-air) inclusion criteria reading that "subjects should have both a standalone WP article and a standalone [[Wikiquote|WQ]] article". Later, someone objected to that, and I was too busy with non-WP matters to discuss so I let it be. Now it feels like the article is becoming a dump for everyone's favorite historical people and literary works, so therefore I ask for consensus on this matter. We need one criterium for real people and one for fictional works. [[User:Gaioa|<span style="color:#0000ff;">Gaioa</span>]] ([[User talk:Gaioa|T]] [[Special:Contributions/Gaioa|C]] [[Special:Log/Gaioa|L]]) 19:27, 17 July 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Donald Trump#rfc_E4EAFE8|Talk:Donald Trump]] expired 2019-08-17 02:01 ===
* Id: E4EAFE8
* User: MelanieN
* Date: 2019-07-18 01:05:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|906756087|BIO 906756087}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|906756092|POL 906756092}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|911177205|BIO 911177205}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|911177209|POL 911177209}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Back in 2017 a consensus developed on the article talk page that even though there was a great deal being said about his mental health in sources, we should not say anything on the subject in the article. In 2018 an article [[Health of Donald Trump]] was written which was primarily about his mental health. In June 2019 that article was AfD‚Äôed, with the result to merge it to the Donald Trump article. Since the article being merged was primarily about mental health, a paragraph on the subject was developed at the Trump talk page and added to the article; it is now the final paragraph in the ‚ÄúHealth and lifestyle‚Äù section. Some people have deleted it or objected to it, so we are seeking a definitive answer to the question: should we have a paragraph about his mental health? The question here is whether we should have something or nothing. Exact wording can be debated later, if the conclusion here is that, yes, we should say something on the subject. In the meantime the paragraph at issue should remain in the article.-- [[User:MelanieN|MelanieN]] ([[User talk:MelanieN|talk]]) 01:05, 18 July 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)#rfc_AF74DD3|Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)]] expired 2019-08-17 20:01 ===
* Id: AF74DD3
* User: Robert McClenon
* Date: 2019-07-19 01:35:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|906901232|POLICY 906901232}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|911311528|POLICY 911311528}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The purpose of this RFC is to determine what are considered to be the purposes of portals. 

Some of the purposes that have been proposed are:
:1. Showcasing our best content to readers. The Main Page, for example, is a portal with this very purpose. The Main Page is also very labor-intensive. Showcasing is work.
:2. Navigating the encyclopedia. Along with lists, navigation templates, and categories, portals are one way readers can [[WP:NAVIGATION|navigate the encyclopedia]].
:3. Containing content not available elsewhere on the encyclopedia. Some editors have stated that portals contain content, so that content is harmfully deleted when portals are deleted.
:3A. Unique, forked or transcluded encyclopedic content
:3B. Explanatory content such as guidance and reviews (others?)
:4. Planning and management of WikiProjects. Portals allow editors to keep track of the current and planned scope of the project's coverage.
:5. Metatext and reviews of the topic.
:6. A statement of the importance of the topic.  The provision that portals should be about "broad subject areas" is more commonly remembered and quoted than the qualifying clause, "which will attract readers and portal maintainers".  A portal is seen as a declaration that a topic is a broad subject area.
:7. An invitation to readers and editors to develop particular articles in a topic area.
:8. Fun, or exercise.  Some editors like making portals.

In the Survey, please specify between 0 and N (currently 8) purposes that you think are valid purposes of [[WP:Portals|portals]].  You may add numbered purposes to the end of list and !vote for them also.

Threaded discussion may take place in the Threaded Discussion section.
[[User:Robert McClenon|Robert McClenon]] ([[User talk:Robert McClenon|talk]]) 01:35, 19 July 2019 (UTC)}}


=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)#rfc_A4151D6|Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)]] expired 2019-08-17 20:01 ===
* Id: A4151D6
* User: Robert McClenon
* Date: 2019-07-18 19:09:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|906857272|POLICY 906857272}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|911277485|POLICY 911277485}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the existing page that is labeled as [[WP:POG|Portal Guidelines]] have the status of a [[WP:Guideline|guideline]]? 

This page has been in place since 2006 and has, in general, been recognized as a guideline, but some editors have questioned whether it was ever properly adopted, and others have wished to suspend it.  The purpose of this RFC is to clarify either that it is a guideline, or that it isn‚Äôt a guideline.  If it isn‚Äôt, then we can go [[back to square one]] and adopt a new portal guideline, or we can we [[WP:UCS|Use Common Sense]].  

The key sentence of the guideline is, and has been for more than a decade:
'''Please bear in mind that portals should be about broad subject areas, which are likely to attract large numbers of interested readers and portal maintainers.'''

If the guideline is adopted or re-adopted, changes to it can be made by another RFC.  

Please Support or Oppose adoption or re-adoption of the guideline in the Survey.  The Threaded Discussion section is for back-and-forth discussion.  
[[User:Robert McClenon|Robert McClenon]] ([[User talk:Robert McClenon|talk]]) 19:09, 18 July 2019 (UTC)}}
