=== [[Wikipedia talk:Administrators#rfc_C55DB21|Wikipedia talk:Administrators]] expired 2019-08-19 04:01 ===
* Id: C55DB21
* User: TonyBallioni
* Date: 2019-07-20 03:25:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|907051563|POLICY 907051563}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|911480333|POLICY 911480333}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
One of the biggest issues with any RfC about activity requirements is that they fail because no one likes specific proposals. To try to deal with that issue, I'm starting the first of what is a potential two part RfC with the following options:
#'''Option 1: The status quo''' ‚Äì the resysop criteria for inactivity should remain the same.
#'''Option 2: Stricter''' ‚Äì the resysop criteria for inactivity should be made stricter in some way.
#'''Option 3: Looser''' ‚Äì the resysop criteria for inactivity should be made less strict.
Ideally, if option 2 or 3 gain consensus, a second RfC focusing on specific proposals based on the principle that achieves consensus would take place. The goal here is to see what the community consensus on the status of the current policy is, not to discuss specific proposals. [[User:TonyBallioni|TonyBallioni]] ([[User talk:TonyBallioni|talk]]) 03:25, 20 July 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:The Boys (2019 TV series)#rfc_A82EE6C|Talk:The Boys (2019 TV series)]] expired 2019-08-20 02:01 ===
* Id: A82EE6C
* User:  YoungForever
* Date: 2019-08-13 14:26:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|910686175|MEDIA 910686175}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|910686181|SOC 910686181}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|911623550|MEDIA 911623550}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|911623557|SOC 911623557}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I want to point out the "homosexual" is considered to be derogatory and offensive nowadays according to [[GLAAD]] [https://www.glaad.org/reference/offensive]. The term "gay man" is the preferred term to use. In other words, it is not appropriate to use "homosexual". An editor and various ip addresses keep on adding "homosexual". Should we use the term "homosexual" or "gay man" or neither (if neither, please state another term that is more appropriate)? ‚Äî [[User:YoungForever|<span style="color: #E63E62;font-family:Georgia;">'''Young'''</span><span style="color: #414A4C;font-family:Georgia;">'''Forever'''</span>]][[User talk: YoungForever|<sup style="color: #2D68C4F">(talk)</sup>]]  14:26, 13 August 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Elizabeth Warren#rfc_B9D7349|Talk:Elizabeth Warren]] expired 2019-08-20 02:01 ===
* Id: B9D7349
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|911615102|POL 911615102}}
=== [[Talk:Wikipedia#rfc_2D94BE4|Talk:Wikipedia]] expired 2019-08-20 03:01 ===
* Id: 2D94BE4
* User: Aceing Winter Snows Harsh Cold
* Date: 2019-07-21 05:37:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|907286284|MEDIA 907286284}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|907286287|SOC 907286287}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|911629552|MEDIA 911629552}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|911629556|SOC 911629556}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I stumbled on the page after being a bit fidgety with the search box, when a result hint for the page in question came up.  Based on its name, I was curious to know what were some of the future plans for Wikipedia.  My prediction for what the page contained was somewhat correct, as it contained what seemed to be a to-do list with what changes are to be done with [[Wikipedia]].  It even talks about some of the yearly [[Peer Reviews]] and [[FAC]]s.  Well that is what it seems to have originally been intended for.  Unfortunately however, as I will discuss somewhere bellow, the page was visited and overridden by other Wikipedians, as well as multiple IP users, who used the page as a to-do list for what they wanted to do on Wikipedia.  Also, some of the tasks there seem convoluted and unrelated or hard to understand.  

It seems that the page is originally intended for bettering the article [[Wikipedia]], so that it can become a featured article.  Thus more caution must come when changing or deleting content that is on that page; I hope you know what is the name of this website, otherwise there is an issue.  Because of that, I felt that placing the page on any 'for deletion' noticeboard would be a bit wrong, as it would require a consensus from a lot more users.  [[User:Aceing Winter Snows Harsh Cold|Aceing_Winter_Snows_Harsh_Cold]] ([[User talk:Aceing Winter Snows Harsh Cold|talk]]) 05:37, 21 July 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Disambiguation#rfc_43AA42E|Wikipedia talk:Disambiguation]] expired 2019-08-22 08:01 ===
* Id: 43AA42E
* User: Steven Crossin
* Date: 2019-07-23 07:56:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|907489898|POLICY 907489898}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|911954171|POLICY 911954171}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Hi all. I have recently closed a requested move discussion on [[Steve Smith (cricketer)]] (located [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Talk:Steve_Smith_(cricketer)&oldid=907488300#Requested_move_14_July_2019 here]) which I determined there was no consensus. In short, those supporting the move to a further disambiguated article title argued that the current title was an incomplete disambiguation. Those opposing the move argued the article subject was the primary topic, and similar to some other cricketer articles (e.g. [[James Anderson (cricketer)]]), should be titled without their year of birth. Through reading this guideline, I was not able to determine how to title articles when there is a conflict between [[WP:INCDAB]] and [[WP:PRIMARYTOPIC]], so I am opening an RFC to see if we can determine which takes precedence in future discussions. The options forward I see (there may be others) are:

*'''Option 1''': INCDAB takes precedence over PRIMARYTOPIC
*'''Option 2''': PRIMARYTOPIC takes precedence over INCDAB

I would appreciate the community's thoughts on this matter. <font face="Verdana">[[User:Steven Crossin|<font color="#078330">Steven</font>]] [[User talk:Steven Crossin|<font color="#2875b0">Crossin</font>]] <sup>[[WP:DRN/V|<font color="#d67f0f">Help resolve disputes!</font>]]</sup></font>  07:56, 23 July 2019 (UTC)}}

'''Option A:''' The '''alt-right''', an abbreviation of '''alternative right''', is a loosely connected [[Far-right politics|far-right]], [[White nationalism|white nationalist]] movement based in the United States.

'''Option B:''' The '''alt-right''', an abbreviation of '''alternative right''', is a loosely connected [[Far-right politics|far-right]], [[white supremacism|white supremacist]], [[White nationalism|white nationalist]], [[White separatism|white separatist]], [[anti-immigration]] and sometimes [[antisemitic]] movement based in the United States.

The former has been in place for several months; it was expanded to the latter <s>in the past few days</s> beginning 10 days ago. There is some Talk Page dispute as to what is best. === [[Talk:Kevin Feige#rfc_17073FD|Talk:Kevin Feige]] expired 2019-08-23 02:01 ===
* Id: 17073FD
* User: 96.8.24.95
* Date: 2019-08-20 02:38:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|911629549|BIO 911629549}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|911629552|MEDIA 911629552}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|912071676|BIO 912071676}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|912071680|MEDIA 912071680}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Is there an official source for the pronunciation of ''Feige''? There seems to be a lot of debate and inconsistency among third parties. ‚Äî[[Special:Contributions/96.8.24.95|96.8.24.95]] ([[User talk:96.8.24.95|talk]]) 02:38, 20 August 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Fascism#rfc_D9D8B2E|Talk:Fascism]] expired 2019-08-23 03:01 ===
* Id: D9D8B2E
* User: Beyond My Ken
* Date: 2019-07-24 02:44:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|907611362|HIST 907611362}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|907611365|POL 907611365}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|912077237|HIST 912077237}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|912077239|POL 912077239}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
In an effort to stop going around in circles, let's try to clarify where everyone stands on the various possibilities.  I believe that all of the below descriptors have support from reliable sources.  I have not included any mention of '''''not''''' being on the right at all, because I do not believe there is a reliable source to support that possibility. If someone wants to vote that way, they '''''must''''' provide a ''bona fide'' reliable source to support their vote, or it will be struck.

Here are the choices:

*'''A. right wing'''
*'''B. far right (wing)'''
*'''C. extreme right (wing)'''
*'''D. radical right (wing)'''

Please bold your favored descriptor in your answer.  If you can live with a number of these choices, please list them in your order of preference - we'll do a simple statistical analysis of the results.

This is a survey, it's not intended to be threaded discussion -- we've had plenty of that above.  Let's just try and see what people's preferences are. [[User:Beyond My Ken|Beyond My Ken]] ([[User talk:Beyond My Ken|talk]]) 02:44, 24 July 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Greta Thunberg#rfc_BA64422|Talk:Greta Thunberg]] expired 2019-08-24 17:01 ===
* Id: BA64422
* User: –†–∞–º–º–æ–Ω
* Date: 2019-07-25 16:49:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|907872821|BIO 907872821}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|907872833|POL 907872833}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|912308494|BIO 912308494}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
&#32;
* [[Deutsche Welle]] [https://www.dw.com/en/family-memoir-explores-childhood-of-climate-activist-greta-thunberg/a-48592700 asserts]: "Greta was finally diagnosed with Asperger's syndrome, her younger sister Beata turned out to have an attention deficit hyperactivity disorder ([[ADHD]])".
* [[The New Yorker]] [https://www.newyorker.com/news/our-columnists/the-fifteen-year-old-climate-activist-who-is-demanding-a-new-kind-of-politics asserts]: "both Greta and her younger sister, Beata, have been diagnosed with autism, A.D.H.D., and other conditions."
: {{u|Wikisaurus}} [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=prev&oldid=907835979 choosed] to believe in Deutsche Welle. But I suppose that others reliable sources support The New Yorker's version:
# [[The Guardian]] [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/mar/11/greta-thunberg-schoolgirl-climate-change-warrior-some-people-can-let-things-go-i-cant asserts] that Greta has [[obsessive‚Äìcompulsive disorder]] (OCD) and [[selective mutism]];
# Greta [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EAmmUIEsN9A&t=1m46s said]: "I was diagnosed with Asperger's syndrom, OCD and selective mutism".
: What other editors think about it? [[User:–†–∞–º–º–æ–Ω|–†–∞–º–º–æ–Ω]] ([[User talk:–†–∞–º–º–æ–Ω|talk]]) 16:49, 25 July 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)#rfc_ED0A03A|Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)]] expired 2019-08-25 03:01 ===
* Id: ED0A03A
* User: Crouch, Swale
* Date: 2019-08-05 12:02:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|909441100|HIST 909441100}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|912371183|HIST 912371183}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I started a discussion at [[Wikipedia:Bot requests#Civil parish bot]] to have a bot create the missing [[civil parishes]] in England (about 700) but there were a few problems, namely that my instructions weren't clear enough, that it would be violating my creation restriction ([https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia:Arbitration/Requests/Clarification_and_Amendment&diff=905074773&oldid=905069383 not so]) and that they might not be notable (not so, civil parishes as opposed to ecclesiastical parishes are legally recognized administrative division per [[WP:GEOLAND]]). 

I have created [[User:Crouch, Swale/Bot tasks/Civil parishes (current)/Simple]] which is the current model, there is also [[User:Crouch, Swale/Bot tasks/Civil parishes (current)/Coded]] and [[User:Crouch, Swale/Bot tasks/Civil parishes (current)]] which provide more instructions and some arguments for an against for bot created articles at [[User:Crouch, Swale/Bot tasks/Civil parishes (current)#Process]].

There are 2 questions here, who has the understanding to program such a bot and are there any other things that need to be improves/changed to ensure that this works correctly or to otherwise improve the articles.

It would be good if eventually we could do the same thing for places in other countries to but we'll start with England for now. '''[[User:Crouch, Swale|<span style="color:Green">Crouch, Swale</span>]]''' ([[User talk:Crouch, Swale|<span style="color:Blue">talk</span>]])  12:02, 5 August 2019 (UTC)}}

* Date: 2019-08-06 22:57:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|909688663|TECH 909688663}}

{{rfcquote|text=
{{Wikipedia books|Canada}}As many are aware [[Help:Books|Wikipedia books]] has not worked in a few years and there's no light down the tunnel of any fixes coming...'''[https://m.mediawiki.org/wiki/Reading/Web/PDF_Functionality Reading/Web/PDF Functionality]''' (no update on [https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Reading/Web/PDF_Functionality#Update_on_books,_August_17_2018 WikiBooks in a year]). I am proposing suppressing the rendering capability of [[Template:Wikipedia books]] <small>( related =[[Template:Book bar]] & [[Template:Books-inline]])</small> and removal of [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Special:Book&bookcmd=book_creator&referer=United+States the Book Creator] in the sidebar. I'm thinking suppression of the template(s) is better than outright deletion in case the WMF finally does come up with something...then poof...they can all appear when transclusion is implemented again. Currently PDF rendering per page has been implemented so the link seen at [[Wikipedia:Books]] about an external program is no longer needed as [https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Reading/Web/PDF_Functionality#Update_on_PDF_rendering,_July_15_2019 our in-house PDF system is running].--<span style="font-weight:bold;color:darkblue">[[User_talk:Moxy|Moxy]]</span> <span style="color:red">üçÅ</span> 22:57, 6 August 2019 (UTC)}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the article include the following text under the heading ‚ÄúScholarly debate‚Äù‚Äî<blockquote>‚Äô‚ÄôSome scholars hold that the famine was the product of [[Malthusian]] and [[laissez faire]] economic policies instituted by British officials, particularly Lord Lytton.<ref>{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=v3Qm4pWlVNsC&pg=PA238&lpg=PA238&dq=1876+famine,+genocide&source=bl&ots=h2HC2vNegz&sig=8kkn3xtaWT6DdLTMwfQfL0q2GN0&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwinwPvj3pzaAhUHq1kKHU7dBkA4ChDoAQg5MAQ#v=onepage&q=1876%20famine,%20genocide&f=false|title=Barbaric Civilization: A Critical Sociology of Genocide|last=Powell|first=Christopher|date=2011-06-15|publisher=McGill-Queen's Press - MQUP|year=|isbn=9780773585560|location=|pages=231‚Äì245|language=en}}</ref>   In his book ''[[Late Victorian Holocausts]]'', Mike Davis called the famine a "colonial [[genocide]]" perpetrated by Great Britain. Some, including [[Niall Ferguson]],<ref>Patrick Brantlinger, [https://books.google.com/books?id=DPqqBgAAQBAJ&printsec=frontcover&dq=victorian+literature+and+postcolonial&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwiA9_iZ0sjjAhXMo1kKHQbhAeMQ6AEIKjAA#v=onepage&q=india%20famine&f=false ''Victorian Literature and Postcolonial Studies''] (Edinburgh University Press, 2009), p. 101</ref>
 dispute this judgement, while others, including [[Adam Jones (Canadian scholar)|Adam Jones]], affirm it.<ref>{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=i3auDQAAQBAJ&pg=PT203&lpg=PT203&dq=adam+jones.+1877.+famine.+genocide&source=bl&ots=DQLYl5TYMr&sig=CDa2ZL5YRYs4-g5DEn7-4D37Gfw&hl=en&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwij4Zatgo3aAhXpx1kKHSK5DhkQ6AEwAXoECAYQAQ#v=snippet&q=%22Mask%20for%20colonial%20genocide%22&f=false|title=Genocide: A Comprehensive Introduction|last=Jones|first=Adam|date=2016-12-16|publisher=Routledge|year=|isbn=9781317533856|location=|pages=|language=en|chapter=Chapter 2: State and Empire}}</ref></blockquote>
[[User:GPRamirez5|GPRamirez5]] ([[User talk:GPRamirez5|talk]]) 22:58, 29 July 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Criteria for speedy deletion#rfc_95EFF5E|Wikipedia talk:Criteria for speedy deletion]] expired 2019-08-30 16:01 ===
* Id: 95EFF5E
* User: Steel1943
* Date: 2019-07-31 15:05:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|908728217|POLICY 908728217}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|913205357|POLICY 913205357}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This proposal is similar to the proposal that resulted in the [[WP:R4|R4 criterion]] being created by extracting it from the [[WP:G6|G6 criterion]]. At the present time, the [[WP:G14|G14 criterion]] includes a portion near the end of its description that applies ''exclusively'' to redirects:<blockquote>"G14 also applies to orphaned "Foo (disambiguation)" redirects that target pages that are not disambiguation pages or pages that perform a disambiguation-like function (such as [[Wikipedia:set index articles|set index articles]] or lists)."</blockquote>I propose that this sentence be extracted from the G14 criterion to create a new "R5" criterion as follows:
;R5<nowiki>:</nowiki> Redirects ending with "(disambiguation)" that do not target a disambiguation page
:This applies to orphaned "Foo (disambiguation)" redirects that target pages that are not disambiguation pages or pages that perform a disambiguation-like function (such as [[Wikipedia:set index articles|set index articles]] or lists).
--[[User:Steel1943|<span style="color: #2F4F4F;">'''''Steel1943'''''</span>]] ([[User talk:Steel1943|talk]]) 15:05, 31 July 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Native American name controversy#rfc_DC81882|Talk:Native American name controversy]] expired 2019-09-02 23:01 ===
* Id: DC81882
* User: Oldperson
* Date: 2019-09-02 20:54:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|913726770|POLICY 913726770}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|913741873|POLICY 913741873}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
==Naming Controversy unresolved on WP'''

Because the issue of the naming controversy is unresolved on WP (meaning one clear policy) the subject is left to subjective interpretation and as a result edit warring.  The article mentions the"Salient Issues affecting the debate"however WP needs a clear consensus to avert and forestall any  edit warring. My personal  opinion is Native American (NA) or native American with the context of a sentence. It is enough that some of the NA community perceive it to be pejorative, aboriginal and indigenous is too wordy and "intellectual", native is sufficient. Using the word Indian is confusing to a younger, less educated reader who might think the article is discussing the Indian subcontinent.[[User:Oldperson|Oldperson]] ([[User talk:Oldperson|talk]]) 20:54, 2 September 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Abortion#rfc_2F90DB0|Talk:Abortion]] expired 2019-09-03 09:01 ===
* Id: 2F90DB0
* Date: 2019-08-06 08:34:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|909581175|SCI 909581175}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|914118108|SCI 914118108}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
In the above discussion, some are opposed to the current lede sentence on the basis that the precise number is specific to the USA and thus invalid.

There would seem to be three possibilities, not the two listed above.

# It is safer than carrying a pregnancy to term, which has a 14 times higher risk of death in the United States. (current version)
# Modern abortion procedures are safer than carrying a baby to term,[https://watermark.silverchair.com/gqv026.pdf], [https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/22270271], [https://www.popsci.com/restricting-abortion-public-health/], [https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/health/news/8349898/Abortion-is-safer-than-having-a-baby-doctors-say.html], especially in the US, where maternal mortality rates are among the highest in the developed world.[https://choice.npr.org/index.html?origin=https://www.npr.org/2017/05/12/528098789/u-s-has-the-worst-rate-of-maternal-deaths-in-the-developed-world] 
# Omit the statement.
<b>[[User Talk:JzG|Guy]]</b> <small>([[User:JzG/help|Help!]])</small> 08:34, 6 August 2019 (UTC)}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|910244678|BIO 910244678}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|910244689|STYLE 910244689}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|913917281|BIO 913917281}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|913917305|STYLE 913917305}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There are [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?search=intitle%3A%22committed+suicide%22&ns14=1&limit=500 many categories that use the turn of phrase ''committed suicide'' in the category title]. I opened this RfC to establish if there is a general consensus to stop using this term which [https://www.nbcnews.com/better/health/why-mental-health-advocates-use-words-died-suicide-ncna880546 some believe is disparaging and has fallen out of favor].

RFC: The term ''{{!xt|committed}} {{xt|suicide}}'' should not be used in category titles unless there is good reason to do so instead of alternatives such as: '''''suicide''''' <s>/ '''''died by suicide''''' / '''''died by apparent suicide''''' /</s> '''''killed themselve(s)''''' or other alternatives. We can discuss case by case later. ---&nbsp;[[User talk:Coffeeandcrumbs|<span style="color:#CC2200">Coffee</span>]]<nowiki/>and[[Special:Contributions/Coffeeandcrumbs|<span style="color:#663366">crumbs</span>]] 17:47, 10 August 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Cloudflare#rfc_557ACF1|Talk:Cloudflare]] expired 2019-09-04 01:01 ===
* Id: 557ACF1
* User: HoboDyerProjection
* Date: 2019-08-05 01:00:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|909377802|ECON 909377802}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|909377807|SCI 909377807}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|913917287|ECON 913917287}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|913917293|SCI 913917293}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Recent controversies surrounding Cloudflare involving 8chan and hate groups are the reason for the changed lede, does this change follow WP:NPOV?
Further clarification: the change started with [[User:Domjh]] being accused of bad-faith changes, while he was removing obvious vandalism (https://twitter.com/AVALANCHE_Girls/status/1158137928536731648). The edit that started all of this can ben found here: [[Special:PermaLink/909341255]]. All discussion from that point onward seems focused on preserving some amount of that vandalism, for whatever reason. It's clear I have the appearances against me, having a new account, but I am truly just a random new editor who stumbled across this discussion and took an interest as it seemed "off".
: Update: I took it upon myself to follow the suggestions of more experienced editors and rewrote the lede, better summarising Cloudflare's controversial history in regards to freedom of speech for using multiple perspectives. Thereby leaving the controversial topics in the lede while also adhering the WP:NPOV. [[User:HoboDyerProjection|HoboDyerProjection]] ([[User talk:HoboDyerProjection|talk]]) 01:00, 5 August 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Meghan Murphy#rfc_53E60FD|Talk:Meghan Murphy]] expired 2019-09-06 10:01 ===
* Id: 53E60FD
* User: F√¶
* Date: 2019-08-07 09:04:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|909743929|BIO 909743929}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|909743933|POL 909743933}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|914278360|BIO 914278360}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|914278364|POL 914278364}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Meghan Murphy is a [[radical feminist]] known for their opposition to [[transgender]] rights and their ban from Twitter for "hateful speech" directed at [[trans women]]. Due to extensive manipulation, including that the original text was created from Meghan Murphy's own published profile by a contributor who has been blocked for disrupting transgender related articles, and while blocked has continued to manipulate the article content and discussions using sockpuppets, I propose that the article is now rebuilt. This is being raised as an RfC to gain a wider consensus, partly because local discussions have been significantly manipulated by confirmed sockpuppetry.

The proposal is to replace with a ''non controversial'' stub, based on only independent [[WP:BLP|BLP]] compliant reliable sources. As a community we can then gradually add sources and material one at a time, ensuring that there is a balance of material in line with policy and documented consensus on controversial topics.

Thanks --[[User:F√¶|F√¶]] ([[User talk:F√¶|talk]]) 09:04, 7 August 2019 (UTC)}}

Should the pictures in the article follow [[:MOS:IMAGELOC]] and avoid the left edge of the page? [[User:Walter G√∂rlitz|Walter G√∂rlitz]] ([[User talk:Walter G√∂rlitz|talk]]) 00:23, 8 September 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Tennis#rfc_472B339|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Tennis]] expired 2019-09-11 20:01 ===
* Id: 472B339
* User: Fyunck(click)
* Date: 2019-08-12 19:17:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|910541843|BIO 910541843}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|910541852|SOC 910541852}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|915197368|BIO 915197368}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|915197373|SOC 915197373}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Shall we place somewhere in the '''lead''' of tennis player Roger Federer, and many other tennis players, the sentence "He/She is considered one of the greatest tennis players of all time?" This includes variants on this theme.

There has been back and forth on this issue for a lot of tennis players leads as pretty much every player in the Hall of Fame of tennis history is in this category. In the recent past we have been eliminating any subjective terminology such as this from all tennis bio leads and been putting them in legacy sections of prose of the bio, with sourcing of course. When present, these leads get fought over with wording regularly. "One of the greatest", "the greatest" widely considered the greatest", "some call one of the greatest", etc. Encyclopedias [https://www.britannica.com/biography/Roger-Federer such as Britannica] don't use these subjective terms at all with Federer, let alone in the lead. I have found that past players and critics who dole out these subjective headlines to sell papers and magszines, change their minds frequently. It's great for the water cooler but I'm not sure it's great for the lead of biography articles. As long as all tennis player bios are treated the same at wikipedia (such as [[Rod Laver]], [[Steffi Graf]], [[Helen Wills]], [[Pete Sampras]], [[Chris Evert]], [[Jack Kramer]], [[Bill Tilden]], etc...) then I'm ok with whatever decision is made here, however it is probably easier to maintain with no mention in the lead for subjective terms such as "one of the greatest." [[User:Fyunck(click)|Fyunck(click)]] ([[User talk:Fyunck(click)|talk]]) 19:17, 12 August 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Music#rfc_EEA6339|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Music]] expired 2019-09-15 16:01 ===
* Id: EEA6339
* User: Ojorojo
* Date: 2019-08-16 15:16:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|911711468|POLICY 911711468}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|915843077|POLICY 915843077}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Several music infoboxes include a location or origin parameter, which is used to identify the country. (see {{tl|Infobox venue}}, {{tl|Infobox record label}}, {{tl|Infobox orchestra}}, {{tl|Infobox musical artist}}, {{tl|Infobox music genre}}, {{tl|Infobox halftime show}}, {{tl|Infobox music festival}}, {{tl|Infobox concert}}, {{tl|Infobox album}} & {{tl|Infobox song}} venue & studio in both).  

When identifying the country, should the acronyms "U.S." or "UK" (with or without periods consistent with the text) be allowed or should only the full "United States" or "United Kingdom" be used? [[MOS:ACRO#Exceptions]] includes: "'''Countries and multinational unions''' For these commonly-referred-to entities, the full name does not need to be written out in full on first use, nor provided on first use in parentheses after the full name if written out{{nbsp}}... UK, US or U.S., USSR".  

A discussion was begun [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Music/Music genres task force#Clarification regarding country names in infobox|here]], but this is an appropriate issue for a more consistent project-wide approach. ‚Äî[[User:Ojorojo|Ojorojo]] ([[User talk:Ojorojo|talk]]) 15:16, 16 August 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Campus sexual assault#rfc_BC88D5F|Talk:Campus sexual assault]] expired 2019-09-15 17:01 ===
* Id: BC88D5F
* User: Nblund
* Date: 2019-08-16 16:29:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|911120705|SCI 911120705}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|911120715|POL 911120715}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|911120719|SOC 911120719}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|915852599|SCI 915852599}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|915852604|POL 915852604}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|915852607|SOC 915852607}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This RFC concerns a dispute over how to frame the research on campus sexual assault.

# Academic surveys of sexual assault generally report a far higher rate of sexual assault than the rate reported by the [[Measures_of_campus_sexual_assault#National_Crime_Victimization_Surveys|National Crime Victimization Survey]] (NCVS). Should the article give '''more weight to the NCVS, equal weight to the NCVS, or less weight to the NCVS''', relative to the higher estimate found in academic sources as a whole.
# A number of non-academic critics (such as [[Christina Hoff Sommers]], or [[Stuart Taylor Jr.]]) have argued the research on campus sexual assault is methodologically flawed. Should the views of these non-academic critics be given '''equal weight''' to the academic views, or should non-academic criticisms be treated as a '''minority or fringe viewpoint'''? [[User:Nblund |<span style="background-color: #CC79A7; color:white;">'''Nblund'''</span>]]<sup> [[User talk:Nblund|talk]]</sup> 16:29, 16 August 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Requests for comment/User rights of (site) banned users#rfc_4DF0F21|Wikipedia:Requests for comment/User rights of (site) banned users]] expired 2019-09-15 20:01 ===

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the user rights (e.g. template editor, autopatrolled, etc.) of [[WP:SBAN|site banned]] users be removed when banned (case-by-case or otherwise)? If so, subject to case-by-case restoration if unbanned? {{small|There was a [[Wikipedia_talk:User_access_levels/Archive_2#Rights_of_indef_blocked_users|previous RfC]] that was similar to this in 2012 which spawned [[WP:INDEFRIGHTS]], but its question was quite broad, referring to ''all'' indefinitely blocked users. This RfC was created with the partial intention/inspiration as a "refresher" on consensus, but with the main focus this time on banned users rather than the broad classification of "indefinitely blocked". === [[Talk:List of Marvel Cinematic Universe films#rfc_EBDC775|Talk:List of Marvel Cinematic Universe films]] expired 2019-09-16 10:01 ===
* Id: EBDC775
* User: TriiipleThreat
* Date: 2019-08-17 09:02:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|911213370|MEDIA 911213370}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|915983713|MEDIA 915983713}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
It has recently been decided to split this article per [[WP:SIZE]]. Editors have already created several drafts by splitting the article by phase (ex. [[:Draft:Phase One (Marvel Cinematic Universe)]]). However, there is disagreement on what these new pages should be titled. Some have suggested [[Phase One (Marvel Cinematic Universe)]] per [[WP:COMMONNAME]] (as seen [https://www.marvel.com/articles/movies/your-marvel-guide-to-avengers-endgame here]). Some have suggested [[Marvel Cinematic Universe Phase One]], based on the cover art of the [https://images-na.ssl-images-amazon.com/images/I/A1mDMlKUaFL._SX342_.jpg box set], or [[Marvel Cinematic Universe: Phase One]] with a colon inserted for legibility. Others have suggested the more formal [[Phase One of the Marvel Cinematic Universe]] per [[WP:NATURALDIS]] and [[Marvel Cinematic Universe (Phase One)]] by adopting [[WP:TV]] naming conventions for television seasons. Other suggestions include [[Marvel Phase One]] and [[MCU Phase One]].‚Äî[[User:TriiipleThreat|TriiipleThreat]] ([[User talk:TriiipleThreat|talk]]) 09:02, 17 August 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject UK Railways#rfc_4B5C86E|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject UK Railways]] expired 2019-09-19 21:01 ===
* Id: 4B5C86E
* User: Djm-leighpark
* Date: 2019-08-20 20:43:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|911778795|POLICY 911778795}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|916630673|POLICY 916630673}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
In response to an argument that escalated to AN/I about the so-called "fan art" dispute, I proposed that an RFC should be held here, and it was suggested that as an uninvolved editor I try to come up with a neutral question to see if we can reach a community consensus.  Here are what I think the questions are; a '''Yes''' or '''No''' or more nuanced answer on each is requested:
: '''A'''. Does the use in articles of editor-constructed diagrams such as livery details violate [[WP:V]] when the diagrammed details are not verifiably sourced?
: '''B'''. Should British railway articles be allowed to include galleries of livery detail diagrams, of the type that some have characterized as "fan art" (whether or not the included diagrams need to be "sourced" will be determined by answers to '''A''').

Feel free to answer like "Yes A and Yes B" or answer one or the other, or both separately, and optionally qualify your responses in terms of visual impact, image quality, availability of quality photographs as alternatives, and whatever else you think is relevant.

'''Background'''

Some prior discussions that didn't converge:
* [[Wikipedia:Village_pump_(policy)#Use_of_fan_art_in_articles|at WP:VPP]]
* [[Wikipedia:Administrators' noticeboard/Incidents#Tony May and persistent criticism and belittling of other editors on British railways|at WP:AN/I]]
* [[#Use of fan art diagrams to illustrate liveries already illustrated with photographs|above at project talk page]]
* [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject UK Railways/Archive 45#Livery diagrams]] ([[User:Djm-leighpark|Djm-leighpark]] ([[User talk:Djm-leighpark|talk]]) 20:43, 20 August 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Template talk:Timelines of Chinese history#rfc_04ACC24|Template talk:Timelines of Chinese history]] expired 2019-09-20 07:01 ===
* Id: 04ACC24
* User: Robertsky
* Date: 2019-08-21 06:08:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|911800285|HIST 911800285}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|911800292|POL 911800292}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|911800295|SOC 911800295}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|916712119|HIST 916712119}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|916712121|POL 916712121}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|916712122|SOC 916712122}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
{{u|Qiushufang}} has included Singapore in the above-mentioned template and dropped the template in [[Timeline of Singaporean history]]. His [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Timeline_of_Singaporean_history&oldid=911794433 reason] for inclusion is 'the template does not just include the history of the country of China, but also many related areas and topics - Singapore is today majority ethnically Chinese and more than fits the bill for inclusion in the template'. However, I disagree on the grounds that:
#Singapore is not a Chinese country or territory. The template is overwhelming China centric. Singapore is independent of China.
#If is to be included, it should be included as diaspora, and list with other countries with sizeable diaspora (i.e. USA) as well.
Even though Singapore has a large Chinese diaspora, Singapore has been separately managed and governed from China, even in ancient times. Whatever bearings China has on us would only be culturally and economically as international trade partners. Our political system, and societal structure, values are different. There were also relatively little events intertwining both nations. 
I seek consensus on whether to include Singapore in the above template. I don't think I would be able to resolve this with {{u|Qiushufang}} as looking at both our edit histories, we may end up clashing with each other over this. [[User:Robertsky|robertsky]] ([[User talk:Robertsky|talk]]) 06:08, 21 August 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:IHeartRadio Canada#rfc_C26AB4E|Talk:IHeartRadio Canada]] expired 2019-09-21 18:01 ===
* Id: C26AB4E
* User: Dmehus
* Date: 2019-08-28 00:11:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|912809774|ECON 912809774}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|912809775|MEDIA 912809775}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|912809783|SOC 912809783}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|916982750|ECON 916982750}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|916982761|MEDIA 916982761}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|916982773|SOC 916982773}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
[[User:ViperSnake151|ViperSnake151]], while almost certainly operating with good intentions and ''good faith'', has performed one or more [[WP:BRD]] moves of [[Bell Media Radio]] to [[IHeartRadio Canada]] with a rationale that is questionable and possibly inconsistent with one or more ''Wikipedia'' policies. He purportedly cites, by way of ''edit summaries'', CRTC ownership charts, but even that shows [[Bell Media]] and [[Bell Media Radio]] are the [[WP:CommonName]]. Moreover, looking to the company's own website, https://www.bellmedia.ca/radio/, I don't see how we should be using IHeartRadio Canada, notwithstanding the noted capitalization issues in that page name. Additionally, we also need to consider that iHeartRadio in the [[United States]] is a separate company owner separate ownership.

To me, I think the page names should remain [[Bell Media]] and [[Bell Media Radio]], with the ''lede'' and ''opening sentence'' indicating the legal name, '''Bell Media Radio G.P.'', and the [[doing business as]] name indicated as iHeartRadio, if desired. [[User:Dmehus|Doug Mehus]] ([[User talk:Dmehus|talk]]) 00:11, 28 August 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Naming conventions (broadcasting)#rfc_F2DDB3C|Wikipedia talk:Naming conventions (broadcasting)]] expired 2019-09-22 16:01 ===
* Id: F2DDB3C
* User: JSH-alive
* Date: 2019-08-23 16:00:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|912152202|STYLE 912152202}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|912152204|PROP 912152204}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|917171817|STYLE 917171817}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|917171819|PROP 917171819}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
After months since the [[#New disambiguation suffix for multichannel television providers|previous discussion]], I still think there should be a new suffix for the articles about [[Multichannel television|multichannel television services]]. Look at the article titles with disambiguation suffix at these categories. Can you find the inconsistencies?
* [[:Category:Pay television]]
* [[:Category:American subscription television services]]
* [[:Category:Australian subscription television services]]
* [[:Category:Cable television companies]]
* [[:Category:Direct broadcast satellite services]]
* [[:Category:Internet television]]

I'd name it '''([country or area] TV provider)'''; since some companies do provide more than one method to provide multichannel services under the same brand (for example, [[Foxtel]] in Australia [cable and satellite], [[Telef√≥nica]]'s [[Movistar+]] in Spain [IPTV and satellite], [[StarTimes]] operations in Africa [DTT and satellite] and [[Altice Dominicana S.A.|Altice Dominicana]] [cable and satellite]), it would be too much to have '''(cable TV provider)''', '''(satellite TV provider)''', '''(IPTV provider)''', etc..

Additionally, I'd suggest '''(radio provider)''' suffix for [[cable radio]] and [[satellite radio]] providers.

But what about services like [[Music Choice]] and [[Stingray Music]] that provide non-stop music streams to TV providers? Should they be suffixed with '''(audio service)'''?

Also, what about '''(video service)''' for
* [[Over-the-top media services|OTT]] video streaming services without linear live channels (like [[Netflix]])
* Video libraries that does not have streaming platform on its own, but provide a catalogue of VOD titles to TV providers (like [http://www.cirkustv.com/ Cirkus] and [http://www.curioplay.com/ Curio])

[[User:JSH-alive|JSH-alive]]/<sup>[[User talk:JSH-alive|talk]]/[[Special:Contributions/JSH-alive|cont]]/[[Special:Emailuser/JSH-alive|mail]]</sup> 16:00, 23 August 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Kate Dover#rfc_18E30B5|Talk:Kate Dover]] expired 2019-09-26 10:01 ===
* Id: 18E30B5
* Date: 2019-09-26 06:38:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|915126537|BIO 915126537}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|915126540|HIST 915126540}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|923080843|BIO 923080843}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|923080844|HIST 923080844}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
&#32;
#<s>Should a shortened version of the subject's full name be included and bolded in the first sentence of the lead, as in {{oldid2|915118190|this revision}} (or compare {{diff2|915118190|this diff}})?</s> <small>(resolved)</small>
#Should the subject be characterized as an "artist and housekeeper", wherein art was her hobby and education but housekeeper was her profession and role in [[Trial of Kate Dover|her trial / crime]], or just as "housekeeper"?
#Is the following paragraph appropriate for the lead?
 <s>Her background was one of artists and artisans. Her father was a wood carver, her employer was an etcher and painter, and she herself attended [[Sheffield School of Art]] and was skilled in drawing flowers. Thus she was a member of the working class in [[Sheffield|a town]] dominated by heavy industry, and at the same time a member of an artistic subculture within that. Her education and cultural environment, together with her complex personality of both intelligence and dishonesty, made her an unusual and notable type of killer, especially if compared with the contemporary murderer from a nearby town, [[Charles Peace]].</s>

 Her background was one of artists and artisans. Her father was a wood carver, her employer was an etcher and painter, and she herself attended [[Sheffield School of Art]] and was skilled in drawing flowers. Thus she was a member of the working class in [[Sheffield|a town]] dominated by heavy industry, and at the same time a member of an artistic set within that. Her education and cultural environment, together with her intelligence and dishonesty, made her a complex character. <small>(Paragraph changed during course of RfC 06:38, 26 September 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Wittington Investments#rfc_E7CC18A|Talk:Wittington Investments]] expired 2019-09-26 17:01 ===
* Id: E7CC18A
* User: Dmehus
* Date: 2019-08-27 16:17:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|912751117|ECON 912751117}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|918024753|ECON 918024753}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I'm issuing this RfC re: some issues I noticed with this ''Wikipedia'' page. Specifically, its ''Holdings'' section where it notes, incorrectly based on my interpretation, that Witting Investments, Limited (Canada) is a [[subsidiary]] of Witting Investments Limited (United Kingdom). Based on the response to the third question in this [[FAQ]],<ref>{{cite web |title=FAQs |url=https://www.wittington-investments.co.uk/faq/ |website=Wittington Investments Limited |accessdate=27 August 2019}}</ref>, it seems to indicate a ''very subtle'' difference in naming convention in that the UK-incorporated Wittington Investments ''doesn't'' have a comma following "Investments" whereas the Canada-incorporated Wittington Investments ''does''.

So, several questions:

# Am I correct in my interpretation that the UK-incorporated Wittington is ''not'' the parent company of the Canadian-incorporated Wittington?
# Assuming that the answer to Q. 1 is ''yes'', would it be logical, therefore, for me to initiate a ''move request'' to ''Wittington Investments (United Kingdom)'' or could I initiate this myself, intending to more fully develop an article for the Canadian-incorporated Wittington as a non-controversial ''page move'' (under what basis should I rationalize the move, as I'm unfamiliar with ''Wikipedia'''s labyrinth of policies)? What is the naming convention on ''Wikipedia'' for two companies that share the same name but different jurisdictions?
# Assuming I ''can'' do this myself non-controversially, or if I should do it in a ''page move'', will anyone volunteer to be a non-involved ''closer'' in either case? [[User:Dmehus|Doug Mehus]] ([[User talk:Dmehus|talk]]) 16:17, 27 August 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Same-sex marriage#rfc_18E5C19|Talk:Same-sex marriage]] expired 2019-09-27 23:01 ===
* Id: 18E5C19
* User: Darryl Kerrigan
* Date: 2019-08-28 22:05:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|912951363|POL 912951363}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|918288988|POL 918288988}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
In the [[Same-sex_marriage#Contemporary|timeline found under the History section]], we indicate that same-sex-marriage is legal "[nationwide]" in the [[Same-sex marriage in the United States|United States]] despite the fact that it remains illegal in the [[LGBT rights in American Samoa|US Territory of American Samoa]]. What is the best way for us to address this without misleading readers, or unnecessarily complicating the table?

#Leave it as is.
#Remove "[nationwide]".
#Add a footnote indicating that it remains illegal in American Samoa.
#Remove "[nationwide]" and add a footnote.
#Other suggestion.

Thank you in advance for your consideration and input.--[[User:Darryl Kerrigan|Darryl Kerrigan]] ([[User talk:Darryl Kerrigan|talk]]) 22:05, 28 August 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of the Cenozoic life of Washington (state)#rfc_115EB54|Talk:List of the Cenozoic life of Washington (state)]] expired 2019-09-28 23:01 ===
* Id: 115EB54
* User: Abyssal
* Date: 2019-08-29 22:18:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|913107340|STYLE 913107340}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|918491525|STYLE 918491525}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I've been compiling [[User:Abyssal/Articles to caption checklist|lists of prehistoric life by location]] for a while now. This article series contains a huge variety of images in all shapes and sizes. I think the articles are best served by displaying wide images with a >0.75 scaling factor and tall images with a lesser one. To keep consistency across the article series I proposed a [[#list|list]] of standards for which scaling factors I thought images of differing aspect ratios would be best displayed at and a [[User:Abyssal/Ratio experiments 4|list of examples]]. Kevmin, this article's other main contributor, disagrees and seems to support maintaining the default scale factor for all images independent of aspect ratio. I just thought I would open an RfC to solicit outside perspectives on the ideal scaling factor(s) for displaying the images in these articles. [[User:Abyssal|Abyssal]] ([[User talk:Abyssal|talk]]) 22:18, 29 August 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of music considered the worst#rfc_1A93EAC|Talk:List of music considered the worst]] expired 2019-09-29 22:01 ===
* Id: 1A93EAC
* User: Wanna Know My Name? Later
* Date: 2019-08-30 21:17:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|913249170|MEDIA 913249170}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|918689366|MEDIA 918689366}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
For many years, the requirement for a music album to be included in the article "[[List of music considered the worst]]" has been that there must be at least one source that calls the album, "the worst". While many albums considered bad are correctly included in this list with this unique requirement, many others which have a mixed or positive reception are also included, since at some point a critic called it "the worst", contradicting the general reception of the album.

We propose that the inclusion criteria changes, per the following:

#If an album contains a Metacritic score (being the original, remastered or new remix version), it has a score below 40, and at least three reliable sources call it "the worst", then it can be included in this article.
#If the album does not contain a Metacritic score, then a discussion will be made to review sources from [[WP:ALBUM]]. If >= 70% of the sources have a negative review of the album, and at least three of them call it "the worst", then it can be included in this article. 
#If an album does not meet any of these requirements, and it's currently in this article (in any section of it), then it will be removed from the article, because it's understood that it is not considered to be "the worst", which is the title of this article.
<font face="Verdana">[[User:Wanna Know My Name? Later|WKMN? Later]] </font><font face="Tahoma" size="1">[ [[User talk:Wanna Know My Name? Later|Let's talk]] ]</font> 21:17, 30 August 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Requests for comment/Arbitration Committee Elections December 2019#rfc_3775FE7|Wikipedia:Requests for comment/Arbitration Committee Elections December 2019]] expired 2019-09-30 13:01 ===
* Id: 3775FE7
* User: Cyberpower678
* Date: 2019-09-30 11:04:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:

=== [[Talk:Stoya#rfc_C4C5EC2|Talk:Stoya]] expired 2019-09-30 23:01 ===
* Id: C4C5EC2
* User: Morbidthoughts
* Date: 2019-08-31 22:03:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|913412514|BIO 913412514}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|918928414|BIO 918928414}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Stoya's birth or legal name has been in dispute over the past decade. Originally editors had speculated that her name was Jessica Stoyadinovich or Stojadinovich based on previous clues about her name and continually inserted it into the article over the years.[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Stoya&diff=387949061&oldid=385602328][https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Stoya&diff=387949061&oldid=385602328][https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Stoya&diff=445183565&oldid=445176429][https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Stoya&diff=570769642&oldid=570472085][https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Stoya&diff=584532088&oldid=584511702] Sources then widely began to report and rely on it, turning it into a case of [[circular reporting]], a phenomenon which the relied source[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Stoya&diff=913393951&oldid=913393416] has been guilty of in the past<s>([[Wikipedia:List_of_citogenesis_incidents]])</s>[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Circular_reporting#cite_note-16]. In the meantime, her actual last name was also first inserted by a random editor in 2009[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Stoya&diff=310110928&oldid=309065324] but this name has not been pushed by other editors with the same vehemence despite confirmation by trademark registration[[https://trademarks.justia.com/777/52/stoya-77752706.html]] and other sources[https://www.welt.de/print/wams/kultur/article151919330/Sexualitaet-und-Wahrheit.html] and consistency with how we understand how family names are derived. Why? I don't know. Given that her last name is in dispute, is it proper to mention either while still respecting [[WP:BLPPRIVACY]]? [[User:Morbidthoughts|Morbidthoughts]] ([[User talk:Morbidthoughts|talk]]) 22:03, 31 August 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:U.S. state#rfc_B6471C5|Talk:U.S. state]] expired 2019-10-01 03:01 ===
* Id: B6471C5
* Date: 2019-09-01 02:17:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|913443951|HIST 913443951}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|913443952|POL 913443952}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|918960818|HIST 918960818}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|918960822|POL 918960822}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The question is, should a section about state-equivalents be included in the U.S. states article? The U.S. Census Bureau defines 6 state-equivalents: [[American Samoa]], the [[District of Columbia]], [[Guam]], the [[Northern Mariana Islands]], [[Puerto Rico]], and the [[U.S. Virgin Islands]]. Even though these areas are not U.S. states, they are treated as though they are states (for statistical purposes) by the U.S. Census Bureau, and by other federal agencies of the United States (such as the U.S. Postal Service). Those opposing inclusion of these entities argue that they are not relevant to the article, while those in favor say they are relevant. There is a previous discussion about this issue in the section above (the section entitled, "Reverted state-equivalents section"). 02:17, 1 September 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Wikipedia as a press source#rfc_BF7AC99|Wikipedia talk:Wikipedia as a press source]] expired 2019-10-02 19:01 ===
* Id: BF7AC99
* User: Biogeographist
* Date: 2019-10-02 16:24:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|919247007|UNSORTED 919247007}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|919264952|UNSORTED 919264952}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should {{tl|Historical}} be added to [[Wikipedia:Wikipedia as a press source]] and to related Wikipedia as a press source YEAR pages listed in {{tl|PressSourceYYYY}}? Information that used to be listed on these pages is now listed in {{tl|Press}} on article talk pages, and no listings have been added for 2019 at [[Wikipedia:Wikipedia as a press source 2019]], so this series of pages appears dead/unmaintained. Note that in contrast, [[Wikipedia:Press coverage]] and related Press coverage YEAR pages listed in {{tl|PressCoverageYYYY}}, for press coverage of Wikipedia as a project (rather than of individual Wikipedia articles), is actively maintained. [[User:Biogeographist|Biogeographist]] ([[User talk:Biogeographist|talk]]) 16:24, 2 October 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Wikidata#rfc_CFDB018|Wikipedia talk:Wikidata]] expired 2019-10-02 22:01 ===
* Id: CFDB018
* User: Bogger
* Date: 2019-09-02 21:19:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|919036455|POLICY 919036455}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|919036456|TECH 919036456}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|919289444|POLICY 919289444}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|919289450|TECH 919289450}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Myself and {{ping|Davey2010}} have [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/User_talk:Davey2010#%22Full_parameters_are_always_preferred%22 come to a disagreement] as to whether a wikidata tracked template (such as [[Template:IMDB name]], [[Template:Official website]], [[Template:Twitter]] ...) should include the id and title, if these parameters are stored in wikidata. It turns out a lot of our individual edits have involved adding these when missing, or removing them when not needed(or moving them into wikidata) respectively. What's the preferred/consensus usage? ''[[Highlander (film)|#ThereCanOnlyBeOne]]''

:'''REWORDING''' using [[User:RexxS]]'s wording from below.
:in edits like [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Emily_Atack&diff=913323684&oldid=912719726 this], I changed <code><nowiki>{{Twitter|EmAtack}}</nowiki></code> to <code><nowiki>{{Twitter}}</nowiki></code> and <code><nowiki>{{IMDb name|3038143|Emily Atack}}</nowiki></code> to <code><nowiki>{{IMDb name}}</nowiki></code> because in those templates the values will be retrieved from Wikidata and we don't need to explicitly give the parameters in that article. Whereas in edits like [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Emily_Atack&diff=913325248&oldid=913323684 this], Davey2010 is restoring or adding those parameters explicitly, either because no valid reason was given for the removal, or because "Full parameters are always preferred". So we would like clarity on whether (1) it's better to keep simple facts centrally on Wikidata and retrieve them as needed; or (2) it's better to keep all information on Wikipedia where it is under our direct control.[[User:Bogger|Bogger]] ([[User talk:Bogger|talk]]) 21:19, 2 September 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:TERF#rfc_B13A823|Talk:TERF]] expired 2019-10-03 05:01 ===
* Id: B13A823
* User: LokiTheLiar
* Date: 2019-09-03 04:06:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|913778260|LANG 913778260}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|913778262|POL 913778262}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|913778263|SOC 913778263}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|919338340|LANG 919338340}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|919338341|POL 919338341}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|919338344|SOC 919338344}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Until about a week ago, this page described TERFs as {{tq|feminists who espouse transphobic sentiments}}. This was recently changed to {{tq|feminists who espouse sentiments considered transphobic}} by [[User:Crossroads1]], and through some talk page discussion has since become {{tq|feminists who espouse sentiments that other feminists consider transphobic}}, but we're now at an impasse.

There has been dispute on this talk page about how exactly to phrase this, with debate centering around the following options:

* '''Option 1''': Leave as is: {{tq|feminists who espouse sentiments that other feminists consider transphobic}}
*: '''Option 1.1''': Proposed by [[User:Darryl Kerrigan | Darryl Kerrigan]]: {{tq|feminists who espouse sentiments that others consider transphobic}}
* '''Option 2''': List specific sources: {{tq|  feminists who have been described as transphobic by USA Today, the Daily Dot, Indy100, and a joint statement by several major lesbian publications, as well as many other feminists}}
* '''Option 3''': Remove mention of transphobia entirely.
*:'''Option 3.1''': Proposed by {{u|Rosguill}}: remove mention of transphobia from the first paragraph but add it to the second which already describes criticism from feminists and academics {{tq|‚Ä¶have rejected this view and consider it to be transphobic}}
* '''Option 4''': Revert to previous wording with no in-text attribution: {{tq| feminists who espouse transphobic sentiments}}
* '''Option 5''': Proposed by [[User:Pyxis Solitary]]: {{tq|feminists who espouse sentiments considered transphobic by transgender advocates}}

Please list all options you are okay with and which one you most prefer. [[User:LokiTheLiar|Loki]] ([[User talk:LokiTheLiar|talk]]) 04:06, 3 September 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)#rfc_1B10437|Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)]] expired 2019-10-04 00:01 ===
* Id: 1B10437
* User: GreenC
* Date: 2019-09-03 23:58:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|913910508|TECH 913910508}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|919484925|TECH 919484925}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
VisualEditor has a particularly devilish bug that is snagging newbies and experts alike, and impacting a dozen+ articles a day.
:[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=See_of_Tyre&type=revision&diff=912533078&oldid=912532691 Example diff] from [[See of Tyre]]
Note the <code><nowiki><sup>[[Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Tyre#cite%20note-FOOTNOTEHamilton2016409-13|[13]]]</sup></nowiki></code>. This should be cite #13 from the article [[Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Tyre]] as of the date the revision at [[See of Tyre]] was made. When the editor copy-pasted the citation in non-edit mode, it got transformed into this garbage string. Another interpreted available [[User:GreenC_bot/Job_18|here]].

A couple things about this bug:
* It is unknown when the VE team will fix this bug. 
* It impacts not only citations: [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Elena_Bajo&diff=prev&oldid=913990745 example cleanup edit]
* A log of cases is available [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchFilter=861 here]
* I wrote a bot [[User:GreenC_bot/Job_18|vebug bot]] to "fix" these cases as seen [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Rafael_Yuste&diff=prev&oldid=913904576 here]. 
* The bot is not fail-proof or fully automatic, there are ways for things to go wrong due to subtle complexities with revision histories, syntax of the bug, technical limitations of determining a citation by its number, etc. Thus the bot leaves a {{tlx|verify source}} with inline instructions for editors to manual check/fix the cite. It moves the process forward, but is not a total resolution. Only manual work can fully verify.

'''Proposal''': The RfC is to establish consensus for a new Edit filter to block further edits containing the bug. The block will contain a message instructing editors not to copy-paste wikitext text unless in edit-mode due to a bug in VisualEditor.  -- [[User:GreenC|<span style="color: #006A4E;">'''Green'''</span>]][[User talk:GreenC|<span style="color: #093;">'''C'''</span>]] 23:58, 3 September 2019 (UTC)}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|919771457|SCI 919771457}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should a YouTube video [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Tsqm_zfA0TA] of the subject of the article talking at an event be acceptable as the only source for a statement in the lead of the article that the company he co-founded lost over $50 million?

#Yes.
#Yes, but the information should still not be include in the lead for NPOV and/or other reasons.
#No, the source in unacceptable for this information anywhere in the article.
[[User:BC1278|BC1278]] ([[User talk:BC1278|talk]]) 17:34, 5 September 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Miscellany for deletion#rfc_CB4ADE6|Wikipedia talk:Miscellany for deletion]] expired 2019-10-10 20:01 ===
* Id: CB4ADE6
* User: ToThAc
* Date: 2019-09-10 19:15:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|915027831|PROP 915027831}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|920602600|PROP 920602600}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
All of the other deletion processes have an archive system by date, so I'm a little confused as to why the [[Wikipedia:Miscellany for deletion/Archived debates|MfD archive]] only goes by month, and doesn't have carbon copies of the discussions like the other deletion processes (even TfD does it by date despite having very little nominations per date). <del>Also, why are the closed discussions listed at their end dates (also unlike the other deletion processes)?</del> For the sake of consistency, I have two proposals as to how this can be remedied, with only one major difference in-between them:
#'''Create archives by date as "{{fake link|Wikipedia:Miscellany for deletion/Log/{expanded DMY date<nowiki>}</nowiki>}} and ''transclude'' the discussion pages into their respective start dates.''' This is similar to the setup currently used at [[Wikipedia:Articles for deletion|AfD]].
#'''Create archives by date as "{{fake link|Wikipedia:Miscellany for deletion/Log/{expanded DMY date<nowiki>}</nowiki>}} and ''merge'' the discussion pages into their respective start dates.''' This is similar to the setup currently used at [[Wikipedia:Categories for discussion|every]] [[Wikipedia:Files for discussion|other]] [[Wikipedia:Redirects for discussion|deletion]] [[Wikipedia:Templates for discussion|process]].
What are everyone's thoughts so far? I'm currently neutral on this discussion, but my opinions may change based on the opinions of other users. [[User:ToThAc|ToThAc]] ([[User talk:ToThAc|talk]]) 19:15, 10 September 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Requests for adminship/Greenman#rfc_96C6E57|Wikipedia talk:Requests for adminship/Greenman]] expired 2019-10-12 11:01 ===
* Id: 96C6E57
* User: Lourdes
* Date: 2019-10-12 02:49:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|920823979|POLICY 920823979}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|920861115|POLICY 920861115}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Friends, supporters, opposers, discussers, I'm aware of my oppose and how it has affected the RfA. My oppose remains the same. I am not comfortable handing this candidate the admin bit until the COI lines are drawn clear. Along the way, there are other significantly stronger oppose reasonings provided by my fellow editors.

And there are as strong, if not stronger, support reasonings, growing in number by the hour.

With all good faith and keeping the candidate's interests in mind, I propose this time-limited RfC for just this RfA (that is, any consensus reached/not reached below will apply just to this RfA and not to future RfAs):
::*'''that crats be allowed to extend this RfA by 24 hours at their discretion;
::*'''that this discretion will not be considered a bureaucratic overreach;
::*'''that any crat will retain the independence to close this RfA at any time after 7 days of !voting are over, irrespective of whether 24 hours extension has been allowed or not.'''

Thanks, [[User talk:Lourdes|<span style="color:blue; background: white">Lourdes 02:49, 12 October 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:People's Party of Canada#rfc_ED02DFC|Talk:People's Party of Canada]] expired 2019-10-13 00:01 ===
* Id: ED02DFC
* User: Helper201
* Date: 2019-10-11 02:36:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|920792888|POL 920792888}}
* RFC Text:

Having "anti-immigration" in the infobox when the party wants to allow 150 000 immigrants per year is deeply intellectually dishonest.
The PPC is anti-mass immigration, here's a source: https://nationalpost.com/pmn/news-pmn/canada-news-pmn/third-party-buys-billboard-to-promote-berniers-anti-mass-immigration-stance
You want to slander the party that's fine but at least try to show some intellectual honesty while doing it.  

Exactly, the PPC is not " anti-immigrant", wikipedia is infected with woke leftists parasites.

Can someone stop Helper201 from vandalizing the page?  

:This is how reliable sources have referred to the party. The linked page for anti-immigration links to the page [[opposition to immigration]], which states in its introduction - 

:'Opposition to immigration ranges from calls for various immigration reforms to proposals to completely restrict immigration to one's nation; these often also include measures to combat immigration of existing citizens'. 

:The party seems to conform at least in part with that description, so the linked page is apt to use here. I'm open to possibly changing what is stated in the infobox to 'anti-mass immigration', however this would likely fall under [[WP:SYNTH]] as this is not what the sources given state. We would need to find sources that state this explicitly, and preferably a third party source stating this, not just a quote from the party leader. I make sure to take a [[Wikipedia:Neutral point of view|neutral]] point of view in my editing and edit pages from across the political spectrum. I am simply adding cited information that is stated by reliable sources. Statements such as 'wikipedia is infected with woke leftists parasites' display a clear point of view. Please also respect [[Wikipedia:Civility]]. [[User:Helper201|Helper201]] ([[User talk:Helper201|talk]]) 02:36, 11 October 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Uber#rfc_DE6DBD5|Talk:Uber]] expired 2019-10-13 10:01 ===
* Id: DE6DBD5
* User: Chilliff
* Date: 2019-10-06 11:53:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|919890478|ECON 919890478}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|921016360|ECON 921016360}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
At the core of the definition of peer-to-peer systems is that there is '''no central stakeholder with power over the platform''', but instead '''peers''' directly coordinate and share resources. For instance, on the wiki page "Peer-to-peer"<ref>https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peer-to-peer</ref> it says: '''"Peers are equally privileged, equipotent participants in the application."'''

This is in complete contrast to how Uber operates: there is one stakeholder - namely Uber - who has almost full command over the platform. It is thus - by orders of magnitude - more privileged and potent than any single rider or driver (or even groups up to a certain size): Uber sets the prices, Uber, if they want, can without problem throw any single rider or driver out of the system, etc. Uber is a classical example of the "gig economy" <ref>https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/pdf/10.1177/1024258916687250</ref>. 

Therefore I propose to remove the term "peer-to-peer" from the introduction. Instead it should simply be described as a ridesharing company<ref>https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ridesharing_company</ref> which provides ride hailing services etc. (as already mentioned in the current intro) - don't you agree? [[User:Chilliff|Chilliff]] ([[User talk:Chilliff|talk]]) 11:53, 6 October 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Transgender#rfc_AF8C87A|Talk:Transgender]] expired 2019-10-13 19:01 ===
* Id: AF8C87A
* User: Gwenhope
* Date: 2019-09-13 18:21:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|915520064|LANG 915520064}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|915520066|SCI 915520066}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|915520071|POL 915520071}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|915520073|SOC 915520073}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|921081080|LANG 921081080}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|921081082|SCI 921081082}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|921081087|POL 921081087}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|921081091|SOC 921081091}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
User {{u|Lmatt}} has [[Talk:Transgender#Definition|proposed many different ways]] in the past view days to write the lead section that merits formal RfC style discussion. As this is a sensitive topic, it is best to get consensus on how to write the lead sentence. The original wording reads {{tq|'''Transgender''' people have a [[gender identity]] or [[gender expression]] that differs from their [[assigned sex]].}}
*'''Option 0''': Original Wording
*'''Option 1''': {{tq|'''Transgender''' is a human [[gender identity]] or [[gender expression]] that contradicts what would be presumed from the [[sex assigned at birth]].}}
*'''Option 2''': {{tq|'''Transgender''' is a human [[gender identity]] or [[gender expression]] that differs from the gender presumed from a person's [[sex assignment at birth]].}}
*'''Option 3''': {{tq|'''Transgender''' is a human [[gender identity]] or [[gender expression]] that contradicts the gender presumed from the [[Sex assignment at birth|sex assigned to a person at birth]].}}
*'''Option 4''': {{tq|'''Transgender''' is a [[gender identity]] or [[gender expression]] of a person that is incongruent with the gender culturally associated with their [[assigned sex]].}}
*'''Option 5''': {{tq|'''Transgender''' individuals have a [[gender identity]] and/or [[gender expression]] that is not culturally associated with their [[Sex assignment at birth|assigned gender or sex]].}} (proposed by {{u|Gwenhope}})
*'''Option 6''':{{tq|'''Transgender''' people have a [[gender identity]] or [[gender expression]] that differs from their [[sex assigned at birth]].}}

Please list your preferred option(s) below or feel free to propose a new option. [[User:Gwenhope|'''<span style="color:darkorchid">Gwen&nbsp;Hope</span>''']] ([[User_talk:Gwenhope|talk]]) ([[Special:Contributions/Gwenhope|contrib]]) 18:21, 13 September 2019 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style#rfc_5D30F85|Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style]] expired 2019-10-16 01:01 ===
* Id: 5D30F85
* User: Robert McClenon
* Date: 2019-09-16 00:52:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|915922129|LANG 915922129}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|915922134|STYLE 915922134}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|915922139|POLICY 915922139}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|921488559|LANG 921488559}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|921488564|STYLE 921488564}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|921488566|POLICY 921488566}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This issue has to do with the sorting of surnames that are preceded by prefixes known as particles, such as ''de'' or ''von''.  The rules for sorting of surnames are complex and depend on the customs of the nationality.  The question is whether names should be sorted based on the national origin of the surname, or the nationality of the person.  An example is Luann de Lesseps, an American socialite and reality TV personality, whose surname is that of her French nobleman husband.  Should she be alphabetized as:
'''A'''.  de Lesseps, Luann (nationality of person, American)  
or
'''B'''.  Lesseps, Luann de (national origin of name, French)
or
'''C'''.  It depends.  If so, specify what it depends on.

Enter your !votes with a brief statement as '''A''' or '''B'''.  Enter any back-and-forth comments in the Threaded Discussion.
[[User:Robert McClenon|Robert McClenon]] ([[User talk:Robert McClenon|talk]]) 00:52, 16 September 2019 (UTC)}}

Regarding [[User:ThecentreCZ|ThecentreCZ]]'s nonsensical rejection of updating the logo. 

Directly from Wikipedia's policy on non-free logos:  "It is believed that the use of low-resolution images on the English-language Wikipedia, hosted on servers in the United States by the non-profit Wikimedia Foundation, of logos for certain uses involving identification and critical commentary may qualify as fair use under the Copyright law of the United States." I did not make up that non-free logos should be low res you are simply just ignorant on the topic.
